Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Figure 1 Overview

Figure 1’s mission is to democratize medical knowledge and improve the future of healthcare. Our platform is valued by healthcare professionals and leading institutions worldwide, and trusted on a daily basis by our community as a quick, easy, and secure way to share and consume medical knowledge.

At Figure 1, we will work hard to understand our users and the value our product offers them. We will constantly seek their feedback in order to continue to provide the most innovative, easy-to-use platform that helps them sharpen their skills and improve the lives of their patients.

“It is impossible to know everything in medicine. But with Figure 1’s knowledge-sharing platform, it’s easy for healthcare professionals to come close.”

Core Company Values

At Figure 1, we work as a team and individually to:

Look out for one another in order to help lift up the skills and capabilities of our colleagues
Set a good example and constantly strive to positively influence others
Always be learning, and share what you learn
Prioritize the business and celebrate successes as a team

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Reports To: VP, Marketing

Job Description:
Help shape the future of our analytics and data infrastructure.
Take multiple disparate sets of data and provide the organization with valuable insights that will inform and drive product, marketing, and business decisions.
Refine what we measure, how we interpret, and use that data to drive organizational change.
Using 3rd party tools, transform raw data into meaningful insights informed by best practices in data governance and analytical techniques.
Work with individual teams to enhance their use of data to improve efficiencies and you'll continually teach what you learn to others.

Must Have Skills:
5+ years of working experience navigating relational databases via SQL, NoSQL architectures, and flat log files alike
Ability to write complex SQL queries, highly proficient in concepts like subqueries, temp tables, and window functions
Experience merging data from different sources to come up with unified models
A track record of successfully navigating messy database schemas to produce analytics that drives organizational change, including multi-touch attribution models, cohort analysis, slice & dice techniques, segmentation, etc.
Expert knowledge in digital metrics, dimensions, and KPIs - drive consistency in how metrics are defined, pulled and utilized
Expert knowledge of data visualization, with experience building BI dashboards in tools such as Tableau, Periscope Data, Mixpanel, or other similar platforms
Expert knowledge in Excel
Experience communicating complex analyses, data-heavy insights, and recommendations verbally and visually to the team at large with a simple, clear story
Experience working independently as an internal service provider to deliver results to multiple stakeholders, including the Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Business Development teams
Some experience with scripting languages such as Python is preferred

What We Offer:
Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
Extended healthcare benefits
Stock options
Opportunities for professional development
One-on-ones focused on mentorship
Supportive parental leave policy
The chance to help save lives and make the world a better place

Period of Employment: This is a full-time permanent role with a 3-month probationary period.

Job Location: Toronto

To Apply: To be considered, please submit a resume and cover letter at https://figure1.bamboohr.com/hiring/jobs/89

Figure 1 is a diverse, inclusive, open-minded workplace. Candidates who identify as minority are encouraged to apply. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities, and accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or national origin.

Title: Product Owner - Data and Business Intelligence
Description:
Our client is one of the country's leading providers of health benefits management services and is looking for Product Owner for their Data Analytics and Reporting Solutions team.
Below are the details of the role: -
Duration - 4-5 Months +
Description -
Reporting directly to the Sr. Manager of Data Analytics, the Product Owner’s primary role will be to define and launch new Reporting Solutions
Product Owner will collaborate with cross-functional teams to define product solutions and will work closely with internal business users and external carriers to understand and articulate business requirements to define applicable product features.
This role involves developing a clear understanding of the end user reporting needs and prioritizing based on the development efforts.
The Product Owner will work closely with Delivery Manager and Data Engineering teams to plan and coordinate release cycles and product increments.
Experience working with databases and reporting platforms is a must.
Facilitate workshops and discussions with clients to understand reporting needs
Prioritize enhancements and defects in the backlog for implementation within a release cycle
Work with the Delivery Manager(s) and Data Engineering teams to plan and coordinate releases and ensure operational readiness
Provide guidance and direction to Business Analyst
Oversee and contribute to QA and testing processes
Support functional areas, in the maintenance and enhancement of existing products and provide business and product knowledge
Knowledge of the Pharmacy or Group Health Insurance (pharmacy, dental, other health) industry or adjudication systems
Knowledge of the various types of business intelligence, data and reporting products (e.g. multi-dimensional cubes, parameterized reports, dashboards, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Strong analytical skills ranging from problem identification through the proposal and implementation of potential solutions
Experience in data warehouse environments and/or denormalized data models
SQL skills are essential
Knowledge of programming concepts, design, procedures and practices
Strong communication skills, written and verbal
Able to demonstrate a range of collaborative methodologies and processes, preferably in an Agile environment
Strong knowledge of SDLC processes in relation to the Product Development Lifecycle (PDL)
Must have Enhanced Reliability Security Clearance or must be eligible to apply for it.
___________________________________________________________________________
To apply for this role email hiren.joshi@roberthalf.com or call 416-227-0581 EXT 61813

Product Owner

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
As the world’s number one distributor of heating, plumbing, industrial, and waterworks supplies, we know that talented people are essential to maintaining our success in the future.
Wolseley Canada provides an environment where employees can take their skills, talents, experience and interests to the next level to grow professionally and build rewarding careers.
Wolseley Canada offers many challenging and diverse career opportunities in our local branch networks and throughout our Regional and Corporate offices across Canada.
We are driven to achieve results, collaborate with each other to determine the best course of action, hold ourselves accountable at all times and demonstrate resilience when new challenges come our way.
Does this sound like you? Do you want to make a difference and grow your career? If so, then come join our talented and high performing team.

Position Overview
As a Business Intelligence Analyst you will own select projects and analytics with the ability to frame how to best approach such responsibilities and interacting directly with business partners at various levels throughout the organization to derive key business implications from analytics and research. The Business Intelligence Analyst must have critical thinking capabilities that can be used in data processing, advanced analytics, applied statistics, process optimization, and report prototyping and deployment. Proficient data extraction with the ability to synthesize information to see the big picture and summarizing analytics and research according to the audience. You will be responsible to help build out BI Technologies, a Business Intelligence Centre of Excellence, support colleagues throughout the entire organization and translate business questions into executable data driven analytics. You will contribute to the design, development and support of our databases and data marts. You will also contribute to transforming Wolseley Canada’s BI data to cloud solutions.
Key Accountabilities
Prototype, deploy and support revenue and customer-related analytics and executive dashboards
Support Business with guidance and consultancy in all matters relating to Business Intelligence, Analytics, and Reporting
Responsible for requirement analysis, design, development, and deployment of our business intelligence and analytical solutions
Understanding stake-holders business requirements and transforming the requirements into a meaningful representation using BI tools
Performing quality assurance testing and ensuring our solutions deliver business value to stakeholders
Automate manual processes
Serving as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for BI related inquiries
Maintain all standard and customized reports using BI tools
Maintain technical and user documentation for BI solutions
Collaborate with team members to develop quality databases and datamarts for business use
Review, evaluate, develop and maintain business intelligence systems including: dimension and fact tables, validation tools and processes, user monitoring and security
Document data flow and design
Establishing and maintaining BI best practices and standards
Contribute to an engaging and fun atmosphere by being driven to see the end result of what the team is accomplishing

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Salary: Based on experience
Full-time position
Summary of Role:
The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst’s purpose is to support the WTC Winnipeg in maturing the organization’s use of data as it seeks to grow opportunities for Manitoba companies that are seeking to grow globally, producing measurement and meaningful economic impacts within the province and globally.
Working directly with the Director of Business Intelligence, the BI Analyst will support the identification of business challenges and outcomes where the use of data analytics will enhance existing or create new value. This may include the elicitation of stakeholder requirements, blueprinting and design of conceptual solutions, development of those solutions, and expansion of value from those solutions as new requirements and opportunities emerge.
This role will provide the successful candidate with the opportunity to further expand their skills and knowledge in business intelligence while working in a supportive environment as we work to bring economic success and resiliency to Manitoba and the entrepreneurial organizations that are born here.
The responsibilities of the successful candidate:
Planning Support
· Working with the Director of Business Intelligence, develop long-term strategic objectives for the use of data in fulfilling the purpose of the WTC Winnipeg. This includes working with stakeholders internally and externally to ensure the alignment of business outcomes with the to-be established data objectives.
· Supports the integration of initiative planning into the overall objectives of the WTC Winnipeg and provides tactical expertise on the implementation of BI-related initiatives.
· Supports the WTC Winnipeg in viewing data as an asset through the establishment of data governance fundamentals to support the identification, collection, and use of data within the WTC Winnipeg, ensuring data parity, integrity, and quality are preserved.
· Identifies new trends and technologies that may allow the WTC Winnipeg to expand the value created by data analytics.
Solution Operations
· Actively participates on projects and initiatives related to the implementation and sustainment of BI and data-related solutions.
· Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs. This will include various integrations to and from centralized data storage solutions.
· Based on inputs from stakeholders, develops and provides reports and insights from available data sources in a manner consumable by non-technical audiences.
· Assist in the design of databases and data warehouses to ensure interoperability with BI solutions and support the evolution of those solutions based on emerging business needs.
· Analyze user requirements and, based on findings, design functional specifications for BI front-end applications and reports, implementing those solutions fully.
· Supports the definition of ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system.
· Develops and applies testing methods to solutions, ensuring reliable performance and the accuracy of outputs.
· Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary.
Necessary Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
· College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information systems, or computer engineering.
· Formal education or professional development in business intelligence or data analytics would be desirable.
· Minimum of two (2) to five (5) years direct work experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role.
· Intermediate ability to develop SQL scripts and queries to enable the extraction and manipulation of data from multiple sources.
· Foundational understanding of .NET, Java, and/or Python would be considered a strong asset.
· Ability to analyze user requirements and build front-end BI applications according to specifications.
· Experience working with data warehouse analysis and design, with foundational knowledge of data warehouse methodologies and data modeling techniques.
· Experience working with cloud-based data analytic solutions based on the Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services platforms would be desirable.
· Familiarity with ETL toolsets would be desirable.
· Natural desire and ability to analyze, conceptualize, and develop technical solutions that support the resolution of business challenges.
· Driven curiosity to learn and expand knowledge of technical solutions and emerging trends which can add value to an entire organization and external stakeholders.
· Ability to take highly technical information and present it to non-technical audiences.
· Ability to self-direct work while also understanding when to ask for support.
· Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
· Proficiency in both of Canada’s official languages is a job skill sought
Application deadline: 2020-11-23
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Company events
Dental care
Disability insurance
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Language:
English (Required)
Français (Required)

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Aleafia Health brings Canadians medical cannabis care through nationwide clinics, world-class cultivation and distribution facilities, and innovative research.
This Business Intelligence Analyst is an intellectually curious, collaborative BI professional that that has the ability to work on multiple ongoing projects with competing priorities. This role requires exceptional attention to detail, a results oriented and analytical mentality and the ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to provide business intelligence and business analytics requests.
This position will support other locations and some inter-site travel will be required.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Collaborating with various departments and personnel to provide innovative technology solutions to resolve growing intelligence and analytical needs. This includes understanding and analyzing business problems and working to solve those problems by addressing people, process and technology gaps.
Continue to build out an improve upon existing data warehouse, including creating additional data sources and integrations with existing systems.
Design, develop, test and support operational and financial reporting and/or dashboard solutions including implementation of Microsoft Power BI Visualizations.
Execute and deliver continuous improvement programs for all data management, business intelligence and business analytics processes.
Implement best practices and policies for data analysis, data modelling, and data management.
Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement innovative solutions including required reports, dashboards and analysis.
Provide key business insights to drive business value in accordance with the Company's strategic objectives.
Utilize project management best practices when executing business projects and initiatives. Effectively manage project resources and be able to plan, execute, control and close projects against defined scope and budget.
ROLE REQUIREMENTS/ABILITIES
Experience / Education
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or other related field
Strong understanding of ETL, data warehousing and big data principles
Expert user of Microsoft Power BI & DAX
Minimum 2 year’s experience working with databases and developing complex queries, stored procedures and functions using technologies such as SQL server
Skills & Abilities
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment
Advanced level MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Deadline oriented with strong ability to multi-task
Superior communication skills (written & verbal)
Ability to work in a team and independently with competing priorities
Quick learner and well organized with superior attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to lead multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines
Working Environment
Busy office environment
Indoors
Verbal & written communication with people (internal & external)
Note: The chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete reference checks and a criminal background check.
We appreciate the interest by all candidates however we will be contacting those that best fit the requirements. If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform Human Resources of any accommodations you may require. Aleafia Health will work with you in an effort to ensure that you are able to fully participate in the process.

Title: Advisor, Business Intelligence Data Acquisition and Analysis
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-09
Advisor, Business Intelligence Data Acquisition and Analysis, you help develop and use tools and methods to collect, compile, model and restore the organization’s physical and non-physical data to establish governance, help decisionmakers understand the big picture and inform decisions.

You advise and assist clients and partners as part of intervention and development initiatives. You recommend solutions to improve or optimize standards, policies and programs. Your projects and initiatives require extensive knowledge of your line of work.

You prepare recommendations, solutions and action plans based on the organization’s objectives and priorities. You help solve complex problems using your analytical skills and extensive knowledge of your line of business. Coordination is critical, so you frequently interact with stakeholders working in other fields. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.
Main responsibilities
Collect user needs in terms of metrics and indicators.
See to the development and enhancement of performance indicators.
Produce the documentation required for managing data.
Help design and model data to enhance the Operations Services Management Division's data warehouse.
Identify and resolve inconsistencies and/or issues related to dashboards.
Monitor and update performance indicators in line with established standards, controls and schedules.
Make sure users properly interpret the results.
Other working conditions
Number of job available : 1
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in information technology, business intelligence, engineering, administration, mathematics and statistics, or a relevant field
At least 4 years of relevant experience with reporting tools (PowerBI, Cognos, Tableau or other) and in a business intelligence, strategic information, analysis or related environment
Master's degree in a relevant field (an asset)

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
AMA:
YOU LIVE BY THE MOTTO: knowledge IS POWER.

Posted: 2020-09-02
Closing: Until Filled
Location: Edmonton South

Just like Indiana Jones, you love digging for information. You can whip up analytical reports faster than Indy can find himself in trouble. You have a knack for data and details and sharing what you’ve discovered in a way that makes it easy for people to understand. You’re fluent in Power BI and Highcharts and don’t need to reference Indy’s diary to help you make heads or tails of the information you discover. You work well with a broad group of people and communicate clearly every step of the way. We like that about you!

WHAT MOVES YOU
You know the key to building strong relationships is being a great listener.
You’re comfortable collaborating with people from all levels of the organization to accomplish common goals.
You have a knack for quickly understanding business unit goals and linking them to standardized analytical products that can be easily used across the organization.
You don’t need anyone to light a fire under you; you know what needs doing and get it done.
You’re a stickler for details and accuracy and have an uncanny ability to get your hands on the right information quickly.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Report to the Manager, Business Intelligence.
Develop highly effective and visually pleasing analytical products such as marketing segmentations, churn analysis, member profiles, etc., in such a way that it’s easily consumed by the business.
Build BI reports in Power BI based around internal stakeholder needs.
Respond to internal, field and vendor requests for information regarding products.
Consult with stakeholders on options to modify or enhance analytical products; identify themes based on requests and raise them with management.
Design performance metrics, reporting formats and dashboards.
Ongoing development and enhancements of impactful dashboards, reports, and products to effectively enable insights and business decisions.
Develop in-depth knowledge and understanding of business strategy, financial goals, processes, and requirements across multiple business lines.
Determine requirements, define key performance indicators, and develop BI solutions to business problems by regularly communicating with executives, business and operational leaders, and subject matter experts.

WHAT YOU’VE DONE
You have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, business management, specialized training/certification, or equivalent work experience.
You’re no newbie. You have 5-7 years of Business Analysis or related technical experience – on this we must insist.
You’ll get bonus points if you have experience with Microsoft Power BI and/or Agile/Scrum.
You’re an expert when it comes to using data analysis technology and language (SQL, Python, DAX, SSRS, BI tools).
You can analyze and interpret data and do queries from multiple data sources (SQL< SQL Sparks) with one hand tied behind your back.

WHAT YOU'LL GET
Competitive salary.
Flexible benefits.
Outstanding employer-paid Pension Plan.
Great AMA discounts.
Unlimited learning opportunities.
Paid vacation and floater day.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - 18 Month Term
Description:
Powered by state-of-the-art fibre optic and wireless networks, Eastlink delivers world-class video entertainment and communications services to residential, business and public sector customers across Canada. As one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 11 consecutive years, Eastlink provides high speed Internet, wireless, TV, telephone, security and automation, data communications and exclusive, locally-produced programming. Headquartered in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Eastlink is the largest privately owned telecommunications Company in Canada with an employee base of just over 1500 individuals.

We’re currently seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our BI & Data Analytics team. Reporting to our Manager, BI & Data Analytics, you will participate in Business Intelligence initiatives including the creation of data-driven solutions to deliver business insights, improve business intelligence and enable better decisions to drive growth.

What sets Eastlink apart?
Business Intelligence within the Telecommunications industry is unmatched by any other industry in terms of data and complexities.
You will be working with a locally owned and operated company that is constantly evolving and will provide the challenges and inspiration for someone who is truly passionate about developing their career in Business Intelligence.
What makes you an ideal candidate?

As the ideal candidate you have relevant post-secondary education coupled with professional experience focused in business intelligence and analytics. Self-driven, you are resourceful individual who is able to take initiative and has a thirst for knowledge. You are proficient in SQL and business intelligence tools such as Microsoft SQL Server (SSIS, SSRS, and SSAS). You have the ability to react quickly to changing conditions and requirements and can balance priorities effectively in a dynamic, results driven environment.

Eastlink is focused on creating an environment which promotes individual growth and career satisfaction. Creativity, entrepreneurial spirit and innovation drive us. We’re looking for people who have the passion for our business, our values and want to go above and beyond for our customers every day.

Dedicated to representing all of the customers we serve, we embrace diversity throughout all levels of the organization and encourage members of equity groups to self-identify during the application process.

If you’re ready to take on this exciting opportunity, please apply today.

Title: Scrum Master – Business Intelligence Solutions – Members
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-09
As Scrum Master, you will help carry out cross-sector projects to meet objectives on time and on budget. You will help the Scrum team implement and use the Agile approach on a daily basis for major projects. You will act as a custodian of respect for Agile values and principles. You will promote the engagement of the squad’s stakeholders to deliver projects as planned and foster the group’s self-organization. You will ensure that the barriers encountered are handled so as to protect the squad from disruptive external elements. As such, your ability to engage others will be an essential skill.

You will advise and coach dedicated clients and partners in connection with key intervention and development mandates in an Agile mode delivery context. Your projects and initiatives will require extensive knowledge of your line of work.

You will develop recommendations, solutions and action plans in line with the organization’s orientations and objectives. You will help the team solve complex problems that require analysis and in-depth understanding of the line of business. Coordination is critical, and you will interact with various stakeholders who work in complementary fields of expertise.
Main responsibilities
Help the Scrum team implement and use the Agile approach for major projects.
Assemble and assist the project’s Scrum team and facilitate meetings. Ensure that both the individuals responsible for the product/process and the project team understand and carry out their respective roles in a satisfactory manner.
Ensure that the Scrum team is functional, productive and well organized. Ensure efficient use of the Agile approach and tools, as well as compliance with Agile values. Establish and monitor performance indicators.
Ensure transparency on the status of work progress. Deal with and follow up on problems raised by the team.
Ensure the consistency of sprint backlog tasks with the commitments undertaken on the functionality of the product backlog.
Help the product owner maximize return on investment, meet objectives and manage the product backlog.
Handle quality control for the product backlog and various meetings (sprint planning meeting, maintenance and product backlog estimation sessions, and sprint review).
Other working conditions
Number of job available : 1
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
At least four years of relevant experience, including a minimum of one to two years as a scrum master for a squad
Experience with the continuous software development and rollout cycle (an asset)
Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
Agile certification: PSM/CSM (an asset)
For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required
Specific knowledge
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence (an asset)

Communicates effectively, Engagement, Interpersonal Savvy

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst - Branded Content (Engl...
Description:
Job Family Revenue
Primary Location Montreal
Position Language Requirement Bilingual (English / French)
Language Skill Level (Reading) C
Language Skill Level (Writing) B
Language Skill Level (Speaking) C
Status of Employment Permanent
Work schedule(s) Full-time

Why work at CBC/Radio-Canada?
When you come to CBC/Radio-Canada, you’re not only joining the undisputed leader in expressing Canadian culture – you’re also participating in its digital revolution. Here, you’ll actively contribute to creating innovative projects on our major platforms and will find a stimulating, state-of-the-art and team-focused work environment.

What will your role be?

The Media Solutions Group at CBC/Radio-Canada is looking for a driven and passionate Senior Business Analyst responsible for performing multi-platform business analysis, with an emphasis on devising effective digital content solutions for advertising clients.
Reporting to the Managing Editor, Content Marketing (or Content Strategist – Media Creativity, if based in Montreal), you will be in charge of providing research, analytical support for branded content strategies, including but not limited to market research, field audits, benchmarking and best practices. You will also provide data that helps dictate revenue maximization strategies related to branded content and custom partnerships with advertisers. You will mine data insights from CBC editorial and sponsored content performance to inform content solution recommendations for advertising clients. You will support new business development efforts through different initiatives. You will analyze certain research streams and synthesize into clear, relevant results.

You will analyze the performance of content campaigns across all distribution channels (broadcast, digital, social,) and implement changes in the design of content marketing solutions and the media strategies to promote them to yield better performance of advertiser partnerships. You will establish performance KPIs and benchmarks for branded content and assess CBC’s campaigns against these, offering insights to help content perform better. You will collaborate with Content Marketing management to set the optimal pricing strategies. You will monitor and analyze the revenue associated with CBC branded content partnerships in collaboration with finance and provide estimates for future planning.

Please, note that under the current conditions we are working remotely, but in the context of this position, you can work from Montreal or Toronto, as soon as the situation is back to normal. Hence, this position is based either in Toronto or Montreal.

We are looking for a candidate with the following:
Post-secondary degree or diploma, and/or 4+ years equivalent data insights experience
Good understanding of digital content strategy and the digital advertising industry
Experience in editorial and content production, an asset
Initiative and strong attention to details, inquisitive and strong problem-solving skills
Ability to analyse data and turn it into actionable insights
Comfortable with innovation and change
Team player
Interested in working at a fast-paced, intellectually challenging work environment
Familiarity with content analytics software as Adobe, Amplitude, Chartbeat, Moat Content Analytics, an asset
Experience with MOAT, Social Media, Podcasting, GAM, Programmatic and Data Management Platforms (DMP) is an asset
Proficient using Microsoft Office products & Google Suite, and a high propensity to pick up new computer programs such as our in-house systems
Ability to create a variety of reports, analysis and recommendations and communicate them to various stakeholders including Sales, Marketing, Content, Ad Ops, Ad Tech, Digital Products and Communications
Ability to multitask and set priorities
Bilingualism (English and French), both spoken and written
Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.

If this sounds interesting, please click on ''Apply online''. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected will be contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence & Innovation Engineer
Description:
Key mandates
Produce, maintain and interpret data models, reports and dashboards.
Collaborating with business users to understand their BI & data challenges and being able to solve those challenges by leveraging business systems and technology
Train & enable users on self service BI fundamentals
Serve as a technical expert providing input to application design regarding environment, tuning, and administration requirements
Participate in Proof of Concept or Proof of Technology projects to evaluate BI technologies and platforms.
Key Responsibilities
Produce specialized reporting packages, dashboards and scorecards
Introduce, educate, and pilot new technologies that can directly drive value to our company
Develop comprehensive frameworks for reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, tools and external data sources
Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting
Develop meaningful and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing reporting packages
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop value-added reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
Adopt, implement and effectively evolve report automation standards
Identify, recommend and execute opportunities to eliminate or consolidate existing reports and leverage existing report usage tracking data
Work in a consultative role to provide “value added” insights in the form of analysis, visualizations, interpretation and advice
Liaise with business stakeholders to conduct effective discussions on project/reporting needs, data specifications, priority and timeline to ensure timely and accurate deliveries
Ensure the creation and ongoing maintenance of documentation for key BI & Reporting processes and deliverables
Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, and implement process improvements
Stay knowledgeable on emerging issues, trends, and evolving regulatory requirements and assess potential impacts to the credit rating industry.
Experience
Minimum of 5 years of practical hands on experience with SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, DOMO
Data extraction, transformation and load, building custom report views in SQL.
Self-motivated team player with a strong work ethic and the ability to multi-task with changing priorities
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Proven ability to translate business requirements into technological solutions/capabilities
Ability to present ideas/solutions to peers and clients, as well as assist in development of presentations, demonstrations, POC/POT work.
Ability to work under tight deadlines and pressure
Strong customer service orientation and highly self‐motivated and directed
Financial Industry experience (plus).
Experience with other BI tool sets such as Datameer, Alteryx would be considered an asset
Qualifications
Bachelors and/or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent experience.
5+ years of IT and business/industry work experience
ITIL certifications are a plus
Proven ability to interact across all levels of organization
About Us
DBRS Morningstar is a global credit ratings business, currently with 700 employees in eight offices globally. Formed through the July 2019 acquisition of DBRS by Morningstar, Inc., the ratings business is the fourth-largest provider of credit ratings in the world.
DBRS Morningstar is committed to empowering investor success, serving the market through leading-edge technology and raising the bar for the industry. DBRS Morningstar is a market leader in Canada, the U.S. and Europe in multiple asset classes.
DBRS Morningstar rates more than 2,600 issuers and 54,000 securities worldwide and is driven to bringing more clarity, diversity of opinion, and responsiveness to the ratings process. DBRS Morningstar’s approach and size provide the agility to respond to customers’ needs, while being large enough to provide the necessary expertise and resources.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Full-time

The Business Intelligence Analytics position have been created to address client’s demand for analytical insights that ultimately drives action based decision-making. The Business Intelligence Analyst will help write financial reports and analysis reports, trouble shoot financial applications and aid in acquisition related activities such as data conversions. none required

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
(200227)
Job Summary
Are you a bold, quick-thinking and driven individual seeking the growth and challenge that comes from working with collaborative teams for a dynamic company? Are you intrinsically passionate as a change agent, influencer of growth and have the desire to "move the needle?" If you feel satisfaction at seeing your team's ideas and dreams become reality and answered yes to any of these questions, we want to hear from you! The Plan Operations Analytics Group at HOOPP (Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan) is looking for an experienced individual to fill a permanent, fulltime Senior Business Intelligence Analyst role for the Analytics Team. The team delivers insights, analytics, reporting, data governance and subject matter expertise in data warehouse knowledge.
The team's principles are focused on delivering true stakeholder value in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. They value challenging the status quo, innovative solutions, team collaboration and practicality.

Roles and Responsibilities
Strategic Reporting
Provides strategic reporting such as forecasts, projections and high-level overview as well as operational (e.g. processing or phone statistics) reporting to management
Provides daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual or ad hoc reporting as required by utilizing standard reports or builds. Extracts data from sources such as data warehouse, as well as converts operation-specific data into reports.
Develop broad subject matter expertise in data and perform an in-depth analysis of data to gather insights and communicate results.
Provides business intelligence support and data solutions to all areas of HOOPP as required by analysis and communication, acting on requests for data and reporting information. Contributes to the structure of databases, drafting of queries, compiling of CRM operational type business intelligence to all departments.
Provides statistical analysis and interpretation in clear user language on data information and provide written summary reporting as well as communication on that analysis. Ability to synthesize large datasets into clear actionable decision-making for presentation to Management.
Facilitates the integration of multiple data sources (data warehouse, portals, dashboards, reports, systems) into specific solutions to answer reporting needs using all relevant data. This to meet HOOPP's immediate and future information needs in collaboration with IT.
Creates develops and maintains business intelligence platforms.
Qualifications
Who You Are:
Analytical
Excellent facilitator and interviewer (able to pull out deeper business needs & usage patterns)
Understands the why (curious, asks probing questions, digs deep, open-minded)
Ability to create clarity and get everyone on the same page
Visual in nature including comfortable whiteboarding complex data models and data flow
Excellent Requirements documentation (clear, concise)
Has strong trust and confidence in team and business. Is the GO-TO person for the details.
Agility
Ability to anticipate 'surprises' early on (and change course/mitigate)
Able to recommend solutions to the business problem and think outside of the box by being creative.
Ability to break features into small chunks (that can be delivered on a weekly basis)
Decision making
Quick, nimble, light-footed in all aspects of solution delivery
Ability to make decisions without all the information available (work in ambiguity)
Self-motivated, highly focused, ability to deliver with little to no direction
Ability to move forward without everything being solved
Ability to overcome obstacles
A positive attitude - can take negatives and turn it into a solution
Teamwork
Strong 1:1 working experience with Analysts, business leaders, stakeholders and management.
Provides honest, constructive feedback in an empathetic manner
Identifying and engaging in difficult conversations; Ability to table conflict or team tensions
Ability to improve Team Norms/processes by influencing
Able and comfortable in working with all levels of management to understand, and when needed negotiate requirements and priorities
Solid communication skills to interact across organizations and offer insights to the business.
Background in mathematics, data analytics and reporting technologies
Solid experience in data analysis and reporting; experience in the pension industry is preferred
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management or related field
Knowledge of Excel, R, Python and MS SQL Server; familiarity with business intelligence tools specifically Power BI
Knowledge of relational database structures and applications.
Competency in agile software development
Notice for job applicants

Following the advice of Canadian health authorities, to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing, all recruiting activities including interviews and new hire onboarding will be conducted online. While we are doing our best to ensure reasonable response times, please expect some delays during the recruiting process due to the current situation. Thank you for your patience and understanding during these challenging times.

For additional information on our adjusted recruitment process, please email us at hrinbox@hoopp.com.
About HOOPP

Established in 1960, the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) is a multi-employer defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's hospital and community-based healthcare sector. We serve more than 381,000 members who provide valued healthcare services at more than 590 employers across the province. At HOOPP, we exist to provide a stable and reliable pension for our members that starts in retirement and is paid for life. As one of Canada's largest and most respected pension plans, HOOPP's net assets reached $94.1 billion at the end of 2019 and our funded status remained strong and stable at 119%.

HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide our every interaction with our members, employers and employees. We've become one of Canada's leading pension plans by consistently challenging ourselves and embracing innovation.
From our unique investment management approach to our innovative technology and thought-provoking research, we constantly seek to push the boundaries, and we do this by hiring passionate, forward-thinking people.

Our high-performance culture is founded on collaboration, respect and belonging. HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer and we're proud of our diversity. We select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Human Resources team. We will be happy to consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.
Primary Location Toronto
Job Pension Services
Employee Status Permanent
Job Type Standard
Schedule Full-time

Title: Adjunct Instructor - Business Intelligence Program
Description:
Adjunct Instructor - Business Intelligence Program
SAIT is a global leader in applied education and an institution that empowers employees to make a difference in the lives of our students.
Building on more than a century of history, we are looking for innovative employees wanting to create a future with us. As part of our team, you are encouraged to be bold and inventive, bringing new ideas to the table. Change excites you.
Along with gourmet on-campus restaurants run by our culinary program and an unparalleled view of downtown Calgary, SAIT offers the chance to do work with a purpose — preparing the next generation of industry leaders, entrepreneurs, advocates and explorers. We develop leaders in the classroom and our workspaces, encouraging lifelong learning for both students and employees.
Your future starts now … at SAIT.
The Opportunity
The School of Information and Communications Technologies has an immediate requirement for an adjunct instructor for short periods of time to teach a number of courses within the Business Intelligence Fast-Track program. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology and will engage our students in the ever-changing world of information technology.
The Role
Reporting to the Academic Chair, this position requires knowledge and skills to instruct in:
Required:
Microsoft SQL Server database
A combination (some but not all) of the following areas is also necessary:
Database Concepts and T-SQL
Business Analysis for BI
Database Architecture and Design
Data Analysis
Data Reporting
ETL
Tableau
Power BI
It is expected that the instructor will:
Provide ongoing support, guidance and advice to learners
Prepare additional study and lab materials for learners
Use a variety of instructional techniques to promote learning and personal development
Show personal interest in the learner and create a climate conducive to optimal learning
Manage the classroom or lab to the benefit of the learners

Minimum of 3-5 years related experience in information technology
Previous post-secondary education in a related field, or industry training.
Previous teaching or training experience would be an asset.
Why Work at SAIT
Enjoy a stimulating work environment and a beautiful campus overlooking downtown Calgary.
To Apply
Please continue with the online application process by clicking the Apply Now button
All applications should be made through our online system.
Notes
SAIT is committed to equity and diversity within its community and invites applications from all qualified applicants.

For information on the collection and use of your personal information, please see our Privacy Policy

In order to ensure and maintain a safe and secure working and learning environment, all applicants to the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology must complete and pass a police security clearance before employment is confirmed. Employment is conditional until a satisfactory police security clearance is obtained and confirmed. Employment with SAIT will not commence until the results have been provided and confirmed.
SAIT’s vision is to be a global leader in applied education

Title: Director Business Intelligence and Portfolio Insights
Description:
Requisition ID: 91467
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Purpose of Job:
The Director, Business Intelligence & Portfolio Insights, Secured Lending, GRM will monitor key risk performance of the Retail Automotive and Residential Mortgage portfolios, and contribute to the development and enhancement of business intelligence tools in addition to providing actionable insight to the Policy & Governance and Strategy Risk teams as well as product and business line partners. The role is highly technical and requires expert SAS/Python, data analytics and BI tools knowledge, as well as ability to optimize and maximize efficiency of existing processes. The incumbent will deliver strategic analysis to senior management while working with multiple stakeholders and partners to facilitate development of Risk-Reward opportunities. He/She will develop optimal analytical methodologies to assess the growth opportunities, and monitor results.
Job Resposibilities:
Credit Risk Portfolio Tracking:
Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (ex. SAS, Python, Tableau) to provide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in GRM and business lines. Lead new report creation and look for opportunities to optimize work stream.
Provide actionable insights and meaningful messages from the reporting to drive credit risk decisions. Able to tell a story by synthesizing vast amounts of data into coherent messages.
Proactively provide strategic analysis that will assist in optimizing risk rewards ratios and grow the portfolios
Collaborate with Strategy and Policy teams to provide measurement and reporting on strategic initiatives such as acquisition dynamics and quality, loan amount optimization and collections effectiveness
Analyze strategy effectiveness , leverage champion/challenger capabilities to confirm assumptions and recommend changes, identify if any credit risks are or will become in excess of the risk appetite framework and make recommendations on how to mitigate.
Data Strategy:
Creation and maintenance of data infrastructure
Collaborate with GRM Analytics and Technology key stakeholders and partners to consolidate secured portfolios data on Enterprise Data Lake
Implement solutions for data cleansing, data discovery, data lineage, automation and self-service of data
Partner with GRM Analytics and Technology to explore data mining, visualization, and extraction tools to further improve reporting transparency and time to action.
Support Business Line Initiatives/Projects:
Ensure all business line strategic priorities (i.e. automotive and RESL lending growth) are consistent with Provisioning and the Risk Appetite Framework.
To support the business line and other stakeholders, participate in projects for Automotive Finance and RESL programs. This includes the review of business cases, risk proposals, requirements documents and liaising with the appropriate groups throughout the organization that will assist in protecting the Bank’s interests and maximize prudent lending opportunities.
Leveraging their strong knowledge of the Automotive and Residential Mortgage segments, proactively research and identify opportunities and recommend changes to business line strategies to ensure the Bank does not take on more credit risk than planned, while maximizing lending opportunities.
Automotive & RESL Competitive Landscape:
Maintain strong segment knowledge by remaining current on the competitive landscape, partnering with the business line to ensure that as risk managers our processes, strategies and policies consider the changing landscape (Canadian/International).
Canadian Economic Environment:
Leverage data from Scotiabank Economics and Risk Analytics for competitor performance and employment rates; informing the business line and preparing for headwinds as required.
Due Diligence:
As required participate on due diligences to assess the new portfolio, current and future performance, and integration complexities.
Team leadership:
Provide strong leadership to direct reports to motivate both individual and team performance and foster a commitment to Scotiabank’s Values and our Customers.
Recruit high potential management candidates.
Develop staff by sharing knowledge/experience and provide opportunities for staff to share responsibility for achieving bank and department objectives/goals.
Contribute to the success of the Global Retail Credit Risk Department.
Job Requirements:
10+ years with an organization in the risk/portfolio management field, with a proven track record of success in leading and implementing change in the financial services sector.
Proficient with MS Office, SAS, SQL Server, Python and Tableau
Experience with Data Quality Management, data mapping and data reconciliation
Strong communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to read and understand logical data models. Experience with data modelling (relational and dimensional)
Strong prioritizing, planning, and project management skills
Proven analytical kills, conceptual thinking and systematic problem solving
Ability to lead and motivate team
University degree is required in the relevant STEM discipline (graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics field is preferred), along with extensive experience in B.I and data strategy roles).
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.
At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst
Description:
BE authentic . BE influential . BE the expert . Be all that and more at Colliers International.
At Colliers International, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.
BE authentic. BE influential. BE the expert . Be all that and more at Colliers International. Join our team as a Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst role in Toronto, ON
Who you are
As Business Intelligence & Performance Analyst you will design and develop data presentation architecture that enables business performance reporting and company dashboards. You will summarize and present data from multiple systems and sources. The reports and dashboards will be developed for various business areas of Colliers’ Real Estate Management Services working with Managers, Senior Management and at times in consultation with clients. You will assist the company in understanding profitability and performance of our business, our clients, their properties, and tenants/occupants. You will also develop operational dashboards and reporting that will increase efficiency in our service delivery.

Post-secondary education in Computer Science or Information Management (or relevant experience)
Proven working knowledge of developing ETL systems using SSIS, Data Factory, or similar
Experience developing reporting solutions with Power BI, Tableau or similar
Intermediate proficiency with SQL
Experience in a fast-paced environment
Bonus skills and experience
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Previous experience working in a fast-paced environment
What success looks like
You will translate user requirement into technical architecture vision and implementation plan

You will Design, develop and manage
ETL procedures to integrate data from various sources

You will develop business models, reports,
and visualizations to express raw analytic data for stakeholders’ consumption
You have a passion for ETL processes and consolidating data from a variety of sources including YARDI, to produce specific reports, data visualizations and dashboards
You will provide training for business users in the data warehousing space, models, and integration data flows
#LI-AA1
BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers International. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.

Direct applicants only please, no agencies.

Title: Senior Business Analyst (Business Intelligence) Lower Mainla...
Description:
Join our team

To be part of our team is to be part of an engaged, entrepreneurial engine that is literally reshaping Canada. We in the Drop Control Centre of Excellence (DCCoE) are responsible for the last mile of the fibre build - directly connecting Canadians to the people and information that matters most. The knowledge that our daily efforts are bridging social, economic, and digital divides to ensure all Canadians have access to the technology needed to thrive in our digital society compels, unites, and excites us.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You will partner with senior leaders and stakeholders, enabling them to make data-driven decisions that Directly impact TELUS share price. Your meaningful analytics, insights and recommendations will: 1) support TELUS’ PureFibre loading targets; 2) drive external vendor accountability; and 3) improve current business processes to ultimately transform the customer experience. Today you could be providing insights to power key strategic and transformational initiatives, tomorrow you may be casting your critical eye over end-to-end processes to improve our team’s efficiency and effectiveness. The possibilities for you to add value, learn and grow are endless.

Here’s how
Conduct analyses and prepare executive-level summary reports to support decision making and drive operational effectiveness
Create predictive models and forecasting to help our team achieve new performance heights
Interpret data trends to provide recommendations for process improvement and consolidation of best practices
Continuously improve current operational reports by deep diving data discrepancies and integrating new data sources
Collaborate, as required, with stakeholders to improve operational efficiencies across a variety of projects

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Confident in your skills using analytical and collaborative tools such as Microsoft Office, Google Suites, Salesforce, JIRA, DOMO, and/or Tableau
Comfortable with SQL and/or Python
Known for expertise conducting complex analyses and presenting recommendations to different audiences

Appreciated for your meeting facilitation, stakeholder management, and collaboration skills
Acknowledged for your advanced business acumen, analytical and problem solving skills
Regarded for your solid understanding of project management best practices
With a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration (or related discipline)
5+ years Business Analytics experience
Great-to-haves
Strong DOMO capabilities
Fibre build experience/knowledge
Change management
Project management

Title: Senior Advisor, Business Intelligence
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-10
As a leader in Quebec's investment industry, Desjardins Capital is one of the most active investors on the market. It is a true driver of entrepreneurship, offering strategic and financial support to growing businesses and contributing to the sustainable prosperity of Quebecers and Quebec communities. Desjardins Capital boasts more than 45 years of expertise, $2.4 billion invested in over 530 businesses, a growing team of more than 100 professionals established across Quebec and 8 funds under management.

As a senior business intelligence advisor, you help develop and use tools and methods to collect, compile, model and restore the organization's physical and non-physical data to establish governance, help decision-makers understand the big picture and inform decisions.

You lead and influence development projects and strategic initiatives that are complex and innovative. Your initiatives require extensive knowledge of your specialty area.

You make recommendations on the development and delivery of initiatives and projects with a high degree of operational and conceptual complexity that require analysis and a comprehensive, detailed understanding of the business and the organization. Coordination is critical, so you are required to interact with a large number of stakeholders working in a variety of fields. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.

You serve as a specialist advisor and subject matter expert in your field, as well as a resource person and coach for decision-making bodies.
Additional responsibilities
Assume responsibility for implementing business intelligence by integrating the information needs of various Desjardins Capital teams.
Ensure data governance (organization, definition and quality assurance), marketing and security.
Provide for the advancement of processes and tools making up the management information governance framework so as to maximize the efficiency of upgrade development and management, and the quality of information.
Provide technological monitoring activities in the business intelligence area, notably in terms of ways to generate management information, technological tools, metadata and documentation.
Advise your clients and partners to help them position, plan, develop, execute and monitor various strategic projects and initiatives for which you are responsible.
Develop and update policies, standards, models and programs to support your unit's strategic projects and initiatives.
Identify, analyze and diagnose major issues and make recommendations to decision-making bodies.
Represent your unit before decision-making bodies
Represent Desjardins Group's position when reaching agreements with partners or external organizations.
Other working condition
Number of job available : 1
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
A minimum of six years of relevant experience
Experience in business intelligence (governance, security and data marketing)
Experience in implementing sector-specific business intelligence (an asset)
Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required
Specific knowledge
Understanding of the investment sector (an asset)
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Collaborates, Customer Focus, Innovation
Key competencies for the job
Ambiguity, Interpersonal Savvy, Strategic mindset
Work Location
Complexe Desjardins Montréal
Trade Union
Non Syndiqué

2020-11-18

Administration (FG)

Title: Senior Functional QA Tester - Games - Business Intelligence
Description:
~ Version Française à suivre ~
PTW is looking for talented Senior QA Testers with Business Intelligence experience. Ideal candidates would be passionate about delivering high-quality products and services with a solid background working on a variety of projects, clients, and platforms.
*This role is an on-call contract with full-time availability requirements from Monday – Friday*
**During the Current Covid-19 global pandemic, this role will be an on-site role**

What you'll be doing
Verify the list of event tracking calls, and make sure they are all well implemented and triggered as per the design specifications of the BI team
Perform clear and concise functional checks, test case execution, ad-hoc checks, regressions, and other end user reporting with all necessary information
Execute daily tests, handling team communication, reviewing/vetting bugs reported by testers and execute tasks assigned by the QA Lead
Write and maintain test cases in TestRail for everything event tracking calls
Take ownership of BI testing through the product
Provide important/alarming observations and report the status for the current build
Manage team in the absence of Test Lead. Act as a secondary point of contact (POC) for clients and internal team
Collate the inputs from the team and provide these to the Test Lead for report generation
Requirements
What we are looking for?
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role, ideally publisher and / or studio
Experience with business intelligence software and testing:
Apple/Google guidelines/certification
Unity
Version control software
Development pipelines
Tracking calls
Mobile games (Android & iOS)
Working knowledge of Jira & TestRail
Experience following testing and bug writing guidelines, with excellent reading, writing and verbal skills in English and French
Being pro-active, analyze priorities and co-ordinate tasks with other testers
Analytical mind and problem-solving skills to provide feedback on QA Process and suggest solutions
Autonomous but also team-oriented, capable of helping and guiding others
Be capable of evaluating and understanding new features being introduced in development
Must be able to take accountability and responsibility for actions and decisions, while also being willing to learn and grow from any mistakes and failures
Passion for games and creative fields
Benefits
What we offer
Test unreleased video games and software
Competitive salary, paid training, and free coffee
Potential for full-time, permanent openings with growth opportunities
Office location near metro in the heart of the Mile End gaming hub
Fun, diverse and collaborative work environment


Who we are
PTW is a leading global provider of customer experience, quality assurance, localization, engineering and audio production services, to key software and technology-focused markets including games, interactive entertainment media, education, e-commerce and internet of things.
For over 20 years, we’ve delivered great results for our clients. Our main aim is to advance their businesses and enhance their customer’s’ satisfaction. We’re dedicated to helping every client develop the best products and consumer experiences possible. And because we believe in partnerships and collaboration, the journey is shared, and the successes are too.
http://www.ptw.com

==========================================================
Testeur fonctionnalités senior - Jeux – Informatique décisionnelle
MONTRÉAL, QUÉBEC
PTW est à la recherche de testeurs AQ seniors talentueux avec une expérience en informatique décisionnelle. Les candidats idéaux sont passionné.es par la distribution de produits et services de haute qualité, avec une solide expérience de travail sur une variété de projets, de clients et de plates-formes.
*Ce rôle est un contrat sur appel avec des exigences de disponibilité à temps plein du lundi au vendredi*
** Pendant la pandémie mondiale actuelle de Covid-19, ce rôle sera un rôle sur place **

Ce que vous allez faire
Vérifier la liste des appels de suivi d’événements et s’assurer qu'ils sont tous bien mis en œuvre et déclenchés conformément aux spécifications de conception de l'équipe BI
Effectuer des contrôles fonctionnels clairs et concis, l'exécution de scénarios de test (testcases), de contrôles ad hoc, de régressions et d'autres rapports d'utilisateurs extérieurs avec toutes les informations nécessaires
Exécuter des tests quotidiens, gérer la communication de l'équipe, examiner / vérifier les bogues signalés par les testeurs et exécuter les tâches assignées par le responsable AQ
Rédiger et gérer des scénarios de test dans TestRail pour tous les appels de suivi des événements
Prendre en charge les tests BI via le produit
Fournir des observations importantes / alarmantes et signaler l'état de versions actuelles
Gérer l'équipe en l'absence du responsable de test. Agir en tant que point de contact secondaire pour les clients et l'équipe interne
Rassembler les entrées de l'équipe et les fournir au responsable de test pour la génération du rapport
Ce que nous recherchons
Minimum 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire, idéalement pour un éditeur et / ou studio
Expérience avec des logiciels et des tests d’informatique décisionnelle:
Directives / Certification Apple / Google
Unity
Logiciel de contrôle de version
Pipelines de développement
Appels de suivi
Jeux mobiles (Android et iOS)
Connaissance pratique de Jira et TestRail
Expérience du suivi des directives de test et de rédaction de bogues, avec d'excellentes compétences en lecture, en écriture et à l'oral, en anglais et en français
Être pro-actif.ve, analyser les priorités et coordonner les tâches avec les autres testeurs
Esprit analytique et compétences en résolution de problèmes pour fournir des commentaires sur le processus d'AQ et suggérer des solutions
Autonome mais aussi orienté.e vers le travail d’équipe, capable d'aider et de guider les autres
Être capable d’évaluer et de comprendre les nouvelles fonctionnalités introduites lors du développement
Doit être capable d'assumer la responsabilité de ses actions et décisions, tout en étant également disposé.e à apprendre et à grandir de toute erreur et échec
Passion pour les jeux et les domaines créatifs
Ce que nous offrons
Tester des jeux vidéo et des logiciels inédits
Salaire compétitif, formation rémunérée et café gratuit
Possibilité de temps plein avec opportunités de croissance
Bureau près du métro au cœur du centre de jeux vidéos du Mile End
Environnement de travail amusant, diversifié et collaborative
Qui sommes-nous
PTW est l'un des principaux fournisseurs mondiaux d'expérience client, d'assurance qualité, de localisation, d'ingénierie et de production audio, sur les principaux marchés axés sur les logiciels et la technologie, notamment les jeux, les médias de divertissement interactifs, l'éducation, le commerce électronique et l'Internet des objets.
Depuis plus de 20 ans, nous livrons d'excellents résultats à nos clients. Notre objectif principal est de faire progresser leur entreprise et d'améliorer la satisfaction de leurs clients. Nous nous engageons à aider chaque client à développer les meilleurs produits et expériences de consommation possibles. Et parce que nous croyons aux partenariats et à la collaboration, le voyage est partagé et les succès aussi.
www.ptw.com

Title: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST
Description:
About Us

The Central Agencies I&IT Cluster's mandate is to ensure that the Ontario Public Service (OPS) has the tools, expert support and knowledge in place to optimize the value of I&IT investments in meeting the business priorities and directions of the Government of Ontario, today and in the future.

The Cluster also supports the Office of the Lieutenant Governor, the Premier's Office, Cabinet Office (including Ministry of Intergovernmental Affairs), Finance, and Related Agencies, Boards and Commissions.

The Cluster is closely aligned to the core businesses of the ministries and is absolutely essential to the efficient and cost-effective delivery of services, the growth of those businesses and their contribution to the agendas of both the ministries and the government. Although there is a wide range of diversity of technology, it is matched to meet the business needs, and is well-integrated and designed to meet corporate I&IT directions.

Why work for the Ontario Public Service?

We are re-thinking how we deliver services through various initiatives, modernization initiatives and how we access and deliver critical services remotely. We are striving to enable a future-ready OPS workforce through a technology-focused enterprise-wide strategies.

The Ontario Public Service offers a competitive compensation package. We support career and leadership development, invest in learning opportunities, recognize team and individual achievements, and support flexible work arrangements.

The Opportunity

Would you like to apply your technical expertise in Business Intelligence development?

The Cluster is in search of an expert to provide technical expertise with respect to Business Intelligence and data analytics for the overall analysis, design and architecture of large complex I&IT projects and systems solutions.

If this sounds like your next career move, then consider this exciting opportunity with us.
What can I expect to do in this role?
As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will:

provide senior technical expertise in the development, testing, implementation and maintenance of business intelligence applications, including data marts or other data structures, to support analytical reporting, extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) process, and the business logical model to support analytical reporting;
lead and participate in the preparation of detailed technical specifications and designs for business intelligence solutions;
lead and participate in the development of program code for various components of business intelligence solutions;
translate corporate information requirements into detailed system/programming specifications;
perform system acceptance testing and draft system documentation;
develop End User Application (EUA) demos and proto-types to support the design process; and
consult with users to determine their user requirements.

How do I qualify?
Technical Knowledge and Expertise
You have knowledge of the principles/techniques of large-scale business intelligence and data warehouse/database design and information management concepts.
You have practical hands-on experience in design and development of BI solutions.
You have knowledge and experience in Extraction, Transformation and Load (ETL) architecture, design and processes and tools for Microsoft platform (SQL Server ETL, SSIS, DataFactory).
You have knowledge of structured methodologies for the development, design, implementation and maintenance of BI solutions (OBIEE, PowerBI).
You have an understanding of Enterprise Architecture principles, techniques, methodologies and various architecture domains.

Systems Analysis and Technology Planning Experience
You have experience analyzing, designing, developing, testing, implementing, and demonstrating business intelligence (BI) tools.
You have experience building and managing data sets by analyzing data contained in the corporate database, legacy systems and other data sources.
You have experience in scripting, programming languages and development tools, architecture and design patterns.

Leadership and Project Management Skills
You can plan and coordinate technical activities, plans and schedules of project teams.
You can evaluate requests for proposals, participate in selection of service providers, coordinate the work and monitor performance of contracts.
You can provide technical direction and mentor junior technical staff

Communication and Interpersonal Skills
You have demonstrated interpersonal, conflict resolution, team-building and client relationship management skills to discuss program requirements, lead or participate in project teams, and discuss systems development recommendations.
You can prepare project reports, analyses, recommendations, systems documentation, manuals and senior-level briefing materials.

Analytical and Interpretative Reasoning Skills
You can assess client I&IT needs and develop solutions that are cost-effective and improve client program and service delivery.
You can determine all appropriate technical requirements, resources and cost estimates for developing, testing and implementing client application and recommend improvements.

Additional Information:
Address:
1 Temporary, duration up to 18 months, 222 Jarvis St, Toronto, Toronto Region

Compensation Group:
Ontario Public Service Employees Union

Understanding the job ad - definitions
Schedule:
6

Category:
Information Technology

Thursday, October 29, 2020

These positions may be of various tenures including, short-term assignments. Your information and the results from this competition will be retained for the purpose of filling vacancies in accordance with the applicable collective agreement or policy provisions.

Description:
BI Developer (prefer in Canada). Would have to have experience with Looker, Snowflake and with building data pipelines.
We use Fivetran along with some internal tools for building pipelines. Experience with Fivetran or similar would be nice.

8 hour shift

Looker: 1 year (Required)
