Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Are you a motivated individual with a strategic mindset and a knack for data-crunching?
Are you a person who thinks outside the box?
If you are driven with an entrepreneurial mindset, then we want to hear from you!
We’re BioSyent Pharma and we’re looking for an ambitious Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI team in our brand new Mississauga office. This is an entry level job.
As our BI Analyst, you are comfortable thinking outside the box and have the drive to help take our BI department to the next level. You are proficient at manipulating, analyzing and interpreting large data sets. You are fully capable of identifying recommendations to Business Unit Heads and will get an opportunity to present your work to the senior leadership, thereby seeing your fingerprints on our success.
This is an excellent opportunity for you if you are a recent university graduate with some work experience, ready to become a professional. You will see your skills and career grow alongside a great Canadian success in the making.
If this sounds like you, then we should discuss your future - connect with us today!
Who We Are?
We are listed on TSXV with an appreciable track record for growth and innovation, located in Mississauga. Check us out at www.biosyent.com.
BioSyent is focused on commercializing healthcare and pharmaceutical products that provide a distinguishable benefit to patients and their healthcare providers and is known for its ability to effectively and efficiently introduce new products to the Canadian market. BioSyent is actively sought out as the Canadian market partner of choice by brand innovators with niche or specialty products looking for a trusted partner that can deliver results.
We were thrilled to be named one of Canada’s PROFIT 500 companies for eight years in a row with no plans of slowing down. We were also named one of the TSX Venture Top 50 growth companies for three years.
As a result of this growth, we need great people to step in and help us grow to new heights of success!
What It’s Like at BioSyent
BioSyent’s values are something that we live and breathe. We value integrity, respect and leadership. We take the long-term view (call it corporate sustainability), we persevere in the face of obstacles and discouragement, and we embrace change as an opportunity.
Ask our employees what it’s like to work here, and they’ll tell you it’s like a family. We care both for the group and its individuals. We’re light on bureaucracy, and it’s easy to access whoever you need (or whatever you need to know).
We work hard for results. We’re all hands on deck when there’s a big priority and then give each other space when we’ve got specific jobs to get done. Here every person is close to decisions and actions – close to the heartbeat of the organization.
Who We’re Looking For
The Business Intelligence Analyst handles a wide range of responsibilities to ensure the smooth functioning of the department. You need excellent communication skills and the ability to function well in a role that requires autonomy and initiative.
You have excellent organizational and administrative skills and can balance multiple priorities. This position regularly interacts with senior management and requires someone with high integrity and discretion.
The responsibilities of this role are as follows:
Build, maintain and improve existing dashboards to allow for immediate insight and analysis by management
Prepare Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly Commercial Activity Reports; constantly improving both the report content for greater commercial impact and reporting process for efficiency
Act as a partner with the business units troubleshooting both day-to-day and high-level strategic problems
Provide management with actionable insights based on in-depth analysis of the commercial and competitive environments for brands in all stages of the lifecycle (i.e. pre-launch, growth, and mature markets)
Actively engage with internal /external teams to streamline and standardize existing processes by identifying and developing opportunities to increase efficiencies
Interpret requests from management (i.e. “wants”) and deliver necessary outputs (i.e. “needs”)
Demonstrate ability to solve complex problems and offer creative suggestions for alternative designs and methods
Evaluate new projects and business challenges and design practical, attainable solutions
Track and document post implementation benefits and key objective measurement
Effectively present information and respond to questions from internal peers and leaders
Be the liaison between the business units and external support teams
Create tools (in Excel and Tableau) to help operations teams manage day-to-day responsibilities
Modeling of forecasts and budget preparation
Occasionally assist finance and accounting department
Additional ad-hoc reports and analysis as required
Sound like the right job for you so far? If so, and you have the following qualifications, we would love to see your application!
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration/Commerce, with a focus on management and/or analytics (or similar fields)
CO-OP / Internship, or similar corporate work experience
Advanced excel skills (Lookups, Pivots, Conditional Formatting, Nested formulas, Data Tables, Charting, etc.)
Investigative mindset that can be applied to a broad range of tools and situations
Hard working, goal-oriented personality with excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to work independently or in a team environment to meet strict deadlines
Proficient in using MS Office Suite of products (PowerPoint, Word, OneDrive/SharePoint, etc.)
Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
Nice to haves:
Tableau, Sage and Salesforce.com experience
CPG and/or Pharmaceuticals experience
Excel VBA & Macros experience
Our Benefits
Our employees are our most important asset, which means their health and well-being are a priority. We provide a competitive benefit package for individuals and families, including:
Medical & dental coverage
Life insurance
Long-term disability insurance
Training and Development on LinkedIn Learning
Employer matched Employee Share Purchase Plan
How to Apply
Our online application will give you the option to apply to this role as a complete person – not just a resume. The application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you will receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.
We are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported. If you require any assistance, please contact us by using the “Help” button.
We will review applications with priority given to those who have completed the assessment and look forward to hearing from you.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist (Tableau)
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Role Summary
Within SLF Canada, Insurance Solutions is one of the largest business units. Insurance Solutions accounts for approximately 15% of worldwide earnings in the overall Sun Life Financial group of companies, and over 30% of Canadian earnings. We manufacture and distribute leading-edge life insurance and health insurance products and solutions for over two million individual customers.
This role will lead analytics initiatives within the Insurance Solutions Market Development team, with particular emphasis on data & analytical services on insurance distribution, product and legacy management.
As a BI Specialist, you will be part of a large analytics community and will be focused within the Individual Insurance business responsible for building modern business intelligence capability as well as delivering innovative analytical solutions.
What will you do?
Data, Technology, and Tools
Responsible for improving the quality and management of data assets across distribution, finance, actuarial, product domains
Partner with data scientists, IT and Analytics Center of Excellence to establish robust CIDMs (Canadian Integrated Data Models) for Insurance Solutions
Lead in migration of all of BI and Insights data foundation to the Enterprise Data Lake
Design and Visualization
Design and facilitate workshops to understand user needs, set business requirements, and test BI dashboard designs with users
Translate user needs into compelling BI dashboard designs utilizing best practices in infographic design and aligned with Sun Life design language
Illustrate alternative concepts by mocking up sketches or wireframes with consistent and professional layout and visual; rapidly iterate and develop final versions
Project and Relationship Management
Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation of business intelligence platforms
Build and maintain strong working relationships with the Pricing, Distribution, Operations and IT partners to ensure delivery of initiatives within the area.
Act as evangelist for BI benefits across the organization and actively promote BI usage to relevant business areas
Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary
Perform VOC feedback analysis to gain insights, take actions and improve.
What will you need to succeed?
Critical thinking and proactive problem solving
Convey complex design concepts with ease
Deadline oriented with ability to effectively multi-task
Strong passion for enabling performance through data-driven management
Understanding of the insurance industry including products and distribution channels
Experience with data querying languages and techniques, analysis tools, data sources and structures
Education and Training
Education background in Math/UI design/Statistics/financial engineering/data analytics
3+ years of experience in data analytics role with a focus on business intelligence
1+ years of experience in insurance and financial service industry as an asset
Strong understanding of best practices in data visualization and dashboard design
Practical experience with modern Data Visualization tools such as Tableau and knowledge with cloud-based Big Data tools and platforms (AWS)
Unique Requirements
The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html)
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits, pension, stocks, savings and 4 weeks vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Salary Range:
67,400/67 400 - 110,100/110 100
Job Category:
Advanced Analytics
Posting End Date:
13/11/2020

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Here at EQ Care, we are on a mission to create innovative technologies and services that drive our vision which is to create a healthier world, one life at a time.

EQ Care is a market leader in the rapidly growing industry of virtual healthcare. We enable employers to offer to their employees a secure online access to medical practitioners and nurses via a computer, tablet, or smartphone. Telemedicine is the biggest trend in employee benefits and an exponential number of companies are looking to offer the service in the near future.

To accomplish our big vision, we are building a team of extremely motivated people from different fields of expertise such as science, technology, healthcare, HR, group benefits and design to combine human knowledge, empathy with technology and processes in order to create the ideal virtual health solution.

At EQ Care, you will be part of a highly dynamic and innovative team, laser-focused on creating a health enriching community built on trust, warmth, and dignity, with the goal of creating value for all our partners through a technology-enhanced care ecosystem.

Business Intelligence Analyst
Position Summary
We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who will be responsible for translating business insight into data. We are looking for an experimented candidate with previous experience in data analytics and metrics optimization. The candidate will also have to give recommendation on how to improve our current practices.
We are seeking candidates who thrive in fast-paced, product and service-driven environments. To be successful, you need to be highly motivated and detail-oriented while showing the highest standards of responsibilities.

Key Responsibilities
Takes a holistic view of a business problem or challenge by translating data into meaningful business insights
Designs new systems by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
Build and maintain queries and reports
Improves systems by studying current practices, designing modifications
Recommends controls by identifying problems
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
Present recommendations
Work closely with the Development and Client Success Team

Education & Skills
5 years of experience in a similar role
B.Comm in MIS or equivalent
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to interface with all levels (executive to entry level)
Detail oriented, organized, and able to meet deadlines
Able to select and maintain Analytic and BI tools
Demonstrated aptitude in dealing with private and confidential information; uses diplomacy and tact in all interactions
Bilingual (French and English) in both, written and oral communication

Chez EQ Care, nous avons comme mission de créer des technologies et services innovateurs en lien avec notre vision de créer un monde plus en santé, une vie à la fois.
EQ Care est un leader dans l’industrie de la santé virtuelle. Nous permettons aux employeurs d’offrir à leurs employés un accès en ligne sécurisé à des médecins, infirmières et autres professionnels de la santé via un ordinateur, tablette ou téléphone intelligent. La télémédecine est la principale tendance en assurance collective et un nombre exponentiel d’entreprises considèrent offrir ce service dans un futur proche.
Afin d’accomplir notre grande vision, nous bâtissons une équipe de gens extrêmement motivés provenant de différents domaines d’expertises tels que les sciences, l’ingénierie, le commerce et la conception afin de combiner les connaissances humaines et l’empathie avec les technologies et les processus pour créer la solution santé virtuelle idéale.
Chez EQ Care, vous ferez partie d’une équipe dynamique et innovatrice, concentrée à la création d’une communauté d’amélioration de la santé bâtie sur la confiance, la chaleur humaine et la dignité, tout en ayant pour but de créer une valeur pour tous nos partenaires via un écosystème de soins supporté par la technologie.

Analyste en intelligence d'affaires

Le poste
Nous recherchons actuellement un Analyste en intelligence d'affaires qui sera chargé de traduire les connaissances commerciales en données. Nous recherchons un candidat expérimenté avec une expérience antérieure en analyse de données et en optimisation des métriques. Le candidat devra également donner des recommandations sur la manière d'améliorer nos pratiques actuelles. Nous recherchons des candidats qui prospèrent dans des environnements dynamiques axés sur les produits et les services. Pour réussir, vous devez être très motivé et soucieux du détail tout en faisant preuve des plus hauts standards de responsabilité.

Principales responsabilités
Adopter une vision globale d'un problème ou d'un défi de l'entrepriise en traduisant les données en informations
Concevoir de nouveaux systèmes en analysant les besoins, construire des graphiques et des diagrammes de flux de travail, étudier les capacités du système, rédiger des spécifications
Créer et gérer des requêtes et des rapports
Améliorer les systèmes en étudiant les pratiques actuelles
Recommander des contrôles en identifiant les problèmes, et en rédigeant des procédures améliorées
Définir les exigences du projet en identifiant les phases et les éléments du projet
Surveiller l'avancement du projet en suivant l'activité; résoudre les problèmes; publier des rapports et recommander des actions
Maintenir les protocoles système en écrivant et en mettant à jour des procédures
Fournir des références aux utilisateurs en rédigeant et en conservant la documentation utilisateur
Préparer des rapports techniques en collectant, analysant et résumant les informations et les tendances
Présenter des recommandations
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe de développement et de réussite client

Éducation et compétences
5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire
B.Comm in MIS ou équivalent
Excellente compétence en analyse et résolution de problèmes
Capacité à interagir avec tous les niveaux (de la direction à l'entrée)
Souci du détail, organisé et capable de respecter les délais
Capable de sélectionner et de maintenir des outils d'analyse et de BI
Aptitude avérée à traiter des informations privées et confidentielles; utilise la diplomatie et le tact dans toutes ses interactions
Bilingue (français et anglais) en communication écrite et orale

Title: Business Intelligence Manager
Description:
About the Company:
The story of Bosa Properties is one of entrepreneurship, commitment and a passion for real estate and construction that began over 50 years ago. Decades in the business have taught us how to create homes that are timeless in design, universal in their appeal, and comfortable for homeowners at every stage of life. Being a forward-thinking company matters to us and influences everything from where we build our projects to the amenities and technologies we build into them.
About the Role:
The Business Intelligence Manager will partner with the Vice President of Strategy and the IT Infrastructure team to build a BI function and practice that supports a diverse range of business groups such as real estate development, acquisitions, sales and marketing, human resources, property management, and more.
The BI Manager will act as the internal expert on data reporting and analysis, reporting design, and BI systems (such as Data Warehousing, ETL’s Data Models and enterprise visualization tools (Power BI). Through partnerships with key stakeholders, including the executive group and BI professionals in other business units, the BI Manager’s key deliverable is to generate insights that allow the business to find and extract value in our operations and both existing and new markets.

Success in this role will be demonstrated through excelling in three main areas:
Data Communication and Process: It is essential that this role creates value to the executive team – the primary stakeholders – by aiding their ability to increase customer demand and/or become more productive. Necessary skills include:
Understanding key priorities of each business unit, then advise and translate data solutions to non-tech business leaders;
Originate and execute process improvement within business units to enhance data collection;
Regular presentations to the Executive team leveraging value-add reports and insights derived from data analytics.
Data Reporting: Source and manipulate internal and external data into a user-friendly report that enhances decision making. Necessary skills include:
Building corporate and business unit dashboards using PowerBI (highest priority), Power Automate, DAX, PowerQuery;
Pull raw data from enterprise systems and apply ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) techniques;
Experience with data hygiene, normalization and frameworks (eg. Hadoop).
Advanced Data Analytics: After sourcing and reporting appropriate data, advanced analytics will be required to derive insights. Necessary skills include:
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques to enable Descriptive (clustering/visualization), Predictive (regression/neural networks) and Prescriptive (optimization, matching) analytics.
Coding fluency in Python or R.
Formal training in Mathematics, Statistics (Masters preferred).
What you Bring:
In addition to the technical skills listed above, to be successful in this role you should be an innately curious individual with a knack for quickly understanding the goals of each business unit and how data and analysis will contribute to the achievement of those goals. Your strong communication skills allow you to easily understand and distill complex information for key stakeholders, and you are comfortable presenting your results and methodologies to the Executive team.

Most notably, you understand the importance of great relationships, and you recognize that your ability to be effective depends on continually developing your understanding of the business, the industry and the individual metrics and levers that affect them.
Your Rewards
Our most important offering to anyone that joins the Bosa Properties team is our culture of innovation, achievement, and ownership. We bring out the best in each other by constantly striving to be world class in all we do. These values are reflected in our Real Estate Projects, our Company, and our People.
At Bosa, we also offer a very competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:
Medical and Dental Coverage: Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost
RRSP Matching: We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your RRSP contributions.
Friends and Family Program: Early and exclusive access to our newly released projects
BOSAconnect™: Our annual development conference that is designed and hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts.
Professional Development and Education Support

How to Apply
Please submit an application at the link provided. We value your interest in the Bosa Family of Companies. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

Title: AU-01 Excise Tax /Income Tax Business Intelligence and Quali...
Description:
For a description of key terms used on CRA job notices, go to Definitions for job seekers.
About the job
Business Intelligence and Quality Officers are responsible for the selection of files having the highest potential risk of non-compliance with the provisions of the Income Tax Act (ITA) and/or Excise Tax Act (ETA) and other statutes administered by the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) to be assigned to audit teams within the region.

They will identify and screen files on a regional basis, in accordance with the program plan(s), for auditors of an equivalent or lower level using risk assessment methodologies.
Reviews audit files completed by auditors, of an equivalent or lower level, on a regional basis to ensure quality standards are met, including the correct application of legislation, policies and procedures, within the parameters of an established framework and in accordance with the program plan(s). Documents audit quality review results, identifies areas of concern and provides constructive feedback to audit team leaders and auditors.

Other duties include identifying key risk indicators and risk assessment issues, problems and concerns relating to legislation, practices, approaches, and tax planning strategies in the development of audit workload. Then communicating identified business intelligence to their team leader for further discussion with headquarters.
This staffing process may be used to staff similar positions.

Various Language Requirements

Come work for the CRA, one of the Top 100 Employers in Canada!
To apply
Who can apply

Persons living in Canada and Canadian citizens living abroad.
AND eligible veterans and Canadian Forces members
AND individuals with preferred status who live or work within the general rule of minimum distance of the position(s) being staffed.

Please note that this process will be used to staff positions in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia only. As a result, if you are selected for a position from this process we will expect you to relocate to this location. Virtual reporting may not be possible.
If you are a candidate from the general public, you will have to pay for any expenses related to your participation in this staffing process, as well as any relocation costs if you receive an offer of employment from this process.
Qualified members and former members of the Canadian Forces who receive an offer of employment are not entitled to relocation costs from the CRA. They may, however, be entitled to a final relocation from the Department of National Defence.
We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible as the closing date and time on this notice of job opportunity may change.

Essential staffing requirements

Education

Possess the Chartered Professional Accounting (CPA) designation (or eligible to write the CPA Common Final Examination in 2020).

NOTE: A copy of your CPA certificate (including certificate number), your current membership card, or a letter of good standing can be used as proof of designation. If you are eligible to write the CPA Common Final Examination in 2020, you must provide your CPA transcripts and outline your plan to allow you to write the CPA Common Final Examination in 2020.

Experience
Minimum two years' experience (in the last 5 years) in a public accounting environment*
Experience in Canadian Income Tax compliance within a public practice accounting firm. This may include:
Conducting/managing audits;
Preparing, reviewing and/or approving corporate income tax returns;
Preparing financial statements corporations;
Auditing to ensure compliance with federal and/or provincial income tax legislation;
Interpretation of the statutes administered by the CRA;
Providing tax planning advice under the Income Tax Act.

The onus is on the candidate to demonstrate that they meet the experience requirements using the Experience Submission.

Experience Submission

In order to maintain client privacy when detailing your work experience, you must not provide the names of corporations, individuals or any other entities. Supervisor: Provide the name and phone number of your immediate supervisor at the time of the work experience cited.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Engineer
Description:
At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.

The impact you’ll make
As a Business Intelligence Data Engineer, you will impact our business by fueling the best in class data analytic and reporting platform at Loblaw Digital that will empower our business users in making data driven decisions and strategies in their everyday work.
We’re growing our BI team to better serve the enterprise data strategy and want you to be a part of it. You’ll work with users across the organization to understand how data helps them and translate that into solutions that will bring data from various systems into our data warehouse. We’re looking to turn our enviable wealth of data into actionable insights and meaningful recommendations that drive growth and improved engagement across all of our lines of business, and a customer-focused mindset is a must-have.
What you'll do
Develop and scale quality and performant data pipelines using GCP (Big Query, Compute Engine, Kubernetes, Cloud Composer, Dataflow) and other open source technologies
Work with stakeholders to develop solutions that support various data consumers
Work with DevOps on setting up environment for new deployment
Build and implement robust data models and semantic layer
Be a subject matter expert on the entire BI framework stack
Support reporting and analytics needs from all areas of the business. For example: Developers, Product Managers, Product Designers, Merchandizers, Marketers, and Operations Analysts
Help us in our mission to be a hypotheses-driven product development organization which means data is at the center of everything we do
Does this Sound like you?
BA/BS in computer science, engineering or related technical field
Hands-on experience with relational databases (e.g. Oracle, MySQL, DB2, etc.)
Python experience coding ETLs using various packages/connectors to databases and endpoints (or Java)
Working experience with Git and CI/CD pipelines
Experience with data pipeline automation using a code focused scheduling tool (e.g. Airflow)
Exposure to Kubernetes, docker, and streaming tools (Kafka)
Experience working with sourcing and feeding data from REST APIs is nice to have
Understanding of data warehouse concept and BI architecture is a plus
Strong oral and written communication skills
Solid stakeholder management skills
Proven team player that will work well in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience in retail or ecommerce is a plus
Strong desire to learn and to push the boundaries of what can be done to better empower our business with data
How you’ll succeed
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Title: Specialist, Business Intelligence
Description:
Reporting to the Senior Leader, Virtual Health, the Specialist, Business Intelligence (BI) is responsible for providing advanced technical leadership and solution architecture in support of analytics and evaluation activities and initiatives. The position designs leading edge approaches and guides the detailed implementation of these solutions from inception to completion. The position also contributes to the development and implementation of data analytics and visualization improvement strategies to ensure that the BI environment and systems are working efficiently in order to improve transactional and reporting activities.

The Specialist provides input to the overall goals, objectives and operations of the department by providing feedback and recommendations specifically with respect to analytics and evaluation issues. The Specialist works across all levels of the Office of Virtual Health (OVH) providing leadership and support in the area of data analytics development/maintenance and information reporting via dashboards, scorecards or reports.

What you’ll do:
Architect and implement leading edge solutions to develop, enhance and improve the BI solutions. This includes leading the design, creation, documentation and implementation of complex multidimensional cubes, reports and data visualization which deliver information via the web to end users.
Provide technical expertise in the development of the BI solutions by assessing client needs/requirements, reviewing technical options, determining software architecture and leading all levels of the solution development and deployment. Ensure security and permission levels maintain patient, physician and data confidentiality.
Maintain familiarity with the latest technologies and an awareness of current information system trends and issues. Evaluate and recommend methods to deliver data visualization in an accurate, timely and user friendly manner.
Mentor and collaborate with other developers and team members and provides technical and educational support to BI end users by developing training materials, delivering training sessions and training trainers.
Collaborate with members PHSA Data, Analytics, Reporting, and Evaluation’s Data Architect and Data Integration team on conceptual design of databases and the development and implementation of solutions in the Enterprise Data Warehouse. Works with IMITS departmental staff and others to manage and maintain the BI servers and applications including system administration, maintenance and performance monitoring of various servers to ensure optimal uptime and production readiness.
What you bring:
A Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science, Business, Computer Science or Management Information Systems from a recognized school plus a minimum of five (5) years of recent related BI work experience preferably in a healthcare environment.
Expert knowledge and understanding of relational and multidimensional (OLAP) databases as well as proven knowledge and experience in working with SQL Server or Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Performance Point, Sharepoint, Visual Studio , etc.
Experience in the development and maintenance of popular BI platforms including Power BI and Tableau.
Ability to create and understand complex T-SQL and MDX queries and previous administrative experience setting up new users and monitoring performance.
Proficiency in scripting and computer programming foundations. Knowledge of web authoring technology such as JavaScripts, HTML, and ASP .NET, AJAX is also required. High level of expertise in Microsoft Office suite of applications.
Ability to understand management reporting and statistical concepts.
Ability to apply machine learning and/or natural language processing (NLP) concepts is a bonus.
Strong analytical, problem solving and system analysis skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze operational problems and recommend innovative solutions. Self-directed and motivated to learn new technology (including hardware, software applications and programming applications) and stay up-to-date on new analytics solutions. Can identify and implement creative data visualizations for specific end-user needs.
Ability to work independently with little direct supervision and as a member of a multi-disciplinary team. Excellent time management skills with the ability to organize and prioritize work. Ability to be customer service focused. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Physical ability to perform the duties of the job.
What’s in it for you:

Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan.
12 annual statutory holidays with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.
Job type: Regular Full-Time
Location: 1333 W. Broadway Vancouver, BC
Closing date: Open until position is filled
Reference number: 100028E
About Us
The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) is part of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA). PHSA provides specialized health services to British Columbians, including cancer care, organ transplantation, pediatrics, emergency services, mental health and substance use services. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose. Learn more about PHSA and our programs: https://jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
We hire on the basis of merit and encourage all qualified applicants to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences. We strive to create a safe and welcoming environment where everyone can come to work and be their best, authentic self.

Title: Functional Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-10
The person in this position will analyze the needs of product owners, identify the information systems required and develop highly complex computer applications. They will act as an integrator through each step of the development process and will coordinate project resources when needed.
We are currently looking for a functional analyst in business intelligence. The person in this position will analyze the needs of product owners, identify the information systems required and develop highly complex computer applications. They will act as an integrator through each step of the development process and will coordinate project resources when needed.

The person will act as a functional analyst in data integration, in connection with business intelligence and the company’s data transactions. They will work in complex, multi-platform environments while using a variety of tools. They will be working with multiple teams and be responsible for handling several files at the same time, for our unit, from end to end.
Other working conditions
Number of jobs available: 1
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
A minimum of six years of relevant experience
Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered.
For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required.
Specific knowledge
Familiarity with business intelligence
Knowledge of data warehouses and data integration systems
Experience in data exploitation: marts, cubes, tools for virtualization (Denodo) and visualization (Power BI)
Experience in SQL, SSIS, SSAS technologies (an asset)
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Collaborates, Customer Focus, Innovation
Key competencies for the job
Drive results, Interpersonal Savvy, Plans and aligns, Strategic mindset
Work Location
Complexe Desjardins Montréal
Trade Union
Non Syndiqué
Unposting Date
2020-11-14
Job Family
Information technology (FG)

Title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Insights
Description:
Location:
1685 Tech Ave, Mississauga, Ontario, L4W 0A7
Take ownership and find more ways to care about our local store owners in a career at Shoppers Drug Mart Central Office / Store Support. Provide great service, specific expertise and actionable advice to support Associate-Owners and their staff in delivering the best health, beauty and convenience services to Canadians.


Why this role is important?
Manager, Business Intelligence & Insights
Location: Mississauga, ON
Specialty Health Network (or SHN, as we call ourselves) is a growing division of Shoppers Drug Mart, with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We pride ourselves in having an awesome work culture and fun environment! We offer competitive salaries, a great benefit package, Shoppers Drug Mart discount, Goodlife gym discount, RRSP/Pension plans, Employee share ownership plan, professional training and development and many more perks!
Shoppers Drug Mart was acquired by Loblaw in 2014, the largest employer in Canada – making your career opportunities within our larger organization - endless!
Why this role is important?
Our Business Intelligence and Transformation team is seeking an experienced leader in Analytics with superior leadership traits, technical skills and business acumen to join the Specialty Health Network division of Shoppers Drug Mart. The successful individual would be a subject matter expert as it pertains to advanced analytics and play a key role in understanding the needs of our patients and partners to transform our patient support programs. This is an opportunity to be responsible for leading the development and maintenance of large scale data mining models in support of all program and real-world evidence intelligence initiatives.
Our business is growing, we're taking big risks and we're looking for a leader who is up for the challenge. If this sounds like you, then keep reading!
What you will do:
Directly manage all advanced analytical activities and lead analysis driven insights with recommendations to improve patient access, outcomes and transformative program design.
Provide thought leadership into the Data and Predictive Analytics Strategy throughout the design, development and deployment stages of CRMs and other data applications.
Guide the development of the CRM / data repositories and Data Mining solutions using the best practices and the latest developments in the industry.
Help maintain the Data Mining tools and frameworks, including all prerequisite components and the add-ons. Help to apply upgrades and patch releases as required.
Collaborate with other teams within Analytics, Operations, Marketing, IT, Sales and Customer Service in the development and deployment of the predictive models. Subsequently, conduct strategic reviews of performance using data driven insights to explain trends and identify key learnings.
Monitor reporting performance and make ongoing corrections by executing extensive report testing strategies.
Based on understanding trends in our customer behavior, proactively prepare presentations for senior management as to opportunities and challenges within our customer base.
Report all Adverse Events (AE) and Product Technical Complaints (PTC) immediately or as soon as possible upon becoming aware of the event as per current policies and procedures.
What you will need:
5+ years in healthcare analytics, CRM, or a related analytical field with a strong preference for experience in patient support programs.
5+ years of Applied Statistics, Data Mining, Database Marketing or Machine Learning.
Proven leadership experience.
Post-Secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical discipline such as Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering. (Candidates with the equivalent of a Master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to Mathematics, Engineering, Business Administration, Marketing, Operational Research, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related field will be preferred).
5+ years of experience in leveraging RDMBS systems (e.g. SQL Servers) and able to query relational databases using BI software.
Able to design models, reports and dashboards and oversee their development into production.
Business acumen - clear and concise communication and presentation skills with demonstrated ability of providing recommendations and highlighting financial implications for the purposes of achieving buy-in.
High level of initiative to prioritize work amid competing demands and take projects from the briefing phase to the delivery of final reports/presentations with minimal supervision.
Demonstrated ability to unite disparate, often complex sources of customer information such as market research data with internally generated transactional data and transform into actionable insights, tactics and strategies.
Why work at Shoppers Drug Mart?
Acting as consultants, supporting internal customers and the Associate-Owners, you will get experience unique to the retail industry while working for an award-winning national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, competitive pay and online learning through SDMU.
Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your work, co-workers, customers and community.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Shoppers Drug Mart Inc. , we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular
Shoppers Drug Mart Inc. recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer-Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics and Reporting, the BI Developer-Analyst is responsible for developing and maintaining BI solutions, including Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), reports, dashboards, and analytical solutions to support effective use of data by PHC clinical and non-clinical programs, Senior Leadership Team (SLT) and other key stakeholders. Responsibilities include dashboard development, database development and monitoring, data modeling, data dictionary development and maintenance, application development, documentation, maintenance of users and user permission, performing routine periodic processing activities related to key decision support applications, participating in the design, writing, production, and documentation of standard and ad hoc queries and reports, problem identification, analyzing healthcare data and communicating the findings through the use of data visualization and storytelling. The BI Developer-Analyst works closely with colleagues to audit, identify and follow-up on issues related to data quality, metric definitions or process deficiencies. The BI Developer-Analyst acts as a key interface between Data Analytics Leads, Solutions Architect and the Data Analytics (Decision Support) teams at our partner organizations, as well as the Information Management, Information Technology (IM/IT) departments to ensure the solutions meet the business requirements and the technical specifications and adhere to team standards. This role requires a strong foundation in analytical methods, data warehousing, data visualization and statistics. The position requires access to detailed and confidential information of all types (clinical, financial, payroll, etc.).
Skills
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.
Expert proficiency in Tableau and other Analytical and Reporting tools. Strong analytical/modeling skills with the ability to convert raw data into actionable business insights.
Demonstrated knowledge of OLAP technologies and dimensional modeling.
Strong background in data architecture, data quality, data mapping, and data structures.
Strong understanding of database and business intelligence concepts.
Proven ability to interpret data files and record layouts to map fields between multiple systems and database tables.
Work effectively in an ETL framework driven environment with proven ability to prepare, maintain and publish ETL documentation, including source-to-target mappings and business-driven transformation rules.
Strong understanding of business processes and transactional systems within the business domain.
Demonstrated ability to understand and prioritize user and business requirements, and to conceptualize information processing solutions in response to them, including analyze, scope and define work effort required to correct program deficiencies and problems.
Strong interpersonal relationship management skills, a team player with a client/user orientation.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas/processes in simple terminology to internal and external stakeholders, including all levels of management.
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills.
Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards.
Excellent organizational skills with proven ability to plan and execute complex projects.
Ability to work to independently, meeting deadlines under pressure, with minimal supervision and frequent interruptions.
Ability to teach, coach and mentor others.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Education
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related field plus a minimum of five (5) years’ recent, related experience with data modeling, data visualization and reporting tools (specifically, Tableau, SAP Crystal Reports, SSRS and Power BI), ETL, Microsoft BI tools (SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS), advanced T-SQL (Microsoft Transact SQL) and analyzing business requirements or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Significant recent experience is also required in the following:
business analysis and project management;
coordinating and documenting the change management process for complex information systems;
upgrading/migrating to SQL Server Platforms - SQL Server 2019;
writing T-SQL;
programming experience in C#, VB.net, Java, etc.
Duties
1. Designs, develops and maintains dashboards, databases, ETL, reports and other BI content and analytical solutions as required. Works collaboratively with clients and business analysts to gather requirements, create definitions and specifications and translate into data models, ETL packages and reports as appropriate. Writes ad-hoc queries and reports to support analysts and leaders in data analysis.
2. Participates in the VCH/PHC regional and PHC local Data Warehouse development lifecycle including: planning, development, testing, migration and production support development activities.
3. Design, develop and support all extraction and integration processes (ETL).
4. Design and build interactive and static data visualizations to provide insights
5. Liaise with team members and/or other stakeholders to determine analytical solutions requirements including understanding inefficiencies in existing business applications and future business needs.
6. Extract, manipulate and analyze complex information from multiple data sources / systems using a variety of software (e.g., R, SQL, Python)
7. Conduct statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to improve forecasting, targeting and performance measurement
8. Assist with data-related technical challenges and perform root-cause analysis to answer specific business questions and recommend and implementing ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality.
9. Maintain a repository of metadata and lineage information about how data flows through its lifecycle.
10. Contribute to the development and documentation of data management standards framework.
11. In consultation with the Solutions Architect, provides input into the logical design and development of PHC Local Data Warehouse data models to be used for reporting and information delivery.
12. Collaborates with Database Administrators, Systems Analysts, and Solutions Architect to identify, analyze and rationalize internal and external data sources and ETL strategies.
13. Performs technical analysis and prepares and implements recommended ETL design approach.
14. Prepares and validates end-to-end business logic and mappings.
15. Develops, tests, documents and implements proposed analytical solutions (e.g., reports and dashboards).
16. Responds to ad-hoc, on-demand and scheduled business user information requests as they relate to services and support provided by the business groups.
17. Produces and maintains core PHC management reports, departmental dashboards and related management tools.
18. Adapts ETL processes as necessary to accommodate changes in source systems and target business user requirements.
19. Maintains and administers PHC organizational development key performance indicators data and reports.
20. Supports and maintains migration of data to data mart from source systems.
21. Develops, maintains and schedules ETL data flows/workflows/jobs, and provides daily support of these processes once implemented.
22. Works with business users to validate rules regarding data integrity and data quality as it relates to the impact on business needs.
23. Debugs, monitors and troubleshoots business solutions to resolve production issues.
24. Liaises with other IT Development and Operations departments to clarify and build applications that meet business unit objectives.
25. Administers security settings and access to the data mart and related systems.
26. Supports all business users with the use of data mart tools and in deployment activities such as user acceptance testing, user training, product demos and product evaluation.
27. Performs other duties as assigned.

Title: Analyst/Developer in Information Technology (IT) business in...
Business Intelligence Analyst (French Services)
Description:
Job Family Media Production
Primary Location Montreal
Position Language Requirement French Only
Language Skill Level (Reading) -
Language Skill Level (Writing) -
Language Skill Level (Speaking) -
Status of Employment Contract
Work schedule(s) Full-time

Why Join CBC/Radio-Canada
Digital is a key part of our present and our future. CBC/Radio-Canada’s strategy is focused on becoming the first organization to provide a digital platform that delivers unique content and experiences for our audiences, by telling stories that reflect who they are.
Your role

As Business Intelligence Analyst, you report to the Supervisor, Metrics and Business Intelligence, and work with the Lead Analyst in charge of digital data practices to ensure compliance with standards established by the Business Intelligence team.
In this role, you are responsible for managing and analyzing user data, audience segmentation and the performance of our content. You work closely with the business lines to identify their needs, proactively propose solutions, and provide access to data needed to meet their expectations. You constantly monitor the properties under your responsibility and highlight recommendations generated automatically or upon request, with a view to optimizing our platforms and strategies.

Your main responsibilities :

Identify our audience’s habits and needs, and optimize their experience by:
Maintaining good relationships with your internal clients by adopting an advisory stance.
Presenting your analyses and findings to a varied audience that may include product managers, strategists, media line directors and marketing/communications managers.
Identifying, cleaning up, transforming and synthesizing large volumes of data through operations performed in our Big Data environment or analytical tools.
Using industry-proven machine learning models on massive data sets (e.g., regression, time series, clustering, decision trees).
Producing and maintaining reports and dashboards in Power BI with high-impact visualizations, a relevant data model and robust automation.
Monitoring changes in the data source structure and conducting impact analyses for your area and reports/dashboards.
Working closely with the Metrics team and Big Data developers to determine the strategy for tagging and regularly processing data.
Paying special attention to privacy laws and policies.

We are looking for a candidate with the following:
Five or more years’ experience in a similar position
Graduate degree in a relevant field (business intelligence, e-commerce, marketing, etc.)
Proficiency in at least one programming language associated with data analysis (R [Tidyverse, data.table] or Python [pandas]) as well as SQL; Spark experience an asset
Proficiency with web analytics measurement tools (Adobe Analytics, Amplitude, A/B test platforms); certification an asset
Recent experience using a variety of machine learning analysis approaches (inference, supervised, unsupervised)
Proficiency with Power BI (visual design, DAX and PowerQuery/M); proficiency with an equivalent tool (Tableau, Qlik) or libraries (ggplot2/matplotlib) an asset
Familiarity with analytics for various media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, DFP, AdWords) and the DMP platform (Lotame) an asset
Keen interest in digital and emerging technologies
Ability to act in an advisory and recommendatory role with internal clients
Ability to make statistical concepts understandable to non-experts
Teamwork skills
Familiarity with Office Suite (especially Excel and PowerPoint)
Superior spoken and written French; practical knowledge of English is an asset
Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.
Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.
Please note that this is a 12-month contract position, renewable annually.
As well, it is important to distinguish that this is not a consulting mandate, but rather a regular, long-term opportunity as an employee with Radio-Canada, complete with competitive benefits.
If this sounds interesting, please click on ''Apply online''. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected will be contacted.
CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. That’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect Canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. That’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada’s public broadcaster. For more information, visit the Diversity and Inclusion section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.
You are invited to consult and familiarize yourself with our Code of Conduct, which can be found on our corporate website. All employees must adhere to the Code as a condition of employment. We also invite you to take a look at our policy on conflicts of interest. In the event that you become an employee, it will be important to inform us, as quickly as possible, of any situation that, because of your hiring, constitutes or could appear to constitute a conflict of interest.
Wherever in the wording of the job description either gender is used, it shall be understood to include all genders.
