Title: Business intelligence specialist - developer, Dartmouth
Description:
Please apply on Isarta

COMPANY :
Medavie blue Cross

POSITION :
Business intelligence specialist - developer

LOCATION:
Dartmouth
For over 75 years, Medavie Blue Cross has been a leading health and wellness partner for individuals, employers and governments across Canada. We are proud to be a not-for-profit organization dedicated to giving back to the communities where we live and work, and to ensuring our employees thrive in our award-winning, collaborative culture. We are one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures and are recognized as a Caring Company, a designation for national leaders in community investment and social responsibility.
Our team of 2,100 professionals work across six provinces. We excel by living our shared values of being caring, accountable, responsible, innovative and community-minded. We're committed to ensuring the health and wellness of our employees and their families, along with personal and professional growth, through a variety of programs and support at all levels of our organization.
Along with Medavie Health Services, we are part of Medavie
a national health organization with over 6,400 employees. Together, our mission is to improve the wellbeing of Canadians.
JOB TITLE:
Business Intelligence Specialist
Developer
Department:
Business Intelligence Services
Competition:
10980
Internal/External:
Internal/ External
Employment Type:
Full time, permanent
Location:
Dartmouth or Moncton
Salary:
Competitive Compensation
Reports To:
Team Leader
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
A fast track to understanding how Business and customer needs can be satisfied through data product delivery solutions. A Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist is a BI solution expert who has vast knowledge of BI Industry best practices in a Data Warehouse environment with business acumen. A BI Specialist is responsible for the design, development, implementation, management and support of mission-critical enterprise BI reporting, ETL, Data Modelling and Analytical solutions.
Working with cross-functional teams, you will be required to gather, document, and approve business requirements for data analysis, data integration and reporting projects for business ready solutions.
What makes us a different kind of employer? In this role, it's the opportunity to have exposure to every signal facet in our organization. Common goals and collaboration to deliver outstanding service is what our team is all about, we offer:
A diverse team of colleagues with multiple fields of expertise
A stimulating and flexible working environment
Comprehensive health and dental plan that is 100% employer paid effective on your first day
Emphasis on work life balance, providing wellness benefits, health resources and fitness center discounts
An organization where we encourage personal learning and growth
If getting involved in charitable causes is something you're passionate about, we support and offer plenty of opportunities to give back
YOUR EVERY DAY WITH US:
As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will gain an understanding of our Group, Individual and Government client benefit business, including how they are structured and managed from a technical perspective. You will interact with other key business areas such as Sales and IT and be responsible to install and manage client benefit plans effectively using our technology and your keen ability to see how elements of the plan design will interact in our information management systems.
Provide analysis to gather business and system requirements.
Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to drive data store/data warehouse/ data mart design and configurations.
Use Extract/Transfer/Load
OLTP & OLAP processes to load data store(s)/ data warehouse(s)/ data mart(s).
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and performance of enterprise data and BI environments for our customers.
Ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented for your sphere of influence
Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
SKILL AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience with Oracle and or Microsoft Database development.
Knowledge and experience in ETL Development/Data Integration with Microsoft SSIS
Knowledge and experience in Dimensional Modelling and Analytics with Microsoft SSAS
Knowledge or experience in developing and maintaining Portal Self Serve reporting in Microsoft Power BI/SSRS
Experience with Oracle PL/SQL
SQL programming, Data Mining and Analytical functions.
Technical background in the areas of Data Integration, Modelling, Security, and Enterprise Data Warehouse development.
Experience in DevOps and CICD
Support continuous improvement and adoption of best practices including Lean Agile, DevOps, Continuous Delivery Pipeline, and ITIL.
WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:
You are a good communicator
you are a clear, concise and friendly but know how to communicate to different audiences such as clients, members and internal stakeholders.
You have earned a post-secondary diploma or degree and/or relevant working experience in business, technology or engineering
You are a problem-solving master, you are able to understand client requirements and have the ability to transform this into IT solutions.
You are detailed oriented person, you like the little details with the big picture in mind.
You have been successful in roles that involve either detailed analysis, quality assurance or systems management
This role could be a good fit for someone in an HRIS, engineering/process management or IT analyst career path
We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
Medavie Blue Cross is an equal opportunity employer.
Job Segment: Business Intelligence, Database, Engineer, Oracle, Data Analyst, Technology, Engineering, Data

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DEVELOPER, BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SERVICES
Full-Time Permanent - Competition #20-55
Position Summary
We are seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our Business Intelligence Services team in Edmonton. The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for the design, development, implementation and support of enhanced reporting and analytic visualizations and dashboards. The Business Intelligence Developer will also play a key role in developing, optimizing, and maintaining ASEBP's data warehouse solutions by supporting SSIS package deployment and SSAS tabular model development. The successful candidate will work closely with other members of the Business Intelligence team on various reporting projects and initiatives.
Your Key Responsibilities
Develop solutions to reporting and information requirements by analyzing information needs and developing reports, dashboards, and visualizations for ASEBP's internal and external clients
Participate in the design of the conceptual, logical, and physical models for the data warehouse
Troubleshoot, monitor, and conduct performance improvement of the ETL
Identify any data issues with the operational ETL and work with necessary stakeholders to resolve the issues
Support SSAS Tabular model development, optimization, and deployment
Your Education and Experience
A minimum of three to five years of related experience
Completion of a two- or three-year technical certificate or diploma in a related field
A combination of education and experience may be considered.
Your Abilities
Significant experience writing complex T-SQL queries
Advanced knowledge with data visualization tools
Strong knowledge of Power BI and the DAX language
An excellent understanding of the structure of relational databases, data warehouses and their implementation
Experience working with data warehouse facts and dimensions
Proven ability to work effectively with large volumes of data, business lines and plans.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), data models, database design, SQL Server 2012 and up, SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), Visual Studio, Team Foundation Server (TFS).
Experience with ETL (Extract, Transform & Load) processes and procedures
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work both in a team and independently
Flexibility, initiative, perseverance, and integrity
Effective time management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects over varying timelines
Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
If you have the required qualifications and would like to become a member of our team, please submit your resume by November 9, 2020.
No phone calls please. We thank all interested individuals, but only those candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted. ASEBP is an equal opportunity employer.

All offers of employment for this position are conditional upon satisfactory background and reference checks, which may include a criminal record check, and/or education and employment verification.
Please note that an account will automatically be created for you during the application process if you do not have an ApplicantPro account set up already.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
The Role
Do you want to work closely with the data and processes of a successful e-commerce business? We’re looking for a data-driven Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze and elevate the way we do things. Reporting directly to our Team Lead, Business Intelligence, in this role, you’ll gain profound insights into what makes us tick – and you’ll use your knowledge of current processes to help us improve.
The Team
Our Analytics team prides itself in providing everyone at Cymax with timely, accurate, and actionable information. Our hardworking team makes this possible by collecting, analyzing and reporting data to give insight into the big picture. Whether through Business Intelligence, Data Science or Operations Research, we use our expertise in big data to facilitate business decisions.
What you’ll do:
Work with internal stakeholders to determine business requirements, priorities, and to define key performance indicators. This includes working with business and development teams to design, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports.
Gain a deep understanding of the business by seeking information beyond the surface level. You’ll investigate the source, the definition, and foundational roots of a data element in order to synthesize valuable information for the business.
Ensure that data is available to decision makers through reports that you create, as well as self-service methods. Use data to determine market and business trends to support with increasing profits and efficiency.
Collect, clean, validate and analyze complex data from multiple sources. You will be responsible for detecting patterns and problems within data and suggesting improvements that will have an immediate impact.
Build data visualizations and reports from Data Warehouse using Power BI and SSRS.
Lead training sessions with internal stakeholders to champion the efficient use of data and to roll out initiatives and improvements
Who you are:
Advanced experience and knowledge in SQL programming
Experience with visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI or Tableau
Experience with data warehouse concepts and foundations
Experience with relational and non-relational data sources
Experience/Proficiency in Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) is preferred
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Ability to balance multiple demands and work both independently and as part of a team
Creative problem solving skills with excessive attention to detail
Passion for data analysis and visualization
Experience working in a fast-paced environment with SCRUM/Agile methodologies
Prior experience working within an Ecommerce environment would be an asset
Why work here!
Based in Burnaby, BC, Cymax Group is one of North America’s largest e-commerce furniture retailers with over 230,000 furniture SKUs - making us a leader in online sales for all items home and office. We pride ourselves on our unique culture, consisting of impressive team members from all walks of life working together to contribute to the amazing growth we’ve seen. With regular company socials and tons of opportunities to learn, we strive to be the most engaging office in Canada.
We’re looking to hire talented people (like you!) to join our passionate team that will support you as you continue to advance your career.

Title: Analyst, Business intelligence
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-08
As a business intelligence analyst, you help develop and use tools and methods to collect, compile, model and restore the organization’s physical and non-physical data to establish governance, help decisionmakers understand the big picture and inform decisions.

You analyze and help diagnose issues, provide opinions in accordance with the rules for your discipline, and help develop recommendations and implementation plans. You develop tools, methods and processes. Your projects and initiatives require extensive knowledge of your line of work.

You share ideas and help solve problems using your analytical skills, extensive knowledge of your line of business and ability to manage complexity. You interact with stakeholders working in other fields.

You provide discipline-specific support to your unit, clients and partners.
Other working conditions
Number of job available : 1
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree
A minimum of two year of relevant experience
Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Collaborates, Customer Focus, Innovation
Key competencies for the job
Decision quality, Drive results, Problem solving (Inactive), Written communications (Inactive)
Work Location
150, rue des Commandeurs Lévis
Trade Union
Non Syndiqué
Unposting Date
2020-11-9
Job Family
Administration (FG)

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer, Amazon Payment Experience
Description:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or a related field
6+ years of professional experience in analytics, business analysis or comparable consumer analytics position
Advanced working knowledge of data mining using SQL, ETL, data warehouse as well as Excel
Experience using Tableau or similar reporting tools to create weekly, monthly, quarterly reports and forecasts
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment
Understanding of data modeling

Amazon’s Payment Acceptance & Experience team develops global services to create and improve the customer paying experience. Measuring customer behavior, developing insights and monitoring our success requires large amounts of data.
We’re currently looking for a smart, motivated, and driven Business Intelligence Engineer to focus on improving the success of our product. This is an opportunity to join a group with a broad charter and stakeholders across Amazon to directly influence the customer experience for Amazon products worldwide. This role offers exciting challenges and the opportunity to influence and drive a growing business area. A successful candidate loves problem solving, obsesses over data, and has a track record of using data to influence successful business decisions.

Responsibilities include:
Developing intelligent, insightful reporting on the key drivers of our business
Interacting with internal stakeholders to lead weekly business reviews and deep dive analyses
Ad-hoc project work supporting the re-invention of how we manage our business
Enabling effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Identifying process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existing metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with internal teams
Driving instrumentation as part of organization wide programs and enhancements
The expertise you’ll develop in the role:
Ability to break down and solve complex problems
Develop high impact solutions working with Data Scientists and Data Engineers focused on business intelligence
Translate massive data sets into actionable business results
Explain analysis results to senior stakeholders through verbal and written communications
Drive scalable solutions
Support new businesses strategy and growth

Masters degree is preferred (Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field)
4+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role
Experience working directly with Sr Data Scientists and Data Warehouse architects
Understanding of data warehousing and big data transformation
Experience using test / control methodology, and using machine learning techniques

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
There’s never been a more exciting time to join our team.
That’s because in January 2020, Prospera Credit Union and Westminster Savings completed the largest merger in Canadian credit union history. The merged credit union, called Prospera Credit Union, is Canada’s sixth largest, with more than $9 billion in assets under management, over 120,000 members, and full-service branch locations across the lower mainland and the Okanagan. We’re excited for the opportunities this merger brings to our members, employees, and communities. If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, apply today!
We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst for our Finance & Business Intelligence team. The Business Intelligence Analyst is the credit union’s expert resource for using a variety of advanced analytical tools and data sources to enable Prospera Credit Union to better understand Its’ operations, opportunities and threats. The Business Intelligence Analyst is also an advocate for data driven decisions and the organization by bringing his expertise on data.
What you’ll do:
Data Management and Reporting
Use internal and external data to develop analytical models to support business analytics needs.
Utilizes advanced analytics tools such as data mining, clustering and predictive models to expand and improve scoping of various initiatives.
Research resources to improve the quality of insight from data sources.
Assists with enterprise initiatives to improve the collection or categorization of data.
Develop dashboards/visualization to present data in a meaningful way.
Uses data to help design and improve various segmentation strategies on specific areas, such as credit risk and sales and customer experience.
Data Driven Decisions and Business Insights
Support various business units in driving strategy by data informed decision-making.
Assists in the preparation of financial analyses and business cases.
Tracks and reports results from various projects and initiatives.
Recommends tactics and strategies driven by data insight based on key results and findings.
Applies conceptual thinking and critical reasoning to mine data and translate business needs into business insights.
Present findings to stakeholders in the organization.
Project Management
Leads project discussions with respect to data/knowledge management solutions.
Completes specific responsibilities outlined in scope required as project leader.
Provides training and/or support to users as needed.
Works with end users and business analysts to ensure tight fit between BI environment and business requirements
What you bring:
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Business/Economics or Information Technology or technical certificate on a related discipline
Experience
3 to 5 years in a similar position, preferably on the financial industry
Competencies
Expert knowledge of database query and reporting tools (such as SQL, SSRS and PowerBI), including ability to quickly create complex queries and reports.
Expert-level analytical skills, including expertise with database analysis and statistical software tools, and applied knowledge of statistical techniques including regression, factor analysis, clustering and classification.
Expertise in utilizing advanced analytics tools, including understanding definitions and impact of business rules and inputs into data mining, clustering and predictive models
Ability to understand explicit and implicit business requirements and to creatively translate those requirements to detailed, accurate queries and reports.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate business conclusions based upon complex data analysis.
In-depth knowledge of business theory, marketing practices, research practices and product development processes.
Advanced proficiency with MS Office applications, specifically MS Excel
Ability to work independently or as part of a team and demonstrated ability at building informal mutually effective relationships with stakeholders across the organization.
Superior organizational and time-management abilities with demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects.
What’s in it for you?
Inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace: All team members are valued, respected and heard. We learn from each other’s differences, gaining strength through our people and our perspectives.
Career Advancement! We are committed to our employee’s growth and development and we want to see you soar. There are several career pathing options this position leads to, let us be your springboard.
Fun & Camaraderie. We care deeply about our members and our employees and we want the hours you spend with us to be fun, rewarding and sometimes lighthearted. We like to work hard, play hard, have fun and be there for each other.
Flexibility! This opportunity includes flexible work arrangements. Whether you work from head office, a branch, your home office or a coffee shop, we want your best work no matter where that is!
Show me the money! We offer a competitive salary, a personalized benefits program and a generous defined pension plan.
Community Focused. We care about giving back to the communities we live, work and play in. We participate in many community minded activities throughout the year.
Grow your dream with us! Be part of exciting growth happening now at Prospera. If you are attracted to a community-based, purpose-driven organization, then join us today.
This single opportunity is posted on both legacy organization websites. Please apply on one site.
www.prospera.ca/Careers
www.wscu.com/careers

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Insights
Description:
There’s never been a more exciting time to join our team.
That’s because in January 2020, Prospera Credit Union and Westminster Savings completed the largest merger in Canadian credit union history. The merged credit union, called Prospera Credit Union, is Canada’s sixth largest, with more than $9 billion in assets under management, over 120,000 members, and full-service branch locations across the lower mainland and the Okanagan. We’re excited for the opportunities this merger brings to our members, employees, and communities. If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, apply today!
We are currently seeking a Manager, Business Intelligence Insights for our Finance and Business Intelligence team. The Manager, Business Intelligence Insights provides technical direction and leadership to the Business Intelligence Insights team in the development of an enterprise-wide Business Intelligence strategy to drive and develop innovative Business Intelligence solutions for Prospera Credit Union. The Manager, Business Intelligence Insights will work with business management to ensure key decision makers in the organization have access to information that is relevant to their needs, accurate for their purpose, available in a timely manner, and shared through an efficient process to enable data-driven decision within an information-centric organization.
What you’ll do:
People Leadership
Manages the staffing requirements for the BI Insights group including hiring, training, coaching and performance management.
Works to identify BI emerging trends and best practices to develop a high performing, diverse team.
Leads by example regarding the organization’s vision and values.
Ensures the department goals are met within approved budgets.
Facilitates regular meetings with employees for communication, business or employee development, and motivational purposes.
Data Driven Decisions and Business Insights
Works closely with key stakeholders and department managers to identify analytical needs within the various functional areas.
Assist those departments in driving strategy by data informed decision-making.
Participate on the definition of proper measures to track and report results from various projects and initiatives.
Recommend tactics and strategies driven by data insight based on key results and findings
Ensures BI enhances business decision making capabilities.
Data Management and Reporting
Oversees the design, development, and accuracy of analysis and reporting.
Research resources to improve the quality of insight from data sources.
Use internal and external data to develop analytical models to support business analytics needs.
Ensures all existing reporting and analysis in use across the organization are catalogued and shared with the business.
Identifies opportunities to improve the quality of databases and works with other stakeholders to implement changes.
Utilizes advanced analytics tools such as data mining, clustering and predictive models to expand and improve scoping of various initiatives.
Examines data rich business processes to identify areas for improvement.
Coordinates and prioritizes future analytical requirements across the organization that ensure we continue to set and achieve goals and make more informed decisions.
Project Management
Leads project teams with respect to BI data/knowledge management solutions.
Develops a project plan, including project initiation and management approval; works with the project team to identify project goals and timelines and prepares a comprehensive status report, as required.
Works with end users and business analysts to ensure alignment between BI environment and business requirements.
Provides training and/or support to users as needed.
Provides support and training to BI Developers.
What you bring:
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Business/Economics, Information Technology or related discipline.
Experience
5 – 7 years’ experience of relevant experience in Business Intelligence, data analytics and associated technologies.
Competencies
Superior knowledge of the concepts of Business Intelligence including data warehousing, score carding, dashboards, data analysis, data base management and querying.
Broad experience within the Financial Services industry (preferably within the credit union system) as well as demonstrated business analytics success within other industries, if applicable.
Excellent organizational and project management skills with the ability to multitask and meet deadlines.
Ability to identify, research and resolve complex technical problems.
Demonstrated aptitude for learning and understanding the business through analysis of data.
Expert-level analytical skills, including expertise with database analysis and statistical software tools, and applied knowledge of statistical techniques including regression, factor analysis, clustering and classification.
Expertise in utilizing advanced analytics tools, including understanding definitions and impact of business rules and inputs into data mining, clustering and predictive models

Title: DEVELOPER, BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE AND DATA INTEGRATION
Manager, Business Intelligence Insights
Description:
There’s never been a more exciting time to join our team.
That’s because in January 2020, Prospera Credit Union and Westminster Savings completed the largest merger in Canadian credit union history. The merged credit union, called Prospera Credit Union, is Canada’s sixth largest, with more than $9 billion in assets under management, over 120,000 members, and full-service branch locations across the lower mainland and the Okanagan. We’re excited for the opportunities this merger brings to our members, employees, and communities. If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, apply today!
We are currently seeking a Manager, Business Intelligence Insights for our Finance and Business Intelligence team. The Manager, Business Intelligence Insights provides technical direction and leadership to the Business Intelligence Insights team in the development of an enterprise-wide Business Intelligence strategy to drive and develop innovative Business Intelligence solutions for Prospera Credit Union. The Manager, Business Intelligence Insights will work with business management to ensure key decision makers in the organization have access to information that is relevant to their needs, accurate for their purpose, available in a timely manner, and shared through an efficient process to enable data-driven decision within an information-centric organization.
What you’ll do:
People Leadership
Manages the staffing requirements for the BI Insights group including hiring, training, coaching and performance management.
Works to identify BI emerging trends and best practices to develop a high performing, diverse team.
Leads by example regarding the organization’s vision and values.
Ensures the department goals are met within approved budgets.
Facilitates regular meetings with employees for communication, business or employee development, and motivational purposes.
Data Driven Decisions and Business Insights
Works closely with key stakeholders and department managers to identify analytical needs within the various functional areas.
Assist those departments in driving strategy by data informed decision-making.
Participate on the definition of proper measures to track and report results from various projects and initiatives.
Recommend tactics and strategies driven by data insight based on key results and findings
Ensures BI enhances business decision making capabilities.
Data Management and Reporting
Oversees the design, development, and accuracy of analysis and reporting.
Research resources to improve the quality of insight from data sources.
Use internal and external data to develop analytical models to support business analytics needs.
Ensures all existing reporting and analysis in use across the organization are catalogued and shared with the business.
Identifies opportunities to improve the quality of databases and works with other stakeholders to implement changes.
Utilizes advanced analytics tools such as data mining, clustering and predictive models to expand and improve scoping of various initiatives.
Examines data rich business processes to identify areas for improvement.
Coordinates and prioritizes future analytical requirements across the organization that ensure we continue to set and achieve goals and make more informed decisions.
Project Management
Leads project teams with respect to BI data/knowledge management solutions.
Develops a project plan, including project initiation and management approval; works with the project team to identify project goals and timelines and prepares a comprehensive status report, as required.
Works with end users and business analysts to ensure alignment between BI environment and business requirements.
Provides training and/or support to users as needed.
Provides support and training to BI Developers.
What you bring:
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Business/Economics, Information Technology or related discipline.
Experience
5 – 7 years’ experience of relevant experience in Business Intelligence, data analytics and associated technologies.
Competencies
Superior knowledge of the concepts of Business Intelligence including data warehousing, score carding, dashboards, data analysis, data base management and querying.
Broad experience within the Financial Services industry (preferably within the credit union system) as well as demonstrated business analytics success within other industries, if applicable.
Excellent organizational and project management skills with the ability to multitask and meet deadlines.
Ability to identify, research and resolve complex technical problems.
Demonstrated aptitude for learning and understanding the business through analysis of data.
Expert-level analytical skills, including expertise with database analysis and statistical software tools, and applied knowledge of statistical techniques including regression, factor analysis, clustering and classification.
Expertise in utilizing advanced analytics tools, including understanding definitions and impact of business rules and inputs into data mining, clustering and predictive models
Ability to understand explicit and implicit business requirements and to creatively translate those requirements to detailed, accurate queries and reports.
What’s in it for you?
Inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace: All team members are valued, respected and heard. We learn from each other’s differences, gaining strength through our people and our perspectives.
Career Advancement! We are committed to our employee’s growth and development and we want to see you soar. There are several career pathing options this position leads to, let us be your springboard.
Fun & Camaraderie. We care deeply about our members and our employees and we want the hours you spend with us to be fun, rewarding and sometimes lighthearted. We like to work hard, play hard, have fun and be there for each other.
Flexibility! This opportunity includes flexible work arrangements. Whether you work from head office, a branch, your home office or a coffee shop, we want your best work no matter where that is!
Show me the money! We offer a competitive salary, a personalized benefits program and a generous defined pension plan.
Community Focused. We care about giving back to the communities we live, work and play in. We participate in many community minded activities throughout the year.
Grow your dream with us! Be part of exciting growth happening now at Prospera. If you are attracted to a community-based, purpose-driven organization, then join us today.
This single opportunity is posted on both legacy organization websites. Please apply on one site.
www.prospera.ca/Careers
www.wscu.com/careers

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
The Role
As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you’ll be working closely with our business stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify business needs, develop actionable insights and help the company identify risks and growth opportunities. You’ll be working to analyze and improve the way we do things, by defining requirements, and then creating B solutions.
The Team
Our empowering Analytics team collects, analyzes, and reports data to give insight into the big picture. Our goal is to provide everyone at Cymax with timely, accurate, and actionable information so whether it’s through Business Intelligence, Data Science or Operations Research, we use our expertise in big data to facilitate business decisions.
What You’ll Do:
Work with internal stakeholders to determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators, and develop BI and data warehouse strategy. This includes working with business and development teams to design and document dashboards, alerts, reports and data automation systems.
Have an understanding of the business environment and an interest in going beyond the obvious, delving into the source, the definition, and foundational roots of a data element in order to get the most out of information.
Perform industry research to clarify, define, or satisfy technology or business process issues.
Communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner across functional and technical departments. This includes suggesting areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible solutions.
Ensure that data is available to decision makers through reports that you create, as well as self-service methods. Use data to figure out market and business trends for companies to increase profits and efficiency.
Collect, clean, validate and analyze complex data from multiple sources. You will be responsible for detecting patterns and problems within data and suggesting improvements that will have immediate impact.
Actively collaborate with Data Engineers to ensure we have scalable ETLs and warehouse data models in place.
Build data visualizations and reports from Data Warehouse using Power BI and SSRS.
Drive training sessions with internal stakeholders to facilitate efficient usage of data and apply improvements accordingly.
Who you are:
Proven experience making strong recommendations in a Business Analyst role
Advanced experience and knowledge in SQL programming
Experience with visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI or Tableau
Experience with data warehouse concepts and foundations
Experience with relational and non-relational data sources
Familiar with Data Mining, Statistical and Quantitative Analysis
Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required
Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Creative problem solving skills with excessive attention to detail
Experience working in a fast-paced environment with SCRUM/Agile methodologies
Why work here!
Based in Burnaby, BC, Cymax Group is one of North America’s largest e-commerce furniture retailers with over 230,000 furniture SKUs - making us a leader in online sales for all items home and office. We pride ourselves on our unique culture, consisting of impressive team members from all walks of life working together to contribute to the amazing growth we’ve seen. With regular company socials and tons of opportunities to learn, we strive to be the most engaging office in Canada.
We’re looking to hire talented people (like you!) to join our passionate team that will support you as you continue to advance your career.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Business Intelligence Developer
For over 55 years, H&R Block has prepared taxes for millions of Canadians annually. Headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, we serve taxpayers in more than 1,000+ offices, through our upload from home service, and online with our DIY tax software. Our dedicated team of Tax Experts use the latest in electronic processing and filing technology to prepare all types of returns, including personal, small business, corporate, farm, trucker, fishing, U.S., rental and estate.
Becoming an H&R Block Associate it is an opportunity to grow with the strongest brand in the tax preparation industry. We are looking for people who want to provide help and inspire confidence in our clients and communities. We know that the ability to deliver outstanding client service starts with having the best talent on our team, and if you want to be part of our success story then we want to hear from you!
The Opportunity:
The role will report to the Director, Analytics & Business Insights and will be responsible to partner with the business leadership team and other key stakeholders. The selected candidate will be driven to achieve a high standard of excellence, motivated by challenges and have a passion for analytics. As a Data & Modeling Analyst, you will focus on delivering action-oriented insights and recommendations designed to achieve business objectives.
The candidate will be responsible for developing reporting infrastructure, reports, dashboards and data models to deliver decision-focused insights using a variety of tools and platforms including Power BI, Tableau, SSRS, AWS, and Snowflake. Strong SQL, data modeling, analysis, and visualization design skills are prerequisites for this role.
Key areas of Responsibility:
The primary focus of this position is to provide decision-focused insights, developing reporting infrastructure, reports, dashboards and data models.
Designing, developing and implementing advanced dashboards, reports, KPI scorecards using BI Tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Cognos
Descriptive and predictive modeling on account and client metrics, unit volume, revenue and margin
Assisting with the construction and implementation of the data warehouse, data marts and reporting views
Evaluate, interpret and communicate data and client models in the form of decision-focused insights
Communicate effectively with business users and internal teams to deliver on technical requirements and to document data flow, reporting logic and business processes
Development of client segmentation views and targeting profiles for both our online and retail businesses
Post-campaign and promotion analytics / ROI analysis for online and retail businesses
Provide support to other team members and business intelligence platform users
Other responsibilities as assigned.
Key Qualifications:
A degree in Business, Data Modeling, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or equivalent experience
A minimum of 10 years experience in Data Modeling or Analytics
Strong understanding of database systems and advanced working knowledge of data mining techniques using SQL
Comprehensive understanding of BI and Data Warehouse design principles, techniques, and standards.
Proficient with SSRS. SSIS and SSAS experience is an asset.
Proficient in developing, publishing and scheduling the distribution of reports and visual insights using BI Tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Cognos following data visualization best practices
Experience working with structured and unstructured data sets, including JSON and XML
Experience with AWS, Azure, or Snowflake analytic cloud solutions
Ability to translate analytical, financial and client data into actionable insights to inform business decision making
Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong competency with Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint in particular)
Ability to proficiently deal with multiple competing priorities
Strong critical thinker with an aptitude for problem-solving and dealing with ambiguity
Working knowledge in different programming/scripting languages (e.g. R, Python, Javascript) is an asset
Do you have an innovative and passionate approach to learning along with the skills and qualifications required for this GREAT opportunity?
If so, we invite you to send your resume to employment.opportunities@hrblock.ca
H&R Block fosters a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated and respected. Successful candidates must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for any employer. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.
October 19, 2020

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst / Engineer
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst / Engineer

As a member of the Business Intelligence & Analytics team, the successful candidate will possess very strong technical and analytical skills to gather and analyze all forms of data in detail. You will support the cloud base enterprise data warehouse maintenance and modernization through your advanced knowledge of data orchestration, ingestion, and reporting. You will identify the business needs and requirements, assemble data sets through efficient data processing pipelines that balance speed and reliability. You will develop automated reporting solutions and deliver analytical results for the business across the company. You will be a key contributor who enables Aurora to make data driven decisions.
Join an enthusiastic team that always enjoys learning, working collaboratively, and solving complex business problems with data.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Maintain strong relationships with business stakeholders and work closely with Data Scientists, Analysts and Developers to ensure business needs are addressed.
Automate reporting solutions and operationalize machine learning models.
Implement optimised pipelines to extract and merge data sets from multiple sources.
Perform data cleansing and transformation using advanced Azure tools.
Work with the team to deploy new cloud-based reporting and analytics tools.
Set up automated deployment processes.
Implement data process improvements such as optimizing data delivery and scalability.
Execute multiple tasks simultaneously while exhibiting professionalism to ensure an incredible stakeholder experience.
JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Very strong experience in database systems including data warehouses and multi-dimensional analytic solutions.
Deep understanding of cloud technologies and infrastructure for data retention and processing such as Microsoft Azure Data Lake, Functions, Data Factory and Databricks.
Strong experience with Microsoft Azure data ingestion. Demonstrated via hands-on project experience.
Experience in managing and deploying code to cloud services, including Azure DevOps experience.
Proficiency in scripting and programming using Python, C#.
Working knowledge of Linux, Visual Studio.
Hand on experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Hand on experience with Microsoft Power Suite – Power Apps and Power BI.
Knowledge in statistics and data mining.
Strong Agile project execution experience with proven ability to prioritize and manage time.
We would like to thank all applicants for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Aurora Cannabis Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Full-Stack/Business Intelligence Developer / Développeur gén...
Description:
THE ROLE
Develops, tests, integrates, supports and maintains applications following the standards of the development cycle system.

THE CHALLENGE
Works independently and delivers high-quality code in a timely manner across a variety of project engagements.
Participates in multiple phases of projects, including requirements gathering, software design, development and testing.
Interfaces with internal and external developer teams, designers and business users.
Demonstrates an understanding of application coding, performance, scalability, reliability and security.
Successfully implements new products and solutions to all channels (on-time deliveries; on-budget projects; business case benefits realized).
Resolves production issues identified with solutions supported by development team.
Ensures that the site performance, page load times and element counts implemented with designed solution all meet standards set by client technical teams.

THE PROFILE
Minimum five (5) years of development experience
Extensive experience in BI development
Expert knowledge of C#, ASP.NET, .Net Framework 4.0 and above
Experience integrating Web service calls and/or RESTful APIs
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL, stored procedures, SSIS and SSRS
Knowledge of MVC and other design patterns
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodology
Experience working with e-commerce platforms like Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Knowledge in JavaScript, Node.js, jQuery, HTML 4.x/5.x, CSS 3.0, XML programming languages
Solid understanding of UI objects and coding for reuse
Proficient with object-oriented programming, including software design
Good communication skills, both written and verbal
Bilingualism.

THE PERKS
Benefit from a competitive total compensation program.
Enjoy a 50% off discount card valid on all Laura and Melanie Lyne styles.
Recharge your batteries with paid vacation time and floater days.
Enjoy our summer hours (half-day Fridays), and get to leave an hour early on Fridays the rest of the year.
Benefit from our employee referral program, offering a significant monetary reward for the right candidate.
Parking provided on site.

ABOUT US
Laura Canada is an iconic and innovative family-owned retailer housing two leading women’s fashion apparel brands, Laura and Melanie Lyne. Based in Laval, Quebec, we design, produce, market and distribute quality apparel across Canada. We proudly employ over 2,000 dedicated team members and operate more than 140 locations and two online stores. We attribute our success to the unwavering commitment of our team to delivering outstanding customer experiences while embodying our shared values of integrity, respect, teamwork, performance, and passion.
At Laura Canada, we believe that delivering an outstanding customer experience is driven by our commitment to an outstanding employee experience.

We are truly humbled that you can see yourself working in the role and appreciate your application. We’ll reach out directly to those we’d like to meet for an interview.

-
LE RÔLE
Développe, teste, intègre, supporte et tient à jour les applications en respectant les normes du cycle de développement des systèmes.

LE DÉFI
Travaille de façon autonome et produit rapidement des codes d’exécution de haute qualité pour une variété de projets.
Participe à plusieurs phases des projets, incluant le recensement des exigences, la conception, le développement et le test des logiciels.
Interagit avec les équipes de développeurs, les concepteurs et les utilisateurs à l’interne et à l’externe.
Comprend le rendement, le codage, l’extensibilité, la fiabilité et la sécurité des applications.
Implante avec succès de nouveaux produits et solutions pour tous les canaux (livraison dans les délais, projets respectant le budget, réalisation d’analyses de rentabilité).
Règle les problèmes de production identifiés avec des solutions soutenues par l’équipe de développement.
S’assure que la performance du site, le temps de chargement des pages et les comptes d’éléments respectent les normes établies par les équipes techniques du client.

LE PROFIL
Minimum de cinq (5) années d’expérience en développement
Vaste expérience dans le développement de la BI
Connaissance approfondie de C#, ASP.NET, .Net Framework 4.0 et versions ultérieures
Expérience en intégration d’appels de service Web et de RESTful APIs
Connaissance de Microsoft SQL, des procédures stockées, de SSIS et de SSRS
Connaissance de MVC et autres modèles de conception
Connaissance de la méthodologie Agile/Scrum
Une expérience avec les plates-formes de commerce électronique comme Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Connaissance des langages de programmation JavaScript, Node.js, jQuery, HTML, 4.x/5.x, CSS 3.0, XML
Bonne compréhension des objets et des codes des interfaces utilisateur pour réutilisation
Compétent en matière de programmation orientée objet, incluant la conception de logiciels
Bonnes aptitudes en communication écrite et verbale
Bilingue

LES AVANTAGES

Bénéficiez d'un programme de rémunération globale concurrentiel.
Profitez d'un escompte de 50 % sur toute la marchandise de Laura et Melanie Lyne.
Rechargez vos batteries grâce à des vacances payées et des jours de congé mobiles.
Disposez de vos après-midis tous les vendredis d'été et finissez une heure plus tôt les autres vendredis.
Recevez une récompense en argent pour avoir recommandé un bon candidat grâce à notre programme de prime de recrutement.
Stationnement sur place.

À PROPOS DE NOUS
Laura Canada est une entreprise familiale iconique et innovatrice qui exploite Laura et Melanie Lyne, deux grandes bannières de vêtements pour femmes. Établie à Laval, au Québec, Laura Canada conçoit, produit, commercialise et distribue des vêtements de qualité partout au Canada. Nous sommes fiers d’employer plus de 2 000 collègues dévoués et d’exploiter plus de 140 magasins et deux boutiques en ligne. Notre succès repose sur l’engagement inconditionnel de notre équipe à offrir une expérience client exceptionnelle tout en incarnant nos valeurs d’intégrité, de respect, d’esprit d’équipe, de performance et de passion.
Nous croyons qu’une expérience client exceptionnelle est motivée par notre engagement à offrir une expérience exceptionnelle à nos employés.

Nous sommes vraiment honorés que vous puissiez vous voir dans ce rôle et nous vous remercions de votre candidature. Nous communiquerons uniquement avec les personnes que nous souhaitons rencontrer pour une entrevue.

Le genre masculin est utilisé comme générique, dans le seul but de ne pas alourdir le texte.

Title: Analyste développeur Power BI | Business Intelligence Develo...
Description:
Mandat:
Relevant du Responsable ERP et Analytics, vous ferez partie d'une équipe dynamique, responsable de l'entretien, l'amélioration et le développement de divers rapports et tableaux de bord, en utilisant une variété de logiciels d’intelligence d'affaires, avec un intérêt particulier pour l’outil Power BI.
Vos fonctions quotidiennes incluent:
Regrouper et Valider les exigences technologiques et fonctionnelles
Travailler conjointement avec les autres membres de l’équipe et les différentes parties prenantes de la compagnie
Élaborer des solutions ainsi que leur développement, validation et déploiement
Développement de rapport et tableaux de bord selon le plan de projet préétabli et les priorités
Offrir un soutien technique et un support à l'utilisateur au de besoin
Exigences:
Expérience (5 ans) en analyse de données, développement de rapports d’intelligence d’affaire dans une moyenne ou grande compagnie
Forte connaissance et expérience en analyse et développement de modèles de données et en création d’indicateurs de performance ( KPI) selon les besoins clients
Connaissance avancée dans l’écriture de script SQL complexes
Expérience avec Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power Bi Services)
Expérience avec les outils Microsoft BI (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS) et d’autres technologies de BI
Familiarité avec les écosystèmes d’intelligence d’affaire: bases de données, ETL, cubes, entrepôt de données
Connaissance de Flux de Données et autres outils de la Power Platform, un atout
Connaissance des technologies Oracle un atout
Connaissance et expérience de travail avec des données financières et/ou reliés au monde du transport et logistique un atout
Ce que vous offrez:
Un résolveur de problèmes très efficace avec la possibilité de formuler des solutions créatives à des problèmes complexes
Souci du détail avec une passion pour la qualité technique, la documentation et l'excellence du service à la clientèle
Excellentes compétences en relations interpersonnel et en gestion de projet
Bien organisé et capable de travailler à la fois en équipe et individuellement
Ce que nous offrons:
Un employeur d’opportunité égale
Rémunération concurrentiel
Régime complet d’assurance de soins dentaires et de santé
Un équilibre entre le travail et la vie familiale
___________________________________________________________________________________________

Mandate:
Reporting to the ERP and Analytics Manager, you will be part of a dynamic and energetic team responsible for the maintenance, enhancement and development of BI reports and dashboards using a variety of BI software, with main focus on Power BI tool.
Daily tasks consist of but not limited to:
Gathering and Validating technological and functional requirements
Working closely with other members of the team and various business stakeholders from the company
Designing solutions as well as their development, testing, and deployment
Developing reports and dashboards according to predefined planning and priorities
Offering technical and end user support when needed
Requirements:
Experience ( 5 years) in data analysis developing business intelligence and reporting in medium to large enterprise
Strong knowledge and experience in analyzing as well as designing data models and creating KPIs that meet the reporting needs
Advance knowledge of writing complex SQL queries
Power BI experience (Power Query, DAX, Power Bi Services)
Experience with Microsoft BI Stack (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS) and other BI stack of technologies
Familiarity with business intelligence’s technical ecosystem: databases, ETL, cubes, data warehouse,
Experience with Dataflow and other Power Platform, an asset
Expert knowledge of Oracle Stack an asset
Knowledge and experience working with Finance data and/or transport and logistics data an asset
What You Offer:
A highly effective problem solver with the ability to formalize creative, out-of-the-box solutions to complex problems;
Keen eye for details with a passion for technical quality, documentation and client service excellence
Possess excellent personnel and project management skills
Well-organized and able to work both as part of a team and individually
What We Offer:
Equal opportunity employer
Competitive compensation
Comprehensive health and dental care
Balance between work and home life

Title: Leader, Business Intelligence & Processes
Leader, Business Intelligence & Processes
Senior business intelligence analyst, Winnipeg
Description:
Please apply on Isarta

COMPANY :
Priceline

POSITION :
Senior business intelligence analyst

LOCATION:
Winnipeg
Senior BI Analysts are responsible for identifying and reporting on patterns of partnership distribution behavior that have a direct impact on the profitability. Through the use of large and ever-growing data sets, analysts develop actionable insights and help the company identify risks and growth opportunities. Distribution requires continuous monitoring and interpretation of trends to help Priceline.com protect and grow its bottom line.
Reporting to the Director of Revenue Management (strategic partnerships) you will be merging and analyzing data across a variety of schemas to derive models and business-process tools that generate insight. You will be a key member of the partnership operations team and the analytics and reporting you produce will result in direct improvement of Priceline's bottom line. You will help product owners and development teams visualize the probable outcomes associated with projects and their products.
IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:
Analyze and stitch together diverse sets of data to identify actionable insights for product, process and business leaders.
Build a portfolio of key performance indicators for growth and risk-mitigation trends, as well as sustainable monitoring tools and reporting to validate findings.
Develop, interpret, and communicate consumer KPIs with finance and product management teams.
Integrate high quality data sources to enable precise, near ?real-time? decision making on all inbound transactions.
Select, prioritize, and drive projects that will extend the capabilities of the operations, product and analytics teams.
Collaborate with several teams, understand their business needs and translate them into actionable data analysis and reports, often with little guidance
Organize and present your findings in a meaningful way to make sure your stakeholders are able to make the right decision
WHO YOU ARE:
Bachelor's degree in math, economics, a quantitative field, or requisite experience
4-7 years of data analysis experience
2-3 years of unstructured/ big data analytics.
Strong proficiency in SQL (Oracle)
Proficiency with data analysis and visualization tools (particularly Tableau)
Proven analytical ability and strong proficiency in Excel
A self-starter who is confident and able to move projects forward with little direction.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills from product specifications, to JIRA tickets, to stakeholder presentations.
Equal enthusiasm for high-level strategic planning and tactical daily execution.
A desire to work in a fast-paced, results driven environment with multiple responsibilities.
Capability to validate and accurately explain results of analysis.
Must be organized, positive, proactive, results-oriented, with excellent communication and problems solving skills
Demonstrated history of living the values important to priceline: Customer, Innovation, Team, Accountability and Trust. Unquestionable integrity and ethics.
WHO WE ARE:
About Priceline Partner Network, a division of Priceline.com
Our mission is ?Helping people experience the world? and our business and market sector is growing rapidly.
As a part of the Priceline Group we are a member of the world's leading and most valuable travel group. Companies that fall under the Priceline Group umbrella include: Booking.com, Priceline.com, Kayak, Agoda and OpenTable.
The Priceline Group is the third largest e-commerce company in the world (behind Amazon and Alibaba). In 2015, Priceline was one of Fortunes ?most admired companies? for the third year in a row, behind only Alphabet (Google), Facebook and Amazon in the tech space. Priceline Partner Network is the distribution arm of Priceline.com and is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.
WORKING WITH US:
We are proud to offer a casual, fun and fast-paced work environment at a company that is growing rapidly. You have the opportunity to contribute to our strategic direction and see your analysis have a real financial impact on our bottom line. We also offer a competitive compensation and benefit plan.
BENEFITS OF JOINING OUR TEAM
Brand new office in Downtown Winnipeg
A casual, fun, and fast-paced work environment at a company that is growing rapidly
Subsidized parking and gym membership
Competitive base salary and consistently aggressive bonus
Excellent health, dental, and vision coverage
Annual conference or training opportunity
Employer RRSP matching
Modern hardware and software to work with
Regular team and company-wide events
Travel opportunities for training and collaboration with our team members in other offices
We're excited that you are interested in a career with us. For all current employees , please use the internal portal to find jobs and apply.
External candidates are required to have an account before applying. When you click Apply, returning candidates can log in or new candidates can quickly create an account to save/view applications.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Our Technology team is the backbone of our company: constantly creating, testing, learning and iterating to better meet the needs of our customers. If you thrive in a fast-paced, ideas-led environment, you’re in the right place.

Through the use of large and ever-growing data sets, analysts develop actionable insights and help the company identify risks and growth opportunities. Reporting to the Director of Revenue Management (strategic partnerships) you will be merging and analyzing data across a variety of schemas to derive models and business-process tools that generate insight. In this role you will get to:
Analyze and stitch together diverse sets of data to identify actionable insights for product, process and business leaders.

Select, prioritize, and drive projects that will extend the capabilities of the operations, product and analytics teams.
Collaborate with several teams, understand their business needs and translate them into actionable data analysis and reports, often with little guidance

A self-starter who is confident and able to move projects forward with little direction.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills – from product specifications, to JIRA tickets, to stakeholder presentations.
Equal enthusiasm for high-level strategic planning and tactical daily execution.
A desire to work in a fast-paced, results driven environment with multiple responsibilities.
Capability to validate and accurately explain results of analysis.
Must be organized, positive, proactive, results-oriented, with excellent communication and problems solving skills
Demonstrated history of living the values important to priceline: Customer, Innovation, Team, Accountability and Trust. Unquestionable integrity and ethics.
Who we are:

WE ARE PRICELINE.
Our success as one of the biggest players in online travel is all thanks to our incredible, dedicated team of talented employees. Priceliners are focused on being the best travel deal makers in the world, fueled by our passion to help everyone experience the moments that matter most in their lives. Whether it’s a dream vacation, your cousin’s graduation, or your best friend’s wedding - we make travel affordable and accessible to our customers.
Our culture is unique and inspiring (that’s what our employees tell us). We’re a grown-up, startup. We deliver the excitement of a new venture, without the struggles and chaos that can come with a business that hasn’t stabilized.
We’re on the cutting edge of innovative technologies. We keep the customer at the center of all that we do. Our ability to meet their needs relies on the strength of a workforce as diverse as the customers we serve. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.
If you want to be part of something truly special, check us out!
Priceline is part of the Booking Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: BKNG) family of companies. Our sister companies include Booking, BookingGo, Agoda, Kayak and OpenTable.
Priceline ensures equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without discrimination or harassment based on race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
We're excited that you are interested in a career with us. For all current employees , please use the internal portal to find jobs and apply.
External candidates are required to have an account before applying. When you click Apply, returning candidates can log in or new candidates can quickly create an account to save/view applications.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst / Analyste en intelligence d'a...
Description:
Français à la suite...
The Role
The conversations we enable between brands and consumers create a wealth of behavioural and e-commerce data. We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with early stage experience, who loves the complexity of diagnosing performance issues in a constantly evolving product. The core BI job to be done at Automat is to balance both customer and larger scale product success. Because of this the analyst will be working hand in hand with both client deployments and product development. On the customer deployment side, the job to be done is to be able to create reliable data reporting for our customers, and to quickly and reliably diagnose where and how the product is not delivering expected results. On the product side, the job is to help structure and validate iterative product experiments and to present data driven opportunities for iterative product improvement.


About You
You have experience in helping early to mid-stage products grow through the analysis you have been able to provide to past clients. You are particularly skilled at seeing large patterns that relate to and effect business results. You are not afraid of digging into a data set that is in flux and evolving. You have practice experience in working closely with product design teams and can demonstrate past instances where your analysis has helped product design change course. You love hypothesis-driven development and are great at creating frameworks for running and validating results. You are unafraid to diagnose problems with an incomplete data set and are equally unafraid to acknowledge the points of uncertainty you encounter in the process.
When problems arise, you demonstrate outcome-first diagnostic skills. When things are good you are great at using data to point out places where the data shows meaningful gains can be made in terms of product success. You rarely miss the forest for the trees.
You are a storyteller who can prepare and present your findings in a format that is visually appealing and easily digestible to our customers, drawing on your experience with other projects to provide actionable recommendations that will unlock value and business opportunity


A Day in the Life of Business Intelligence Analyst at Automat
You'll be responsible for collecting, maintaining and analyzing data that can be translated into insights to guide our business strategy as well as inform product development efforts.
You support day-to-day requests for data analysis such as decision support and KPI's and provide quality assurance.
You work side-by-side with the business stakeholders, iterating on the analytical work in an agile fashion to deliver insights.
You understand data landscape (tooling, tech stack, source systems etc.) and work closely with the Engineering/R&D team to improve the quality of data collection.
You define and identify macro and micro levels trends with statistical significance on a regular basis and understand the key drivers related to those trends.
You develop dashboards to inform business decisions with an emphasis on automation and scalability.
You find actionable strategic insights through funnels, cohort analyses, user segmentation, regression models and more.
You constantly look for improvements in tools, data sources, data quality and analytics techniques.
You will work with the Product to generate and validate hypothesis driven experiments.


Qualifications
Must have 3-5 years of experience in data analytics with a focus on retail and e-commerce
Bachelor's degree in a related field (ideally Computer Science, Economics, Math, Statistics or another quantitative discipline)
Strong analytical, creative problem-solving and storytelling skills
Experience building dashboards - you know the trade-offs and impacts of using one metric versus another
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau, Google Data Studio or similar platforms
Experience with analytics-based platforms like Google Analytics or Google Tag Manager
Good understanding databases, data warehousing and data lake architecture
Exceptional attention to detail
Understanding of omni-channel customer behavior to drive a unified view of the overall experience
Communication skills and empathy to understand and discover business pain points and build solutions to improve the user experience
Ability to work with key stakeholders across Automat in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Self-motivated and customer-oriented
Demonstrate attention to quality, precision and ethics
Be able to thrive in small and flexible teams
Demonstrate a high degree of proactivity adapting to a quickly evolving data landscape


What We Offer
A culture of autonomy, accountability, and excellence. This is a place where you are free to be the best version of yourself and do your best work.
Full health coverage for you and your family, including dental, medical and vision packages.
Competitive salary and equity for all employees.
A flexible “work from home” policy.
Great career development opportunities.


About Automat
Automat is helping companies use AI to talk to their customers, to understand them and serve them better. We're the first Conversational platform powered by artificial intelligence and we believe in a world where every company can have a personalized one-on-one conversation with every customer, fan, and follower.

Le Poste
Les interactions que nous suscitons entre nos clients et leurs consommateurs génèrent une grande quantité de données comportementales et transactionnelles. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un analyste en intelligence d'affaires compétent pour se joindre à Automat et nous aider à générer des données analytiques et développer des pratiques exemplaires à partir de zéro. Pour réussir, le candidat retenu doit avoir une grande expérience avec les données et un sens aigu des affaires et des produits afin de présenter des renseignements attrayants et hautement stratégiques qui nous permettront d'accélérer notre croissance et d'orienter notre prise de décisions relativement aux produits au sein d'Automat.
À Votre Sujet
Transformer les données en renseignements qui guideront notre façon de diriger notre entreprise vous passionne. Vous êtes fier de votre capacité à communiquer clairement vos conclusions dans des rapports et des présentations visuellement attrayants. Vous avez une compréhension de base des statistiques et de l'expérience en analyses avancées, y compris dans les méthodes de test, la segmentation et la modélisation.
Vous êtes un « storyteller » hors-pair qui peut préparer et présenter ses conclusions dans un format facile à assimiler par nos clients en vous basant sur votre expérience sur d'autres projets et avez la capacité de présenter des recommandations débouchant sur des mesures concrètes qui généreront de la valeur pour Automat et nos clients ainsi que de nouvelles opportunités d'affaire.



Une Journée dans la vie d'un Analyste de en intelligence d'affaires chez Automat
Vous serez responsable de la collecte, du maintien et de l'analyse de données qui peuvent être transformées en renseignements qui guideront notre stratégie d'affaires et nos efforts relatifs au développement de produits.
Vous répondez aux demandes quotidiennes d'analyses de données, comme l'aide à la prise de décisions, l'analyse d'indicateurs de performance (KPIs). Vous vous occupez aussi de l'assurance de la qualité.
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes de l'entreprise et adoptez une approche agile dans votre travail.
Vous comprenez bien le domaine des données (outils, technologies, plateformes, etc.) et travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de R&D et de l'ingénierie afin d'améliorer la qualité de la collecte de données.
Vous définissez et relevez les tendances aux niveaux micro et macro qui ont une signification statistique et comprenez les principaux facteurs associés à ces tendances.
Vous développez des tableaux de bord en vue de guider nos décisions d'affaire avec un accent sur l'automatisation et l'extensibilité.
Vous trouvez des informations clés stratégiques débouchant sur des mesures concrètes au moyen d'analyse d'entonnoirs, de méthodes des cohortes, de segmentation des utilisateurs, de modèles de régression et autres.
Vous recherchez sans cesse à améliorer les outils, les sources de données, la qualité des données et les techniques d'analyse.
Qualifications
Avoir de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience en analyse de données, surtout en commerce de détail et en commerce électronique.
Baccalauréat dans un domaine connexe (de préférence en informatique, économie, mathématique, statistique ou autre discipline quantitative).
Solides compétences en analyse, résolution de problèmes et narration.
Expérience dans le développement de tableaux de bord; vous connaissez les risques et les incidences du choix d'un indicateur de performance (KPI) par rapport à un autre.
Expérience de la visualisation de données et des outils de création de rapports comme Tableau, Google Data Studio ou autres plateformes similaires.
Expérience avec les plateformes d'analyse comme Google Analytics ou Google Tag Manager.
Bonne compréhension des bases de données, du stockage de données et des « data lakes ».
Souci du détail hors du commun.
Compréhension du comportement des clients omni-canaux pour obtenir une vue unifiée de l'expérience globale.
Compétences en communication et capacité de comprendre et relever les sources d'irritation et de trouver des solutions pour améliorer l'expérience client.
Capacité à travailler avec des intervenants clés chez Automat dans un environnement dynamique et collaboratif.
Personne motivée et axée sur le client.
Souci de la qualité, de la précision et des normes éthiques.
Être capable de s'épanouir dans un environnement de travail avec de petites équipes.
À propos d'Automat
Automat aide les entreprises à utiliser l'intelligence artificielle pour s'entretenir avec leurs clients, les comprendre et mieux les servir. Nous sommes la première plateforme de marketing conversationnel optimisée par intelligence artificielle et croyons en un monde où toutes les entreprises peuvent avoir des entretiens individuels avec chaque client, partisan et abonné.
