Title: Senior Product (Business Intelligence) Analyst
Description:
Abou the role:
The Student Lending business is a key part of Finastra overall strategy in continuing to deliver on the needs of the governments and students across the country. Reporting to the Senior Manager Product Management, the Product Analyst is responsible for the review, analysis and evaluation of the product across all stages of the Product Lifecycle (Phases: Ideation, Development, and Management). The Product Analyst will ensure cross-functional alignment of efforts to ensure the product line meets business needs and is consistent with Finastra objectives. They will maintain a focus on increasing the profitability of existing product and developing new products, create detailed requirement documentation, functional design specifications, system and training documentation and support system testing for the product.
What you'll do:
Manage the product backlog for Business Intelligence and Analytics scrum team.
Work closely internal stakeholders (Scrum Masters, Dev, QA, and Product) and end users to understand, analyze and gather/validate business and user requirements.
Within every sprint, work closely with the scrum team to ensure they understand the business problem, who the targeted users are and the impact of user stories on the product as a whole.
Ensure that delivered code is in the spirit of the user story validating that the customer/end user experience is captured and value is delivered. Monitor the progression of each product through the product lifecycle, engaging key internal and external stakeholders and escalating to Product Manager when required
Determine fulfillment of acceptance criteria and offer advice to the Product Manager regarding acceptance of stories.
Supports and owns SCRUM events, including but not limited to, managing/prioritizing the backlog, accepting user stories, and sprint/Program increment demos to both internal and external stakeholders.
Support leadership in meeting timelines, implementing work activities and maintaining artifacts as required
Work with cross-functional groups to understand reporting requirements and solution design.
Work closely with the Product Manager overseeing the Business Intelligence and Analytics work package to prioritize the features/user stories to align to the contract requirements.
What you'll need:
Skills and Knowledge:
Analytical: sound analytical and problem solving skills as well as proven time management
Effective influence and negotiation skills
Strong writing skills, including technical writing
Excellent verbal communication and presentation skills for working with internal and external clients
Well-developed organizational and human relations skills
A combination of being business and technical savvy, having a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality
Able to think strategically and get into the details
Proven ability to work with and influence cross-functional teams, and able to deliver effectively as an individual contributor
Proven ability to effectively communicate with several types and levels of staff, both internally and externally
Proven ability to effectively work simultaneously on many priorities, which change frequently
Required Experience:
3-5 years’ experience as a Product Owner, managing a product backlog, preferably with experience in the Business Intelligence and Analytics space (Power BI preferred) and within a SaaS environment
Experience in Data Mapping, data modeling.
5 years of Financial Industry experience; specifically in software development.
Proven success in being able to work with clients and internal stakeholders to deliver actionable insights through best in class BI dashboards and visualizations.
Post-Secondary Education (with a degree in business or technology is an asset)
Understanding of cloud-based solutions (preferably Azure)
Experience working with Mainframe technology datasets (asset)
Experience in working in AGILE Delivery environment. SAFe Product Owner Certification is an asset.
Experience in Lending necessary to understand the business concepts and goals of loan administration (Student Lending Product Knowledge/Experience would be an asset)
Experience working with project management software application analysis, design or implementation (knowledge of project management principles).
Proven track record of product management accomplishments and initiatives with demonstrated success in product launches and end-to-end execution of marketing strategies.
#LI-MG1

Title: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence & Analytics
Description:
Do you want to be on a dynamic team that will Conquer Cancer In Our Lifetime? We are seeking a Data Analyst who is ready to work in a fast-paced environment and is passionately inspired to utilize their data and analytics skills to help us deliver on our mission. The newly established analytics function’s core purpose is to deliver the right insights, to the right people, at the right time, that informs decision making to drive value – and we want you to help us.
This is not just about the role itself, but is equally about the opportunity for impact. This role presents a unique opportunity to join one of the top fundraising teams in Canada as we advance on our vision (which will be your vision): To Conquer Cancer in Our Lifetime.
About The Princess Margaret Cancer Foundation
As one of the world’s leading cancer charities, The PMCF raises funds for Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, one of the top 5 cancer research centres in the world, to deliver future care now.
For more than a decade, The PMCF has been on an aggressive growth trajectory. Setting daring and audacious goals is a mindset that is driven by our culture and passion to perform. We have pioneered many successful fundraising programs, including our world-leading Princess Margaret Home Lottery, and some of the world’s largest cancer fundraising events. The foundation’s vision, which will be your vision, is to Conquer Cancer in Our Lifetime.
The Princess Margaret is a proud member of University Health Network, Canada’s largest research hospital network, which also includes Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Toronto Rehab Institute and The Michener Institute for Education.
About the Role
The Data Analyst role, reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence & Analytics, will be a key member of the team, supporting the Foundation-wide data governance, analytics, and reporting services. In this role, under the guidance of the Director, the individual will seek to understand the informational needs of each business area and the organization as a whole, and will work with the team to deliver the multi-year analytics roadmap focused on modeling, list management, analysis, reporting, and data quality. We are seeking a highly motivated individual who is a proactive and resourceful problem solver, with a natural analytical way of thinking, who will see this position as a great opportunity to drive improvements in business performance as a result of being a data driven organization.
You will:
Under the guidance of the Director, work with key business stakeholders within the fundraising, events, and marketing teams, and across the whole organization, to encourage the use of data and reporting to improve decision making
Help partner with leaders to discover and articulate analytical needs; define business intelligence opportunities which synthesize the data that is available into meaningful insights, driving tangible business results for the whole organization
Develop and effectively deploy statistical models to improve results, create efficiencies, and reduce costs
Assist in implementing effective list managements practices: optimizing the list build process, tracking list usage, reporting on results, and recommending improvements on subsequent iterations
Proactively consult with business teams across the foundation to translate marketing testing strategies across online and offline channels, into clearly defined A/B testing requirements, and measure/validate the significance of the tests
Analyze the performance of customer journeys and conversion (donation/registration) flows and communicate campaign optimization results to stakeholders
Assist in building dashboards with key performance metrics across each of our businesses
Support the Foundation’s data quality initiative by partnering with data engineering and business partners to maintain the integrity of our master data which is critical to ensure reliable analysis
You have:
Bachelor’s degree is required, preferably in mathematics, statistical methods, data science, engineering, or related field
Proficiency in statistical analysis, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms
Experience using Power BI, or other data visualization technology
Experience with list management, data management, or a related field
Experience with Blackbaud Raiser’s Edge considered an asset
Experience with translating, simplifying, communicating, and presenting data insights to stakeholders
Proficiency with SQL
Utilized advanced statistical techniques such as Linear & Logistic Regression, Clustering, and Decision Trees in order to turn data into insights which can be quickly adopted by various business units across the organization
Experience with analytical tools and technologies (Python, SAS, SPSS, and/or R)
Experience with digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics, SiteImprove, and Cookies/Tagging Methodologies
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Why work with us?
Experience a sense of purpose that you won’t get anywhere else, in any other job. You will be making a difference for millions of people impacted by cancer
We have an open and approachable culture that enables you to bring your best ideas forward
We will invest in your growth through ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and education assistance programs
We offer flexible working arrangements to support your need to balance life at work and at home

If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.
Posting date: October 16, 2020 Closing date: Until Filled
For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.
University Health Network thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.
Chez Premier Tech, nous sommes constamment en croissance. À force de grandir, les projets que nous avons à offrir à nos équipiers se multiplient et se diversifient. Et nos équipes en information de gestion en profitent pleinement! Si vous êtes passionné et aimez être occupé, ce poste est pour vous! Ne vous en faites pas, tous ces projets se font en collaboration avec une super équipe expérimentée, créative et déjà bien en place.
Afin de nous aider dans tous ces beaux mandats, nous recherchons un Développeur en intelligence d’affaires pour se joindre à l’équipe d’information de gestion de notre groupe d’affaires Systèmes Automatisés. Quelqu’un qui enrichira son expertise (si ce n’est déjà fait!) dans le développement en intelligence d’affaires (BI), et ce, en nous aidant à améliorer notre plateforme BI.
Voici le défi que l’on vous propose :
Vous jouerez un rôle de premier plan dans la modélisation des données (Data Warehouse, ETL) ainsi que dans le développement de rapports et de tableaux de bord.
Vous serez appelé à travailler en étroite collaboration avec notre Analyste en intelligence d'affaires afin de proposer, définir et promouvoir des standards de développement.
Puisque nous évoluons avec une vision d’amélioration continue constante, les choix de programmation ainsi que les standards et procédures en place sont parfois à revoir. Vous aurez la chance d’y participer en nous faisant part de vos idées et de vos précieux conseils.
Vous analyserez différents types de données afin de résoudre certains enjeux ou de répondre à des questions d’affaires.
Vous serez appelé à interagir directement avec la clientèle interne en leur offrant de la formation et du soutien.
Vous aurez à traduire les exigences techniques en langage d’affaires afin d’assurer la compréhension de vos clients : bref, vous serez un traducteur technique!
Êtes-vous la personne que l’on recherche?
Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme d’études collégiales en informatique et vous avez complété une formation spécialisée en intelligence d’affaires ou vous détenez une expérience équivalente. Un baccalauréat est considéré comme un atout.
Vos collègues vous décrivent comme une personne curieuse, rigoureuse et autonome.
Vous croyez que les données parlent et vous savez aisément raconter leur histoire.
Vous détenez une bonne connaissance des outils BI de Microsoft (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Power BI, requête SQL).
Votre niveau d’anglais est fonctionnel et vous permet d’interagir avec une clientèle interne.
Découvrez-en plus sur votre future équipe :
Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous développons des systèmes novateurs qui exploitent le plein potentiel de la robotique. Nous figurons parmi les plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage à l’échelle mondiale. Ici, l’innovation est au cœur de nos projets depuis toujours. Il n’y a donc pas de limites à ce que l’on peut créer!
Votre futur environnement de travail :
Vous serez localisé au Campus Premier Tech, notre siège mondial où 1 400 équipiers travaillent.
Notre équipe prend toutes les précautions pour respecter la distanciation physique et les mesures de désinfection plusieurs fois par jour. C’est un lieu sécuritaire!
Le poste est situé à Rivière-du-Loup, entre Québec et Rimouski. Voici une occasion unique d’allier une carrière en entreprise internationale à la qualité de vie qu’offre la région du Bas-St-Laurent. Pourquoi choisir entre qualité de vie et carrière, lorsqu’il est possible d’avoir les deux?
Nous vous attendons avec impatience. Postulez directement en ligne pour en apprendre davantage sur ce défi!

Title: Business Intelligence Coordinator
Description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.
Que diriez-vous de joindre notre équipe en tant que Coordonnateur en intelligence d’affaires? Votre mandat : proposer une architecture de données qui constituera un élément stratégique au sein du groupe d’affaires Systèmes Automatisés de Premier Tech.
Vous guiderez et fournirez des recommandations d’affaires aux différents leaders des équipes commerciales, d’excellence opérationnelle ainsi que d’administration et finance afin qu’ils puissent prendre des décisions basées sur des données.
Voici le défi que l’on vous propose :
Vous animerez les réunions d’équipe où les priorités et orientations de la semaine seront établies.
Votre compréhension des processus d’affaires combinée à votre interprétation des données vous permettra d’entrevoir l’avenir et d’accompagner l’Équipe Leadership dans la prise de décisions stratégiques.
Vous participerez à l’analyse des processus et des procédures en place afin de proposer des améliorations.
Vous accompagnerez et conseillerez les développeurs et les analystes en intelligence d’affaires dans la réalisation de leurs tâches et dans la résolution de problèmes.
Vous suivrez l’évolution des analyses et des projets afin d’assurer l’adéquation entre les orientations et l’atteinte des objectifs d’affaires.
Vous analyserez les besoins afin de planifier et d’établir les priorités des projets en lien avec l’intelligence d’affaires.
Vous veillerez à ce que l’ensemble des procédures et des processus soient en conformité avec la stratégie de gouvernance définie par Premier Tech.
Êtes-vous la personne que l’on recherche?
Vous êtes titulaire d’un baccalauréat en informatique et vous avez complété une formation spécialisée en intelligence d’affaires ou détenez une expérience équivalente.
Vos collègues vous décrivent comme un leader naturel, capable de mobiliser une équipe autour d’un objectif commun.
Vous savez mener des projets de manière structurée et organisée.
Vous détenez une bonne connaissance des outils BI de Microsoft (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Power BI, requête SQL).
Vous maitrisez les concepts et les processus en lien avec la gestion des données maitres (MDM).
Vous vous exprimez aussi aisément en français qu’en anglais.
Découvrez-en plus sur votre future équipe :
Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous développons des systèmes novateurs qui exploitent le plein potentiel de la robotique. Nous figurons parmi les plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage à l’échelle mondiale. Ici, l’innovation est au cœur de nos projets depuis toujours. Il n’y a donc pas de limites à ce que l’on peut créer!
Votre futur environnement de travail :
Vous serez localisé au Campus Premier Tech, notre siège mondial où 1 400 équipiers travaillent.
Notre équipe prend toutes les précautions pour respecter la distanciation physique et les mesures de désinfection plusieurs fois par jour. C’est un lieu sécuritaire!
Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui d’un campus universitaire : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus!
Le poste est situé à Rivière-du-Loup, entre Québec et Rimouski. Voici une occasion unique d’allier une carrière en entreprise internationale à la qualité de vie qu’offre la région du Bas-St-Laurent. Pourquoi choisir entre qualité de vie et carrière, lorsqu’il est possible d’avoir les deux?
Nous vous attendons avec impatience. Postulez directement en ligne pour en apprendre davantage sur ce défi!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
This newly created role will support the use and development of Manulife's internal reporting platform.
The Analyst will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports in Power BI and other BI platforms, providing training and support to users throughout Manulife from analysts in the Philippines to traders in Boston, resolution of platform and data errors, tracking usage and issue metrics, and creating effective written procedures and documentation as well as playing an active role in the design and governance of the support model.
This position requires:
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Organized and self-motivated
Eagerness to learn and test out new ideas
Strong work values - dependable, honest, positive attitude
Interest in working with data and using data collection, aggregation, presentation tools
Analytical mindset
Experience in Excel
Experience in or willingness to learn business intelligence tools, particularly Microsoft Power BI
Experience in or willingness to learn SQL
The ability to prioritize and transition between multiple tasks and stakeholders

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.
About Manulife
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of June 30, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.9 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.
Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground.
It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Role:
Bringing on a new resource to assist with an end to end COGNOs migration including configuration, developing the reports, migrating the reports from the traditional to new cloud platform.
Must haves:
Strong and recent experience in end to end implementation and migration using COGNOs
COGNOs admin skills, along with BI
Strong background in cloud technologies and container-based cloud hosting experience a must - need to have cloud experience to be considered
Previous data management experience
Not looking for a consultant - the resource needs to have actual hands on experience with leveraging approach for migration of COGNOs and container-based hosting
Python experience
Assets:
SAS visual analytics a strong asset
Qualification:
The Business Intelligence Specialist (L3) resource is required to:
Support the Business Intelligence and Business Analytics Unit in developing and implementing cloud based technical solutions needed as well as providing operational support ensuring that any technical anomalies can be quickly addressed.
Design technical solutions for hosting Cognos solutions on Linux VM’s and cloud container-based platform.
Develop detailed application design specifications, and conducting unit tests
Develop, test and implement the required technical solutions as well as ensure that the requirements in terms of data accuracy, quality are met.
Produce design artifacts and documentation which will allow future support of the implemented solutions.
Provide programming support for incident management, application functionality sustainment, performance tuning and technical documentation; translate technical specifications for integration/sustainment into working, tested application code; work to migrate and upgrade hosting of Cognos applications on to new platforms.
Provide the technical advice and implementation of Cloud-based BI solution.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.

The impact you’ll make
As a Business Intelligence Developer, you will impact our business by fueling the best in class data analytic and reporting platform at Loblaw Digital that will empower our business users in making data driven decisions and strategies in their everyday work.
We’re growing our BI team to better serve the enterprise data strategy and want you to be a part of it. You’ll work with users across the organization to understand how data helps them and translate that into solutions that will bring data from various systems into our data warehouse. We’re looking to turn our enviable wealth of data into actionable insights and meaningful recommendations that drive growth and improved engagement across all of our lines of business, and a customer-focused mindset is a must-have.
What you'll do
Work with stakeholders to develop solutions that support various data consumers
Help automating reporting pipelines, and build real-time streaming dashboard
Build and implement robust data models and semantic layer using Looker and BigQuery
Develop pipelines using Python, DBT, Airflow, and other GCP technologies
Be a subject matter expert on the entire BI framework stack
Support reporting and analytics needs from all areas of the business. For example: Developers, Product Managers, Product Designers, Merchandizers, Marketers, and Operations Analysts
Help us in our mission to be a hypotheses-driven product development organization which means data is at the center of everything we do
Does this Sound like you?
BA/BS in math, computer science, engineering or related field
2+ yrs of experience as a BI developer or data engineer
Hands-on experience with relational databases (e.g. Oracle, MySQL, DB2, etc.)
Ability to write complex SQL queries and perform analysis
Experience in data processing using Python or Java
Familiar with reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker is an asset
Working experience with Git
Exposure to cloud technology (GCP, AWS, Azure) is an asset
Understanding of data warehouse concept and BI architecture
Strong oral and written communication skills
Solid stakeholder management skills
Proven team player that will work well in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience in retail or ecommerce is a plus
Strong desire to learn and to push the boundaries of what can be done to better empower our business with data
How you’ll succeed
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
About Pinterest:
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. As a Pinterest employee, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping users make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.
The mission of the Business Intelligence team is to empower high-impact decisions at Pinterest by engineering data drive solutions. We are looking for a senior Business Intelligence Engineer who will design, build and maintain the most critical data sets and visualizations for our company. And as the lead for one of our verticals like Ads, Shopping, Infrastructure, Sales and Finance - you’ll be working directly with the Analysts, Data Scientists and Business Leaders in that area to ensure they have the data they need.
What you’ll do:
Understand the business drivers and analytical use-cases and translate these to data products
Explore new technologies and learn new techniques to solve business problems creatively
Think big and drive the strategy for better data quality within Pinterest
Design, implement and maintain pipelines that produce business critical data reliably and efficiently using cloud technology
Become the voice of business within engineering, and of engineering within business
Create data visualizations that allow easy consumption of the data learnings and insights
Collaborate with many teams from Product, Engineering and Business to produce relevant data solutions that can be used across multiple use cases
What we’re looking for:
5+ years of experience with big data (Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Spark), scripting language (Python) and data visualization (Tableau) technologies
Hands-on experience in principled data warehouse design, data visualization and data pipeline design and development
Prior experience working with business stakeholders in the technology space is a plus
Great communication skills. You should be able to directly communicate with senior business leaders, embed yourself with business teams, and present solutions to business stakeholders
Experience in working independently and driving projects end to end
Strong analytical skills
#LI-MJ1

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
About the Company:
The story of the Bosa Family Companies is one of entrepreneurship, commitment and a passion for construction that began over 50 years ago. The wholly-integrated, family-run company is backed by a longstanding history of excellence in development, contracting, and asset-management, making it one of Canada’s most respected privately-owned brands. With an uncompromising commitment to quality construction and innovative design, the Bosa Family Companies – through its subsidiaries, Bosa Properties and BlueSky Properties – has cemented its reputation as one of the British Columbia’s top developers, and boasts an extensive portfolio of residential, commercial, industrial and mixed-use urban properties.
About the Role:
Reporting to the IT Infrastructure Manager, the Business Intelligence Developer will play a key role in working with the business and internal client groups to create a unified data source and analyzing large sets of data from multiple internal platforms (eg. Salesforce, Yardi, Procore, etc.). You will:
Pull raw data from enterprise systems and apply ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) techniques
Normalize and aggregate large data sets
Apply statistical and machine learning skills for insights
Building dashboard to assist internal client groups to visualize data
What you Bring:
The ideal candidate for the Business Intelligence Developer position has a good mix of business, mathematical, front-end developer skills. You are a highly analytical individual that dreams about how data driven decisions can be a business game changer. You think in rows and columns, conditional probabilities and standard deviations. You are meticulous in your thinking - persistent in finding ways to ensure the last little bit of accuracy from your custom-built neural network.

Our Must Haves
Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data science position
Academic background in Computer Science, Technology or related field
Knowledge of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree, recurrent neural networks) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques (regression, Bayesian statistics, dimensionality reduction etc)
Experience with Salesforce
Experience with data hygiene, normalization and frameworks (eg. Hadoop)
Skilled in data reporting, design and mining
Data Warehouse Design (OLAP cube, snowflake schema, etc.)
Excellent SQL Expertise
Database Systems: MSSQL, Postgres, Dynamo DB, Redshift (Asset)
Skilled in Microsoft Reporting Platforms
PowerBI, DAX, PowerQuery
M, SSRS(Asset)
Skilled in Cloud knowledge
Data Management in AWS (eg. S3, Glue, Athena, Redshift)
Azure (Asset)
Skilled in manipulating data and drawing insights from large data sets using statistical tools
Python
R, Java, C++, C#, Tensorflow, Pyspark, Numpy, ggplot (Asset)

Your Rewards
Our most important offering to anyone that joins the Bosa Properties team is our culture of innovation, achievement, and ownership. We bring out the best in each other by constantly striving to be world class in all we do. These values are reflected in our Real Estate Projects, our Company, and our People.
At Bosa, we also offer a very competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:
Medical and Dental Coverage: Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost
RRSP Matching: We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your RRSP contributions.
Friends and Family Program: Early and exclusive access to our newly released projects
BOSAconnect™: Our annual development conference that is designed and hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts.
Professional Development and Education Support

How to Apply
Please submit an application at the link provided. We value your interest in the Bosa Family of Companies. While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview:
OSL is a family of passionate and enthusiastic movers and shakers, over 5000 strong. We’re always on the lookout for awesome individuals to join our growing team. We are great people doing greater things, every day. Our promise is to help organizations drive sales through engagement by combining technology, process and passion to create engaging experiences that drive consumer purchase decisions. WE REINVENT THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE. We connect people to brands through superior sales and customer service. Some of the largest retailers and brands on the planet hire us to deliver solutions to customers, not sales pitches.

General Summary:
Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst is a skilled analytical professional who has significant hands-on experience with analysis and reporting as they relate to the merchandise productivity in a large organization. As an Analyst, you will be responsible to create and develop metrics, see opportunities in the business and help shape the vision for reporting and analysis at OSL.

Responsibilities:
Work with the Business Intelligence Manager to determine the vision for reporting and builds a plan to execute on those goals
Work within a team to prioritize work and achieve team goals on time
Support the team with producing reports as required, scheduled or ad hoc
Assist in identifying opportunities in the business and works to produce impactful analysis
Examine reports and produce accurate data
Assist with the compilation and distribution of key financial and management reports
Liaise with internal and external clients on reporting needs to find effective solutions
Assist with new project opportunities to identify reporting and data system requirements
Candidate Qualifications:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regardingdata models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset

Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
What you'll be doing...
What you'll bring to the table...

What to Expect
This isn’t just about us getting to know you. We believe that you need to get your hands dirty (so to speak) to make sure Visier is the right career opportunity for you. So feel free to ask lots of questions, read up on our company news, check out our thought leadership and peep our social media channels. As you get to know what we’re all about, we hope that you’ll become increasingly confident and excited that Visier could be your next big move.

Once your application is received and reviewed, qualified candidates will move on to our next steps.
Chat with our Talent Acquisition team
Meet with the hiring manager and your potential team
Meet with one of our executive leaders and learn how your career can grow with Visier
Visier is a fast-growing technology company with over 400 employees across North America and Europe. Our multi-award winning applied analytics solution has been chosen by industries as diverse as health care, technology, retail, and banking.
We’re as passionate about empowering companies with insights as we are about providing our employees with a fun, dynamic, and rewarding work experience. Visier is where you realize your potential, make big dreams a reality, break the status quo, win as a team, and deliver exceptional quality in everything you do.
We are proud to support the professional growth and personal wellness of our people. We offer competitive salary and benefit options, Scala certification, bootcamps, lunch and learns, personal development subsidies, in-house gym facilities (Vancouver office), yoga classes (Vancouver office), volunteer days, unlimited snacks and beverages, monthly socials, and more.

Title: Business Intelligence Advisor
Description:
Transforming data into actionable insight is a requirement for every project team. Business Intelligence professionals empower project teams to consolidate disparate data points, identify risks, and action issues before they impact project performance, thereby driving substantial performance improvement potential.

The Position
We are currently recruiting a Business Intelligence Advisor to join our team. This is a remote work position within our Analytics Team. You will work with a portfolio of projects developing mockups, developing dashboards and reports, defining data models, maintaining platforms, and working collaboratively with project teams to document and deliver on analytics requirements.

Work location: Calgary, Alberta
Travel Required: None
Work Schedule: Monday - Friday with some evenings and weekends
Salary or Hourly: Salary
Management Role: No
Reports to: Manager - Analytics

Education and Experience
Bachelors degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, business, or data analytics
2 years of experience in a Business Intelligence role
Experience with PowerBI Service and Desktop
Experience in DAX
Experience in data modelling
Experience in Power Query/M-Code
Previous experience in the construction industry is an asset

Technical Skills
Technical writing
Coding languages (R, SQL, Python)
Data warehouse design
Knowledge of wireframe tools
Understanding of data warehouse design, data mining, and database management systems
Understanding of online analytical processing
Understanding of Extract, Transform, Load framework
Understanding of SQL Queries, SQP Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services, and NoSQL

Soft Skills
Public speaking (small and large audiences)
Communicating across stakeholder groups

Roles and Responsibilities:
Understand and document business requirements of BI solutions
Create storyboards
Document data models
Produce mockups and review with project stakeholders
Develop technical specifications
Design user interfaces
Develop dashboards and reports that meet BI needs of project stakeholders
Perform analysis on, troubleshoot, and optimize existing dashboards and reports

Title: Functional Analyst – Business Intelligence Solutions - SME p...
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-09
Are you dreaming of exciting challenges in Quebec’s largest private IT team? Are you passionate about data, inquisitive, ambitious and creative, and do you have solid expertise in developing business intelligence solutions? We might have the perfect professional opportunity for you!

As a functional analyst in Business Intelligence Solutions for the SME project, you will work in Agile mode in a squad of approximately 8 experienced collaborators. The squad’s mission is to extract and integrate business partner data and make it available to business partners in order to meet their analytical or operational needs.
Specific information
Assist business partners in defining their needs.
Discuss the required functional aspects with the business partner and the development team and define functional requirements.
Discuss non-functional requirements and constraints with the business partner and development team.
Create clear functional specifications for the development team.
Help define acceptance criteria and ensure they are clear.
Perform functional tests based on specifications and acceptance criteria.
Prepare and recommend action plans that could help correct anomalies encountered.
Provide functional documentation and useful training to the user.
Other working condition
Numbers of job available: 3

A minimum of four years of relevant experience
Experience as a functional analyst in the development of backend-type business intelligence solutions (data warehouse, data counter, data exchange and integration)
Experience in the banking industry (an asset)
Knowledge of the Agile development mode (an asset)
Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered.
For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required.

Good command of data usage cycle and data visualization concepts
Knowledge of a programming language: SQL, Datastage
Knowledge of databases: DB2, Oracle and SQL Server
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Collaborates, Customer Focus, Innovation

Business insight, Complexity

Complexe Desjardins Montréal
Trade Union
Non Syndiqué

2020-11-16
