Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
There’s never been a more exciting time to join our team.
That’s because in January 2020, Prospera Credit Union and Westminster Savings completed the largest merger in Canadian credit union history. The merged credit union, called Prospera Credit Union, is Canada’s sixth largest, with more than $9 billion in assets under management, over 120,000 members, and full-service branch locations across the lower mainland and the Okanagan. We’re excited for the opportunities this merger brings to our members, employees, and communities. If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, apply today!
We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Developer for our Surrey Corporate Office. You’re a proven team player with deep database modeling, design and implementation expertise. Plus, you’re known by peers as someone who “gets it done” when it comes to solving problems and presenting data from various complex relational databases. Your broad repertoire of skills includes the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and communicate back to the business using non-technical language. Developing BI solutions excites you.
If the above description sounds like a dream job, apply today for this opportunity!
What you’ll do:
Systems Architecture
Implements and maintains the application architecture for all internally developed data knowledge management functions.
Analyzes issues, recommends and implements possible solutions based on organizational change and release strategy.
Development
Provides need analysis, requirements gathering and development to meet client demands for new business intelligence applications and changes to current systems.
Participates in the design and development of integration projects required to incorporate new data sources into the data warehouse while providing data stewardship.
Maps and documents source system data to data warehouse model to presentation layer.
Efficiently learns and evaluates new developments in BI tools.
Data Warehousing
Develops, tests and maintains ETL processes.
Monitors data warehouse environments including ETL batch processing, SSIS script execution and other regularly scheduled data warehouse events.
Identifies inefficiencies and gaps in the current data warehouses and ETL processes; resolves ambiguities and conflicting business/data architecture.
Troubleshoots performance problems and data issues conducting strong root cause analysis.
Data Analytics and Reports
Monitors data warehouse environments including ETL batch processing, SSIS script execution, subscription, refresh and other regularly scheduled data warehouse events.
Identifies inefficiencies and gaps in the current data warehouses and ETL processes; resolves ambiguities and conflicting business/data architecture.
Updates and creates documentation for architecture and operational processes/procedures.
Project Management
Completes specific responsibilities outlined in scope and schedule as required by projects.
Works with the project team to identify project goals.
Works with end users and business analysts to ensure alignment between BI environment and business requirements.
What you bring:
Education
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field (e.g. Computer Science or Information Technology or Business)
Experience
3 years’ experience in a business analytics or BI role preferably within the financial services industry OR an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Technical experience with databases and data warehousing concepts/tools and proven capability to strategically problem solve using advanced quantitative and analytical skills.
Experience with SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, as well as data warehouse and ideally PowerBI.
Experience working with conceptual, logical, and physical data models, data flows and databases.
BI methodologies, data dictionary and meta data management tools.
Experience with relational and dimensional databases (MS SQL Server).
Experience with SQL development Fundamentals (Stored Procedures, Triggers, Views).
Competencies
Solid knowledge of extracting data from various large relational databases with SQL queries and OLAP cubes.
Proven abilities for database modeling, design and implementation using SQL Server.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft BI Stack.
Ability to work independently and with initiative.
Proficient at absorbing business knowledge while providing technology solutions.
What’s in it for you?
Inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace: All team members are valued, respected and heard. We learn from each other’s differences, gaining strength through our people and our perspectives.
Career Advancement! We are committed to our employee’s growth and development and we want to see you soar. There are several career pathing options this position leads to, let us be your springboard.
Fun & Camaraderie. We care deeply about our members and our employees and we want the hours you spend with us to be fun, rewarding and sometimes lighthearted. We like to work hard, play hard, have fun and be there for each other.
Flexibility! This opportunity may include flexible work arrangements.
Show me the money! We offer a competitive salary, a personalized benefits program and a generous defined pension plan.
Community Focused. We care about giving back to the communities we live, work and play in. We participate in many community minded activities throughout the year.
Grow your dream with us! Be part of exciting growth happening now at Prospera. If you are attracted to a community-based, purpose-driven organization, then join us today.
This single opportunity is posted on both legacy organization websites. Please apply on one site.
www.prospera.ca/Careers
www.wscu.com/careers

Technical experience with databases and data warehousing concepts/tools and proven capability to strategically problem solve using advanced quantitative and analytical skills.
Experience with SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, as well as data warehouse and ideally PowerBI.
Experience working with conceptual, logical, and physical data models, data flows and databases.
BI methodologies, data dictionary and meta data management tools.
Experience with relational and dimensional databases (MS SQL Server).
Experience with SQL development Fundamentals (Stored Procedures, Triggers, Views).
Competencies
Solid knowledge of extracting data from various large relational databases with SQL queries and OLAP cubes.
Proven abilities for database modeling, design and implementation using SQL Server.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft BI Stack.
Ability to work independently and with initiative.
Proficient at absorbing business knowledge while providing technology solutions.
What’s in it for you?
Inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace: All team members are valued, respected and heard. We learn from each other’s differences, gaining strength through our people and our perspectives.
Career Advancement! We are committed to our employee’s growth and development and we want to see you soar. There are several career pathing options this position leads to, let us be your springboard.
Fun & Camaraderie. We care deeply about our members and our employees and we want the hours you spend with us to be fun, rewarding and sometimes lighthearted. We like to work hard, play hard, have fun and be there for each other.
Flexibility! This opportunity may include flexible work arrangements.
Show me the money! We offer a competitive salary, a personalized benefits program and a generous defined pension plan.
Community Focused. We care about giving back to the communities we live, work and play in. We participate in many community minded activities throughout the year.
Grow your dream with us! Be part of exciting growth happening now at Prospera. If you are attracted to a community-based, purpose-driven organization, then join us today.
This single opportunity is posted on both legacy organization websites. Please apply on one site.
www.prospera.ca/Careers
www.wscu.com/careers

Title: Business Intelligence Data Strategist 3155800
Description:
Business Intelligence Data Strategist 3155800
Job Number:
3155800
POSTING DATE: Aug 20, 2020
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-Canada-Quebec-Montreal
JOB: Modeling
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Associate
DESCRIPTION
Company Profile
Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back.

Morgan Stanley's Institutional Securities Group (ISG) is a remarkably broad and diversified business. We provide institutions with almost every kind of financial product and service across the world's major markets. Whether you're interested in planning complex deals; trading on the moment-to-moment movements of the capital markets; analyzing the financial needs of a company or a wealthy family, Morgan Stanley is the place to be.

The Fixed Income Division is comprised of Interest Rate and Currency Products, Credit Products and Distribution. Professionals in the Division assess and actively manages risk, trade securities, and structure as well as execute innovative transactions in the fast-paced and constantly changing global markets. The Commodities Division is a market leader in energy, metals, and agricultural product trading worldwide whose professional’s trade in both physical and derivative commodity risk.

Position Description:

The role offers a unique opportunity to participate in the data based transformation of Morgan Stanley’s Fixed Income Business. Our Data Strat team combines technology with product expertise to bring unequalled value to the world's information. We evaluate, collect, analyze and process data from a variety of internal and 3rd party sources for use in our trading and lending businesses. We are growing our team in order to scale our technology capabilities and expand the range of acquisition, extraction and enrichment techniques we use for automation of our data analytics.

You will:

Oversee the complete lifecycle of data integration: analysis, design, implementation and actively engage with the business on using the data to make trading decisions.
Architect data flows, build out data pipelines and implement complex analytics while ensuring the highest standard of data integrity
Perform advanced quantitative and statistical analysis of large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that can be used to improve business performance

QUALIFICATIONS
Required skills

3+ years of relevant experience
Experience in setting up data pipelines, processing data with complex analytics and ensuring data integrity
Programming experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: KDB/Q,Python, C++, Java or JavaScript
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
Effective problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to manage multiple projects and report simultaneously across different stakeholders.
Structured thinking with ability to easily break down ambiguous problems and propose impactful solutions.
Passion for analyzing large and complex data sets and converting them into the information that drive business decisions.
Attention to detail and effective verbal/written communication skills.

Nice to have

Experience with large scale distributed systems

Knowledge of French and English is required
.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.

Spotlight on our Montreal Technology Centre: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oo5GaXpCwKs
Video dated October 2019.

Title: Business Intelligence Manager (Remote Opportunity)
Description:
Business Intelligence Manager

Rewind is looking for a detail oriented Business Intelligence Manager to join our Data team and support Rewind’s upcoming growth plans to be the only service your business needs to protect its valuable data!

About Rewind

Rewind is a service that protects the data that is driving your business, from a simple side hustle to a successful venture. Our focus is on backing up data that lives in the cloud – specifically in apps like Shopify, BigCommerce, and QuickBooks Online. We invite you to read our startup story to learn where we came from and where we’re going. For a more technical view, check out our Behind the App feature on the BigCommerce Developers Blog.

We care about honesty, we believe in learning from our mistakes, and we support each other as we grow.
About the Job

Reporting to the Controller, the Business Intelligence Manager will take ownership of building and managing our data function and be a key strategic partner at Rewind. As a Business Intelligence Manager, you will collaborate with departments across the organization to understand our data sources and needs, set up the processes and delivery on it (including data warehouse, tools, ETL, integrations), and improve performance measurement to make informed decisions. You will be responsible for building, sharing, and advising on key metrics of the business, developing and implementing a data and governance strategy, and enhancing our data-driven culture. You can expect to:

Oversee the planning and implementation of Rewind’s data warehouse,BI tools, ETL process, and integration capabilities
Partnering with other departments to define what business problem they are trying to solve, with what sources of data, when is it due, how it will add value, and deliver on the reporting, dashboards, and automation as needed
Monitor and analyze market trends, customer behaviours, buying patterns and sales performance
Track the performance of sales and marketing campaigns / experiments and help build predictive models
Create processes to triage internal requests and boost internal productivity by spending time on what’s important
Optimize processes and operational performance by reducing time spent on data entry and manipulation
Benchmark data against competitor and historical data for continuous improvements
Supporting the finance team in building business cases for capital allocation

About You

We are looking for candidates with 5 years of experience in a business intelligence or data analytics role
You may have a Bachelor’s degree in business technology management, computer science, or equivalent experience
You should have:
An obsession with accuracy
Strong written and verbal communication skills, can effectively communicate and work with departments to translate business requirements to technical requirements
Strong, hands-on experience with Excel and SQL, relational databases, data modelling, dashboarding and reporting, with the ability to interpret findings and produce meaningful insights
Experience with scripting in languages (e.g. Python, Ruby)
Strong curiosity for uncovering strategic opportunities and creativity in solving business problems
Proven ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, managing competing priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Previous B2B or SaaS experience is considered an asset
As we are working remotely, communication skills are critical. We appreciate those who have strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
You should also be excited to join a rapidly growing team!

About our Hiring Process

You can expect us to be curious about who you are, what experiences you have gained to date and what you are looking for in your next opportunity. We know that you are selecting us as an employer just as much as we are inviting you to join our team. We will provide a series of opportunities for us to connect and for you to meet various members of our team. Please ask us questions and let us know how we can support you throughout our hiring process.

Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your background is close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying, even if you aren’t able to check every box above. We don’t hire people to fill boxes - each new hire is an opportunity for us to augment our collective perspective and to make us a stronger team… and that is where you come in!

We are dedicated to providing an inclusive and supportive workplace where all of our teammates can bring their full and authentic selves to work... everyday. As a proud equal opportunity employer, we consider all applicants for employment and certainly invite those who identify as members of underrepresented communities to apply and join our team! And hey - we may not have a role available today that would be exciting to you, but we are growing fast and would love to have you join our talent community.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
We are looking for a passionate developer in reporting, business intelligence and data visualization!

Reporting to the Manager, Application & Database Operations, the Business Intelligence Developer will support & enhance existing BI projects and participate in net-new initiatives to drive new capabilities while improving the enterprise capability in reporting and analytics.
The BI Developer has knowledge or experience implementing analytics solutions and common services such as Data Governance and Data Quality in hybrid data architectures (cloud and on-premise).This position will occasionally be called on to advise and support database applications such as system-to-system integrations or as an advisor to data migration / data cleansing efforts.
Responsibilities:
Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
Participate in project planning sessions with multiple partners to analyze business requirements and outline the proposed solution
Develop technical specifications based on business requirements
Participate in design reviews, contribute to the design recommendations and incorporate the security requirements
Provide input to information data and flow
Understand and follow System Development Life Cycle methodology
Adhere to I/S control policies throughout design, development, and testing
Document the detailed application specifications
Translate technical specifications into application modules
Perform unit and integration testing

Qualifications:
Computer Science degree or equivalent education and experience
Confirmed experience in building and deploying reports to either on-premise and/or cloud implementations of Power BI.
Excellent SQL skills for extracting data from relational databases and designing & implementing data marts using SSIS to extract, transform, and load (ETL)business-critical information into SQL Server databases from disparate sources
Hands-on experience building data analytical capabilities by using OLAP, SSIS, SSAS and Cubes
Deep level understanding in writing MDX / DAX for design and reporting purposes
Solid skills with the Microsoft technology stack (SSAS, SSRS, SQL Server, TSQL, MDX, DAX, Power BI, Power Pivot, Power Query)
Ability to create multi-dimensional and tabular models.
Creative and innovative problem-solver applying the best techniques that address data architecture, extraction, transformation, movement, storage, integration and governance of data.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both technical and non-technical scenarios.
Knowledge of or experience with ML enabled Data Management, Data Lakes and, IOT Integration and Analytics projects considered an asset.

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.
Qualified applicants interested in joining a dynamic team are encouraged to submit a resume and cover letter electronically.
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information.
Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.
The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck’s approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2019, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the tenth straight year, indicating that Teck’s sustainability practices rank in the top 10 per cent of the world’s 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index.
Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources

Title: Team Lead - Business Intelligence
QC - 2021 Field Services Internship Program, Business Intell...
Description:
Req Id: 263431

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Bell’s Field Services team is proud to be the face of the Bell brand, performing the best installation and repair services and maintaining Bell’s network for our residential and business customers.

If you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.

Using innovative operational theory, tools and techniques, the Field Services team ensures that the right technician with the right skill set arrives at our residential and business customer’s premises on time, every time. We are committed to ensure that Bell's network, products and services are of the highest standard. The Field Services team thrives on providing installation and repair services for business and residential customers using the latest technology, including Fibre, Optical Ethernet, and IPVPN.

Are you looking for a fun and amazing career opportunity next summer? One that provides you with advanced eligibility to join our best-in-class Field Services Graduate Leadership Program upon graduation?

We are looking for talented and enthusiastic individuals to join our Field Services team next summer. As a Business Intelligence consultant, you will focus on connecting data from the entire customer experience value chain to uncover new insights on how we can improve our products and processes for an even better customer experience. If you are passionate about operational excellence and providing a great customer experience, then the Field Services Operations BI team is the place for you.

Big data is a big deal:
If you're the type of person that has a strong sense of curiosity and is energized by solving complex puzzles, then this role is the perfect opportunity to strengthen your analytical skills. With nearly limitless sources of data at our fingertips, the Field Services Operations Business Intelligence team collects and analyzes data on network and product performance, uses data such as GPS to optimize resource utilization across a workforce of nearly 10,000 people and delivers a performance management system that achieves best in class quality from our technicians. The teams findings help prioritize key technology investments and ensures major strategic decisions are always data driven. This is a terrific opportunity to build your project management skills and gain experience working with new, cutting-edge BI technologies.

How the program works:
This is a three month structured program where you will be working in teams to tackle your assigned consulting project. All projects are designed to maximize your learnings across various facets of Field Operations, and to provide you with opportunity to network and connect not only with grad peers, but also with the Bell Executive Leadership team. About 50% of your time will be allocated to learning about Bell’s services and our customers, networking and volunteering, and the remaining 50% will be focused on team based consulting project work.

Why join the program:
Benefit from extensive training and ongoing support from Bell leaders and Executives
Interact with an amazing peer-to-peer grad and alumni support network
Unique opportunity to present your project to the Bell Executive Leadership team
Advanced opportunity to join our best-in-class Graduate Leadership Program upon graduation
Opportunity to develop your analytical, problem-solving and leadership skills with real, customer-facing challenges

What our Interns are saying:
“What I enjoyed most about my 3 months at Bell was the variety of experiences offered in a short span of time. From gaining firsthand knowledge about front line work to helping solve a real-life business problem, I was able to interact with and learn from people in numerous roles and departments.”

“The best part of the summer was the autonomy offered to interns which allowed us to put academic and on-the-job knowledge to work on our project - it was challenging but very rewarding.”

What we’re looking for:
Successful students working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Science, Engineering, Business, Math/Statistics or Economics with a planned graduation date of spring 2022
Highly analytical with an understanding of the basic principles of working with large and complex data sets
Knowledge of, and preferably experience with, query languages such as SQL, and/or software development such as Python, and/or developing visualization tools
Ability to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations
Demonstrated initiative, leadership and a passion for learning new skills
Strong work ethic and persistence in the face of challenges and opportunities
Demonstrated curiosity and ability to learn quickly, with an ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Bilingual (English/French) is an asset

Key information:
Internship term: May to August 2021
Competitive compensation
Job Location: Montréal
Successful participation in this program will provide you with advanced eligibility to join our best in class Graduate Leadership Program resulting in a permanent position with Bell upon your graduation

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information:
Position Type: Management
Job Status: Intern
Job Location: Canada : Quebec : Montreal
Application Deadline: 09/30/2020

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.

Title: Director, Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Field:
Facility Management - Critical Environment
Job Type:
Full-time
Building Location:
Length of Assignment:
SUMMARY
The Director, Business Intelligence will lead the program strategy development, implementation, and oversight of business intelligence and business analytics in support of client Accounts, Portfolios, and the BGIS business. The Director, Business Intelligence will partner with both Client Account and Business Leaders to understand the data and analytics requirements and develop the appropriate metrics, reports, and dashboards that drive business value. This role will support the Account SIMs
This leader will ensure that the SIM functions are updated to reflect evolving tools and analytic strategies and measures including but not limited to the Corporate KPI Dashboard, BI Client Account Benchmark Reporting/Dashboards and piloting of business optimization analytic initiatives which demonstrate add value opportunities and measures for Clients and the enterprise.
This role has ownership of the strategic guidance, tool development, implementation, sustainment, continuous improvement, and training of the business analytics ensuring successful adoption and use. This role also contributes to the development and adherence to enterprise data definitions and governance.
KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Development and optimization of corporate processes and standards including governing policies and continuous improvement of the process of delivering business analytics products.
Partner with Client Account and Business Leads to understand the data and analytics requirements
Develop the data visualization and user experience guidelines to ensure the Business Analytics reports and dashboards are presented in a meaningful and accessible manner that allows the user to easily understand and interpret the data
Develop the Business Analytics performance measurement standard to track the ongoing adoption and use of the reports and dashboards
Partnering with IT support to ensure the continuous enhancement and development of Business analytics tools and platforms.
Development, enhancement, and optimization of Analytics Programs including business cases for investment.
Business Intelligence & Analytics strategies, programs, pilots, and implementations.
Tracking, documentation, and prioritization of requests for Analytic Support from Accounts and Business Units.
Responsibility for representation and promotion of BA Programs internally and externally.
Leads team in developing tools, dashboards, and processes to manage programs (SLC, Corporate KPI Reporting, Data Governance, etc.)
Works closely with Account Teams and data originators to ensure data integrity and quality in BA output products.
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
Demonstrated technical expertise in financial and data manipulation and analytics.
10+ years of relevant experience
Effective communications and presentation skills to both Client and BGIS teams
Demonstrated experience working with large data sets and source systems and ideally across a broad portfolio of measures and sophisticated data modeling.
Experience in understanding source system architecture – working with the I/T team to make upgrades and changes and/or interface in 3rd party systems or tools.
Demonstrated experience in effectively leading a team, including virtual teams working from locations across Canada
Strong computer proficiency and specifically experience and high proficiency with sophisticated analytical tools/ systems.
Strong data generation, audit and analysis skills, and advanced presentation skills.
Strong people development and mentoring skills.
Demonstrated ability to achieve results through influence as opposed to authority. There is a requirement to effectively work with the delivery organization within the Client Account groups, business units, and the enterprise Support Teams.
Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation
Professional Designation (CPA.) would be considered an asset

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Business Intelligence Developer (Power BI)
Description:
WHO WE ARE
Omicron Canada Inc. (Omicron) is one of the largest integrated development, design and construction firms in Western Canada, combining the expertise of more than 135 Architects, Interior Designers, Engineers, Building Assessment Experts, Real Estate Development Strategists, Cost Estimators, Project Managers, Construction Personnel and Corporate Support Professionals.
Omicron creates a better experience for clients in the Retail, Institutional, Renewals, Commercial, Industrial and Residential sectors from offices in Vancouver and Victoria.
Omicron has a distinctly entrepreneurial culture and is an innovative, sustainable and award-winning organization focused on success for clients and staff alike. Omicron was a winner of Canada's Best Managed Companies program in 2009 and has requalified every year since.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
As the Business Intelligence Developer, you will be responsible for designing and building data and analytics reports across the organization. You will be a catalyst for growing the business intelligence capabilities, working closely with our discipline teams to understand complex business problems and their analytics needs. You will develop, enhance, and maintain reports, dashboards and analytics using Microsoft Power BI and build a data pipeline to automate the extraction and transformation of data into SQL. You will engage with Omicron business stakeholders across a wide range of disciplines to identify and capitalize on key opportunities for data analysis and reporting enhancements. You will be an advocate of BI throughout the organization and provide BI training and support to staff.
Responsible for building, implementing, and supporting Microsoft Power BI solutions
Assist in the creation of a framework for how data, reports, and dashboards are managed and delivered
Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports to present data using Microsoft Power BI
Convert existing datasets/reports into SQL Server/Analysis Services/Power BI Solutions
Contribute reporting and business intelligence expertise to special projects as required
Create and maintain business intelligence tools and reports, including physical data models and dimensional analysis
Build a data pipeline to automate the extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) of data into SQL
Write programs to automate business processes and synchronize data between applications
Assist stakeholders to determine business needs and requirements for BI, including the development of performance metrics and KPIs
Design, code, test and aggregate results from SQL queries to provide information to stakeholders
Analyze data to provide recommendations for future actions to business stakeholders
Foster a data-driven culture through the adoption and proliferation of data management best practices
Seek key points of integration with design, engineering and construction teams to gain cost and schedule efficiencies
Leverage technology to enhance operational performance and productivity
WHO YOU ARE
You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and are able to make quick, well-informed decisions. You collaborate with people from diverse backgrounds in a clear and articulate way.
You have strong communication skills and the ability to effectively communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders throughout the organization.
You are a quick learner with exceptional technical skills and a hunger to stay on the leading edge. You want to continue to learn, grow and expand your skillset.
You have a strong sense of ownership and hold all your work to a high self-standard.
You have excellent time management and prioritization skills; you get things done right within short time frames.
You are candid and comfortable when working with our internal teams and external partners. You are receptive and adaptive to feedback and push-back when approaches or timelines change.
REQUIREMENTS
2+ years hands on experience with Microsoft Power BI, Business Intelligence and Data Analysis
2+ years of technical experience with SQL Server is preferred
Undergraduate degree in related field (computer science, engineering, mathematics, or equivalent)
Microsoft Power BI certification is an asset
Detailed knowledge of BI Best Practices/Methodologies, relational structures, dimensional data modeling, structured query language (SQL) skills, data warehouse and reporting techniques
Working knowledge of coding languages, including C+, VBA and Python
Ability to understand and create complicated Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) language expressions and familiarity with Power Query
Proven experience with using data visualization techniques to create meaningful reports and dashboards

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will be a member of the PMO and will report to Business Intelligence Project Manager.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is a balanced technical and business role. Individuals within the Business Intelligence Analyst role will be responsible for the identification of business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs as well as the design and implementation of technical solutions. They will work closely with departmental Data Analysts and IT teams to turn data into critical information, knowledge and insight that can be used to make informed business decisions. It is essential that this individual build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues. They provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption. The Business Intelligence Analyst will educate and train the departmental Data Analysts to use the data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms for the purpose of analysis and data exploration.
The Business Intelligence Analyst will work with departmental Data Analysts to determine business requirements, priorities, define Key Performance Indicators (KPI), develop Business Intelligence and Data Analytics strategy and governance. This includes working with business and development teams to design, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports. This individual is accountable for providing leadership and independent initiatives in facilitating information gathering, structured documentation and presentation of findings to all levels of management.
The Business Intelligence Analyst will understand how data is turned into information and knowledge and how that knowledge supports and enables positive business change. They must have an in-depth understanding of the business environment and an interest in going beyond the obvious, delving into the source, the definition, philosophy, and foundational roots of a data element in order to create information. They must work well within a team environment and must also work on their own initiative.
Responsibilities:
Be the reference person for the proposal, development and implementation of analytical solutions for the organization.
Work with development teams and stakeholders in analyzing existing reports, identifying duplicates, and designing key reports to satisfy business needs
Design and develop dashboard and reporting solutions to enable management to analyze information and improve decision making suited for their level in the organization
Collaborate with clients to determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and develop Business Intelligence and Data Analytics strategy
Work with the data team on the design of dashboards, alerts, and reports
Conduct analyses of functional business processes and functional business requirements and participate in the development of business cases in the support of process changes and/or Business Intelligence and Data Analytics projects
Develop, analyze, optimize and automate dashboards, data analysis processes and tools, metrics and reports aligned with the strategic departmental plan.
As a recognized expert, support departmental Data Analysts in the development of their analytical solutions
Facilitate or participate in workshops to gather the requirements
Analyze the functional requirements to propose BI solutions (reports and dashboards)
Write functional specifications for developers (data integration) in collaboration with the architects
Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness of reports and data through rigorous testing and accurate and reliable data
Providing solutions and developing partnerships in a dynamic and agile environment
Participate actively in reviewing the dashboard and performance of different operation units
Develop and apply test cases to ensure the smooth running of data flows
Participate in Agile meetings: daily stand-ups, sprint planning’s, reviews and demos
Participate in project documentation and knowledge sharing with users
Broadcast best business intelligence practices in the organization
Create ETL Maps (data transformation, business rules)
Create Workflow design (BPM)
Create Impact analysis
Contribute to solution architecture and detailed solution design
Help resolve incidents and problems; propose solutions and action plans
Provide support and context to the development and quality assurance teams.
Ensure the creation and ongoing maintenance of governance and related documentation for key BI & Reporting processes and deliverables
Create training materials to guide business users on how to use dashboards and reporting solutions
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in information technology or a related field
Minimum five years of experience as a business/system analyst in business intelligence and data integration
Proficient with SQL, able to efficiently write queries to retrieve data
Accountable for information gathering, structured documentation, and presentation of findings to all levels of management
Excellent, communication and interpersonal skills are essential
Excellent presentation and reporting skills are essential
Ability to perform in an Agile environment: backlog and sprint management, user story creation, etc.
Working knowledge of relational model concepts
Familiarity with business intelligence’s technical ecosystem: databases, ETL, cubes, reports, etc.
Experience with Power BI and Dataflow, an asset
Familiarity with Power Automate (Microsoft Flow), an asset
Team player with a proven commitment to collaboration; self-directed, detail-oriented and methodical; excellent analytical and processing skills
Adaptability and versatility
Ability to prioritize and accomplish tasks in a fast-paced environment
**FRENCH VERSION**
Analyste des renseignements d’affaires
L’analyste des renseignements d’affaires sera membre du BGP et relèvera du gestionnaire de projet des renseignements d’affaires.
L’analyste des renseignements d’affaires joue un rôle équilibré sur les plans technique et opérationnel. Les personnes occupant le poste d’analyste des renseignements d’affaires seront responsables de la détermination des besoins en matière de renseignements d’affaires, de production de rapports et d’analyse des données, ainsi que de la conception et de la mise en œuvre de solutions techniques. Ils travailleront en étroite collaboration avec les analystes de données et les équipes de TI du Ministère pour transformer les données en renseignements essentiels, en connaissances et en renseignements qui peuvent être utilisés pour prendre des décisions opérationnelles éclairées. Il est essentiel que cette personne acquière une compréhension de l’entreprise à un niveau de détail qui lui permet de cerner et de régler les problèmes critiques.
Ils fournissent des données exactes, cohérentes et fiables, et veillent à ce que l’information soit facilement accessible aux utilisateurs à des fins de consommation directe. L’analyste des renseignements d’affaires éduquera et formera les analystes des données du Ministère afin qu’ils utilisent les données comme outil d’analyse et qu’ils affichent l’information sous de nouveaux formulaires aux fins d’analyse et d’exploration des données.
L’analyste des renseignements d’affaires travaillera avec les analystes des données du Ministère pour déterminer les besoins opérationnels, les priorités, définir les indicateurs de rendement clés (IRC), élaborer la stratégie et la gouvernance des renseignements d’affaires et de l’analyse des données. Cela comprend la collaboration avec les équipes d’affaires et de développement pour concevoir et documenter les tableaux de bord, les alertes et les rapports. Cette personne est responsable de fournir un leadership et des initiatives indépendantes pour faciliter la collecte de renseignements, la documentation structurée et la présentation des constatations à tous les niveaux de la direction.
L’analyste des renseignements d’affaires comprendra comment les données sont transformées en information et en connaissances et comment ces connaissances appuient et favorisent un changement opérationnel positif. Ils doivent avoir une compréhension approfondie de l’environnement d’affaires et un intérêt à aller au-delà de l’évidence, à approfondir la source, la définition, la philosophie et les racines fondamentales d’un élément de données afin de créer de l’information. Ils doivent travailler en équipe et de leur propre initiative.
Responsabilités:
Être la personne de référence pour la proposition, le développement et la mise en œuvre de solutions analytiques pour l’organisation.
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement et les parties prenantes pour analyser les rapports existants, identifier les doublons et concevoir des rapports clés afin de répondre aux besoins de la branche
Concevoir et développer des solutions de tableaux de bord et de rapports pour permettre à la direction d’analyser l’information et d’améliorer la prise de décision adaptée à son niveau au sein de l’organisation
Collaborer avec les clients pour déterminer les exigences et les priorités opérationnelles, définir les indicateurs de rendement clés (IRC) et élaborer une stratégie de veille stratégique et d’analyse des données
Collaborer avec l’équipe chargée des données à la conception de tableaux de bord, d’alertes et de rapports
Effectuer des analyses des processus opérationnels fonctionnels et des exigences opérationnelles fonctionnelles besoins et participer à l’élaboration d’analyses de rentabilisation à l’appui des changements de processus et/ou des projets de veille stratégique et d’analyse de données
Élaborer, analyser, optimiser et automatiser des tableaux de bord, des processus et des outils d’analyse de données, des mesures et des rapports conformes au plan stratégique du Ministère.
En tant qu’expert reconnu, soutenir les analystes de données ministériels dans le développement de leurs solutions analytiques
Animer des ateliers ou y participer pour recueillir les exigences
Analyser les exigences fonctionnelles pour proposer des solutions BI (rapports et tableaux de bord)
Rédiger les spécifications fonctionnelles pour les développeurs (intégration des données) en collaboration avec les architectes
Garantir l’exactitude, l’exhaustivité et l’actualité des rapports et des données grâce à des tests rigoureux et à une fiabilité données
Proposer des solutions et développer des partenariats dans un environnement dynamique et agile
Participer activement à l’examen du tableau de bord et des performances des différentes unités opérationnelles
Développer et appliquer des cas de test pour garantir le bon fonctionnement des flux de données
Participer aux réunions Agile : réunions quotidiennes, planification de sprint, examens et démonstrations
Participer à la documentation du projet et au partage des connaissances avec les utilisateurs
Diffuser les meilleures pratiques en matière de veille stratégique au sein de l’organisation
Créer des cartes ETL (transformation des données, règles commerciales)
Créer la conception du flux de travail (BPM)
Créer une analyse d’impact
Contribuer à l’architecture de la solution et à la conception détaillée de la solution
Aider à résoudre les incidents et les problèmes ; proposer des solutions et des plans d’action
Fournir un soutien et un contexte pour le développement et la qualité
Qualifications
BAC+3 en technologie de l’information ou dans un domaine connexe
Au moins cinq ans d’expérience en tant qu’analyste commercial/système dans le domaine de la veille stratégique et de l’intégration des données
Maîtrise de SQL, capacité à écrire efficacement des requêtes pour récupérer des données
Responsable de la collecte de l’information, de la documentation structurée et de la présentation des constatations à tous les niveaux de la direction
Excellentes compétences en matière de communication et de relations interpersonnelles
Excellentes compétences en matière de présentation et de production de rapports
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement Agile : gestion du carnet de commandes et du sprint, création de récits d’utilisateurs, etc.
Connaissance pratique des concepts de modèles relationnels
Connaissance de l’écosystème technique de la veille stratégique : bases de données, ETL, cubes, rapports, etc.
Expérience de Power BI et du flux de données
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $75,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental Care
Extended Health Care
Vision Care
Schedule:
8 Hour Shift
Experience:
Business Analyst: 3 years (Required)
Data Warehousing: 2 years (Required)
Reporting: 2 years (Required)

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Within the context of a client and family centred model of care and, in accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Providence Health Care, the person promotes a safe, respectful, and civil working environment for patients, residents, families, visitors and staff.

Reporting to the Manager, People Staffing, Planning & Analytics, the Senior HR Forecaster-BI Analyst is responsible for leading planning, design, and optimization of People Services (HR) and Workforce Scheduling business application solutions including data warehouse development and/or enhancement of the data warehouse architecture to support departmental business needs in a sustainable and scalable manner. The position also plays a major role in the management of data within HR systems and its utilization to understand our workforce and make effective workforce planning decisions. The Senior HR Forecaster-BI Analyst works closely with Clinical and Operational Leaders, People Services teams such as Workforce Scheduling and other organizational stakeholders to determine business requirements and analyze their metrics. Conducts statistical analysis, produces business models and forecasts, and develops and maintains performance indicators, comprehensive reports and tools using current business analytical methods and software. Recommends and participates in the implementation of interventions to optimize workforce utilization and talent acquisition planning both on a short-term and long-term basis to ensure PHC has the right staff, in the right place and the right time.

Provides input into the development and implementation of policies and procedures for data stewardship and data governance. Gathers and documents requirements including technical and financial feasibility of proposed business intelligence solutions. Conducts design and code reviews. Tests, documents and implements solutions in collaboration with applicable stakeholders. Participates in planning for data migration from source systems and works with IT and business users to validate data integrity and data quality within systems. Administers system security and access, supports and delivers user training and provides technical direction to other staff as required. Participates in internal and external HR reporting requirements.

Participates in internal and external committees and working groups as required. Works with team members to establish and maintains cooperative and effective relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners.
Skills
Extensive experience building, monitoring and maintaining data warehouses using the Kimball methodology.
5+ years working with T-SQL
A keen, high level awareness of what is needed to make business intelligence and analytics a successful function within a large organization with many internal and external stakeholders.
Experience and proficiency in MS Excel and Word with one or more of the following analytical tools, SAS, SPSS, R, and STATA
Strong background in data architecture, data quality, data mapping, and data structures.
Proven ability to interpret data files and record layouts to map fields between multiple systems and database tables
Ability to collaborate extensively with business partners in data warehousing solutions, and contribute to a very flexible and agile development process.
Ability to gather requirements from various user groups and translate those requirements into technical specifications.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards.
Ability to work to independently, meeting deadlines under pressure, with minimal supervision and frequent interruptions.
Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas/processes in simple terminology to internal and external stakeholders, including all levels of management.
Knowledge of project management and change management methodology.
Proven ability to plan and execute complex projects with stringent budgets and timelines.
Strong team player with a client/user orientation.
Ability to teach, coach and mentor others.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.


Education
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field plus a minimum of five (5) years of recent, related experience in data warehousing, significant experience using Microsoft BI Suite (SSMS, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS), forecasting and analytics or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Experience with HR and health care data would be an asset. Software development experience and working with Tableau or other data visualization software would be an asset.
Duties
Liaises with HR teams and other organizational stakeholders to determine requirements including understanding inefficiencies in existing business applications and future business needs. Establishes and maintains positive and cooperative relationships with all internal and external stakeholders/partners.
Gathers and documents requirements including technical and financial feasibility of proposed business intelligence solutions, analyzes and reviews with Workforce Planning & Data Analytics team members and/or other stakeholders and makes recommendations including anticipating future data needs and how existing data can be best leveraged to meet user needs.
Leads/delivers the preparation and assessment of data regarding state of current workforce including complex analyses to identify workforce behavior (i.e. attrition, retirement, movement) and assess headcount and skills changes (gaps/surpluses).
Develops and delivers current state reporting and future state predictive modeling tools. This includes tools, reports and metrics that can be used directly by Managers for evidence-based decision-making.
Acts as a technical lead for assigned projects, including the development, monitoring and evaluation of project plans and deliverables using project management methodology. Assists with supervision, mentoring and coaching of team members, participates in recruitment panels, provides input into training and development decisions and monitors staff performance on project teams.
Provides technical direction and guidance in the implementation of business solutions to other team members as required.
Designs, plans and optimizes HR data warehouse, reports, dashboards and other business solutions content as required including core HR management reports, dashboards and related tools.
Performs statistical analysis, business models and forecasts using various software packages and current methodologies.
Responds to ad-hoc, on-demand and scheduled business user information requests.
Provides input into the development and implementation of policies and procedures for data stewardship and governance.
Conducts design and code reviews as needed to ensure quality, consistency and compliance with requirements.
Tests, documents and implements proposed business solutions in collaboration with appropriate stakeholders.
Participates in the planning for data migration to the HR data warehouse from source systems.
Works with IT and business users to validate rules regarding data integrity and data quality as it relates to the impact on business needs.
Identifies and troubleshoots issues; proposes business solutions to resolve these issues.
Administers security settings and access to HR data warehouse and related systems.
Supports all business users in the use of HR data warehouse tools and in deployment activities such as user acceptance testing, user training, product demos and product evaluation.
Develops, updates and coordinates the preparation of related educational and training materials.
Maintains current knowledge and provides developmental expertise in various human resources systems to support data quality, system and process efficiencies.
Performs other related duties as required.

Title: Finance Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Company Description
ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM GLOBAL?
Become a part of AIM Global’s history.
We have continued to prosper for the last eight decades through our employees’ strength and our clients’ trust, thus establishing our international presence and diversifying our expertise. Take your place at AIM Global, an integrated chain comprised of five divisions who work in collaboration to revalorize resources such as metals, construction waste, end-of-life vehicles and urban areas. We invest in our installations and employees to ensure a better future for all.
It’s simple; we do it right. We aim for excellence.

Job Description
As a Finance Business Intelligence Analyst, you help develop and use tools and methods to collect, compile, model and oversee the quality of financial transactional data. You will be part of a team whose mandate is to develop business intelligence knowledge to support decision-making and help decisionmakers understand the big picture.
Main responsibilities
Work closely with various technology and project teams to understand business data and provide analysis and requirements to ensure the data design / development initiatives are in line with the management expectations.
Provide support throughout data lifecycle to resolve data issues and support operation users to interpret the data
Develop and maintain knowledge of available data from different IT systems and data sources
Design and implement reports and dashboard to provide insights and meet business requirements
Identify, analyze key performance indicators (KPI) and interpret data to inform management decision-making
Perform data analysis, with a wide variety of statistical methods including cluster, regression, decision tree, random forest, time series and others.
Works closely with IT BI team to ensure that the needed data models are available and meet the expected reports and dashboards
Establish strong relationships with peers and work cross-functionally with finance teams.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
A minimum of two years of relevant experience
A relevant experience in an accounting and financial systems
Strong interest in data analytics, data transformation and problem-solving skills.
Experience in business intelligence and data management
Advanced Knowledge: Microsoft Excel (Pivot tables), experience with cubes, data analysis tool, hypothesis testing, linear regression, qualitative and quantitative forecasting methods
Specific knowledge
Knowledge of SQL, entity relationship diagrams and dimensional data models
Knowledge of visualization tools such as Cognos or Power BI (an asset)
Knowledge of VBA, R, or Python (an asset);
Facility with databases management
Knowledge of accounting and operation management

Additional Information
La Compagnie Américaine de Fer & Métaux et ses filliales offrent des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous. Le masculin est uniquement utilisé afin d'alléger le texte. Seules les personnes retenues pour entrevue seront contactées.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.
Les termes BI, KPI, Predictive Analytics, Big Data sonnent comme de la douce musique à vos oreilles?
Ce rôle est pour vous!
Le groupe d’affaires Eau et Environnement de Premier Tech est à la recherche d’un Analyste intelligence d’affaires qui évaluera des données très diversifiées afin d’aider nos équipiers à prendre les meilleures décisions possibles, mais également à visualiser des données comme jamais auparavant! Nous préparons l’avenir en explorant de nouveaux outils dans le but d’apporter une vision commune, claire et de toujours mieux partager l’information.
VOICI LES DÉFIS QUI VOUS ATTENDENT :
Grâce à votre sens des affaires, vous analyserez les besoins en information de gestion avec les utilisateurs.
Vous aurez à faire la modélisation de données et à effectuer le « mapping » pour les transformations vers l’entrepôt de données et ses environnements informationnels.
Vous irez au-delà des besoins utilisateurs en prévoyant différents scénarios de consommation des informations et vous aurez à concevoir des tableaux de bord visuels à la fois flexibles et faciles d’utilisation.
Vous travaillerez en collaboration avec les développeurs BI et les utilisateurs pour assurer la qualité des solutions.
Vous agirez à titre de mentor auprès des utilisateurs pour qu’ils s’approprient les outils BI et l’analyse des informations.
ÊTES-VOUS LA PERSONNE QU’IL NOUS FAUT?
Vous êtes titulaire d’un baccalauréat en informatique de gestion, en comptabilité ou avez complété une formation spécialisée en intelligence d’affaires (BI).
Vous avez une grande capacité à naviguer dans un environnement flou et à vos yeux, tout problème devient une opportunité à saisir.
Vous êtes curieux : tout ce qui touche aux données vous passionne, et ce, dans les différents secteurs d’activités de l’entreprise.
Les concepts d’intelligence d’affaires et les outils reliés de Microsoft n’ont plus de secrets pour vous.
Vous maitrisez les bases de données SQL Server et Oracle en plus du langage SQL.
Votre secret pour cerner les besoins analytiques? Vous êtes rigoureux, fonceur et désireux d’aller au fond des choses!
Vous êtes un excellent communicateur en français et en anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.
Votre futur environnement de travail :
Vous serez localisé au Campus Premier Tech, notre siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
Notre équipe prend toutes les précautions pour respecter la distanciation physique et les mesures de désinfection plusieurs fois par jour. C’est un lieu sécuritaire!
Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui d’un campus universitaire : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus!
Le poste est situé à Rivière-du-Loup, entre Québec et Rimouski. Voici une occasion unique d'allier une carrière en entreprise internationale à la qualité de vie qu'offre la région du Bas-St-Laurent. Pourquoi choisir entre qualité de vie et carrière, lorsqu’il est possible d’avoir les deux?
Le groupe d’affaires Eau et Environnement de Premier Tech est un chef de file dans les solutions de traitement des eaux usées. Nous créons des solutions efficaces, efficientes et écologiques pour protéger l’environnement et assainir les eaux de manière durable. Nos produits sont fiables, innovants et sont soutenus par des marques de commerce reconnues. Ils représentent la connexion unique entre nos équipiers et nos technologies, en plus d’avoir comme fonction première de protéger l’eau, une ressource vitale.
Être équipier Premier Tech, c’est faire partie d’une grande équipe internationale qui célèbre les réussites – petites et grandes – en valorisant le rôle que chacun y a joué. C’est évoluer ensemble, avoir confiance et accomplir toujours plus.
Prêt à faire la différence? Postulez en ligne dès maintenant, nous vous attendons avec impatience!

Title: Business Intelligence / Data Analyst
Description:
The following position description is established by Flair Flexible Packaging Corporation (the “Company”) to outline the basic requirements, duties, and responsibilities of the full-time position of Business Intelligence/Data Analyst. The Company has the right to amend or modify this job description at any time in its sole discretion.
Job Summary
The Business Intelligence/Data Analyst is responsible for driving the value of data in ways that create value for our customers, employees and broader stakeholder communities. You will utilize effective communication skills to collaborate with IT and business partners as well as 3rd party providers to create and manage BI and analytics solutions that turn data into knowledge. In this role, you are to create best practices and identify innovative strategies for delivering internal and external data to decision-makers across the company. As a Business Intelligence/Data Analyst, you’re also responsible for performing activities required to create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) master data, maintaining data integrity through all systems used by the company.

Essential Duties
The following duties are an overview of the primary duties and responsibilities of the Business Intelligence/ Data Analyst role and should not be considered an all-inclusive list:
Responsible for process of design, construction of reports and visualizations while ensuring long-term maintainability and scalability
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify opportunities to leverage company data and data platforms, and build business case
Translates stakeholder requirements into reporting deliverables
Conducts research, assembles, and analyzes data from multiple sources to prepare reports, dashboards, presentations, and documents as needed.
Gain in-depth understanding of the company’s transactional systems and the relationship between those environments and the data warehouse.
Stay updated on developments in the field of advanced data analytics
Drive adoption of industry best practices and tools for advanced data analytics
Assist IT manager in developing corporate BI architecture and landscape
Partner with data owners to ensure quality of master data
Prepares and conducts meetings with team members and creates a culture where members can share and voice their concerns and provide a forum for continuous improvement
Develops resource strategies, allocating staff, tools and specialized support as necessary to ensure that IT infrastructure needs are met

Technical Competencies
Extensive experience of data warehouse, BI reporting, analytics and dashboards
Experience in building and troubleshooting SQL queries
Advanced SQL skills and experience in joining/cleansing datasets from multiple sources
Advanced Excel skills to build data models and dashboards in Excel
Experience with data visualization tools, e.g. Power BI or Tableau
Experience in working with ERP
Proven track record in designing, developing and implementing BI solutions
Strong understanding of principles of data modelling and solutions architecture

Leadership Competencies
Strong verbal and written communication skills
High quality analytical skills
Proven ability to lead and work with multi-cultural teams and facilitate workshops
Highly adaptable, strong prioritization and ability to work well under pressure meeting
deadlines
Influencing and negotiation skills and ability to work with wide range of stakeholders

Safety Responsibilities
All Flair employees are required to be an active safety participant at Flair by:
Attending required safety training sessions,
Reporting accidents and near misses in a timely fashion,
Reporting any safety concerns to a designated safety team leader,
Takes reasonable care for their own health and safety,
Watches out for the safety of their fellow co-workers, and
Follows Flair’s work safety rules and procedures.

Food Safety Responsibilities
Employees shall report problems with the food safety management system to the responsible person(s). Responsible personnel shall have defined responsibility and authority to initiate and record actions.
Employees shall understand the Food Safety Policy, GMP’s, HACCP Principle and Food Safety Standard.

Required Training, Experience, Licenses and Certifications
In addition to performing satisfactorily all of the duties and responsibilities of the position, an individual in this position must possess and maintain the following knowledge, skills, qualifications and/or abilities:
5+ years’ data and analytics experience working with complex and large data
Bachelor/Master’s degree in information technology
Proven track record in delivering BI projects through all phases (requirements gathering, design, build, testing, deployment and support)
Experience with Exact Globe ERP is a plus
Possesses strong support and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to speak, read, write and understand the English language at a level adequate to perform job functions.
Ability to understand and follow oral and written directions promptly and accurately.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of individuals.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with other Company employees, representatives of manufacturers, vendors or third-parties, and customer representatives.
Ability to work well under pressure and under stressful conditions.
Ability to coordinate, prioritize and timely and satisfactorily complete many different tasks.
Ability to work a flexible schedule and overtime hours as necessary.

Working Environment/Physical Requirements:
The duties of this position generally involves sedentary office work.
Moderate physical activity is required.
Ability to lift up to 25 pounds on occasion.
Ability to sit, talk, see and hear.
Ability to stand, walk, stoop/bend, lift, and frequent repetitive motion and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls, and normal vision.
Frequent use of office equipment including personal computer, copier, postage equipment, telephone and fax machine.
This position has frequent exposure to periods of high activity, interruptions and high stress under demanding and occasionally adversarial conditions.
The position requires communication with Company employees, customers and other individuals.
Work hours will vary depending upon the needs of the Company’s customers at any given time, and will involve working long or non-traditional hours to fulfill Company and/or customer’ needs, projects or special circumstances.
Experience
Preferred
5 - 10 years: Data and analytics experience working with complex and large data
Education
Required
Associate's degree or better in Information Technology
Preferred
Bachelor's degree or better in Information Technology
Skills
Required
ERP/SAP
Microsoft Access
Microsoft Outlook
SharePoint
SQL Reporting
Preferred
Adobe
Behaviors
Required
Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking
Functional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subject
Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
Motivations
Required
Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
Goal Completion: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks

Title: Analyst, Business Intelligence & Reporting
Description:
Analyst, Business Intelligence & Reporting
(200146)

Job Summary

Are you a bold, quick-thinking and driven individual seeking the growth and challenge that comes from working with collaborative teams for a dynamic company? Are you intrinsically passionate as a change agent, influencer of growth and have the desire to "move the needle?" If you feel satisfaction at seeing your team's ideas and dreams become reality and answered yes to any of these questions, we want to hear from you!

The Plan Operations Analytics Group at HOOPP (Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan) is looking for an experienced individual to fill a permanent, fulltime Analyst, Business Intelligence & Reporting role for the Analytics Team. The team delivers insights, analytics, reporting, data governance and subject matter expertise in data warehouse knowledge.

The team's principles are focused on delivering true stakeholder value in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. They value challenging the status quo, innovative solutions, team collaboration and practicality.

Roles and Responsibilities

What You Will Do:

Strategic Reporting
Provides strategic reporting such as forecasts, projections and high-level overview as well as operational (e.g. processing or phone statistics) reporting to management
Provides daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual or ad hoc reporting as required by utilizing standard reports or builds. Extracts data from sources such as data warehouse, as well as converts operation specific data into reports.
Undertake broad subject matter expertise in data and perform in-depth analysis of data to gather insights and communicate results.
Provides business intelligence support and data solutions to all areas of HOOPP as required by analysis and communication, acting on requests for data and reporting information. Provides guidance on the structure of databases, drafting of queries, compiling of CRM operational type business intelligence to all departments.
Provides statistical analysis and interpretation in clear user language on data information and provide written summary reporting as well as communication on that analysis. Ability to synthesize large datasets into clear actionable decision-making for presentation to Management.
Participates the integration of multiple data sources (data warehouse, portals, dashboards, reports, systems) into specific solutions to answer reporting needs using all relevant data. This to meet HOOPP's immediate and future information needs in collaboration with IT.
Creates, develops and maintains business intelligence platforms.

Qualifications

Who You Are:

Analytical
Understands the why (curious, asks probing questions, digs deep, open minded)
Ability to create clarity and get everyone on the same page
Excellent Requirements documentation (clear, concise)
Has strong trust and confidence of team and business.
Teamwork
Strong 1:1 working experience with Analysts, business leaders, stakeholders and management.
Provides honest, constructive feedback in an empathetic manner
Identifying and engaging in difficult conversations; Ability to table conflict or team tensions
Ability to improve Team Norms/processes by influencing
Skills and Abilities
Able and comfortable in working with all levels of management to understand, and when needed negotiate, requirements and priorities
Solid communication skills to interact across organizations and offer insights to business.
Background in mathematics, data analytics and reporting technologies
Solid experience in data analysis and reporting; experience in the pension industry is preferred
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management or related field
Knowledge of Excel, R, Python and MS SQL Server; familiarity with business intelligence tools specifically Power BI
Knowledge of relational database structures and applications.
Competency in agile software development
Notice for job applicants

Following the advice of Canadian health authorities, to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing, all recruiting activities including interviews and new hire onboarding will be conducted online. While we are doing our best to ensure reasonable response times, please expect some delays during the recruiting process due to the current situation. Thank you for your patience and understanding during these challenging times.

For additional information on our adjusted recruitment process, please email us at hrinbox@hoopp.com.
About HOOPP

Established in 1960, the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) is a multi-employer defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's hospital and community-based healthcare sector. We serve more than 381,000 members who provide valued healthcare services at more than 590 employers across the province. At HOOPP, we exist to provide a stable and reliable pension for our members that starts in retirement and is paid for life. As one of Canada's largest and most respected pension plans, HOOPP's net assets reached $94.1 billion at the end of 2019 and our funded status remained strong and stable at 119%.

HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide our every interaction with our members, employers and employees. We've become one of Canada's leading pension plans by consistently challenging ourselves and embracing innovation.
From our unique investment management approach to our innovative technology and thought-provoking research, we constantly seek to push the boundaries, and we do this by hiring passionate, forward-thinking people.

Our high-performance culture is founded on collaboration, respect and belonging. HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer and we're proud of our diversity. We select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Human Resources team. We will be happy to consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.
Primary Location Toronto
Job Pension Services
Employee Status Permanent
Job Type Standard
Schedule Full-time
Job Posting Aug 4, 2020, 9:18:25 AM

Title: Software Developer, Business Intelligence Solution
Description:
English follows

Nous sommes en recrutement pour un Développeur logiciel, solutions d’intelligence d’affaires (ou bien sûr une) qui souhaite contribuer directement au succès de l'entreprise en concevant et en développant des logiciels de Business Intelligence & Analytics pour l’industrie de l’assemblage électronique. Nos solutions permettent aux manufacturiers d’améliorer considérablement leur productivité et d’établir un environnement propice à l’industrie 4.0 et l’IoT.

CE QUE TU FERAS
Analyser et synthétiser les besoins des clients
Estimer les efforts requis pour le travail à accomplir
Concevoir et programmer les fonctionnalités logicielles
