Élaborer et maintenir les tests automatisés

CE QUE NOUS RECHERCHONS
Un diplôme universitaire ou collégial en génie informatique, en informatique ou en mathématique
2 ans ou plus d’expérience dans le développement de solutions d’intelligence d’affaires (business intelligence)
Maitrise d’un des langages orienté objet : Java et/ou C#
Expérience avec des entrepôts de données, des structures dimensionnelles (OLAP), les ETL et des technologies de présentation (rapports et tableaux de bord)
Expérience dans l'utilisation de bases de données relationnelles
Savoir appliquer des design patterns et s'intéresser à l'application de bonnes pratiques de génie logiciel
Une capacité à livrer des résultats hautement fiables avec une bonne gestion de son temps
Une facilité à apporter des solutions simples à des besoins d’affaires complexes
Être à l'aise à communiquer et travailler en français ou en anglais
Important : Seuls les candidats qui sont déjà légalement autorisés à travailler au Canada seront pris en considération

CE À QUOI T’ATTENDRE
Joindre une de nos équipes de développement Scrum et contribuer directement à la création de solutions IoT et Industrie 4.0 qui ont un impact positif et concret sur l’efficacité et l’environnement pour l’industrie manufacturière électronique.
Collaborer avec notre équipe multidisciplinaire formée entre autres d’ingénieurs d’application, de spécialistes en assurance qualité et en support technique et de professionnels de la vente et du marketing
Apprendre et évoluer dans notre environnement international: nous travaillons en étroite collaboration avec des clients et partenaires situés dans 28 pays sur 5 continents!

COMMENT ÇA FONCTIONNE AVEC LES EXIGENCES ACTUELLES DE DISTANCIATION SOCIALE
Nous recrutons pour notre bureau de Bromont. Actuellement, l'équipe travaille la majeure partie du temps à distance. Notre bureau est ouvert et c’est possible pour quelques employés à la fois d’y travailler lorsqu’ils le souhaitent. Considérant la situation actuelle et les recommandations du gouvernement du Québec, le télétravail demeure l’option privilégiée. Pour l'instant, le nouveau membre de l'équipe aura la possibilité de travailler à distance ou au bureau par moment.
Dès qu'il sera conseillé de recommencer à travailler depuis le bureau la majeure partie du temps, nous nous ajusterons en conséquence. Même après le retour à la normale des opérations, il sera possible de travailler à distance quelques jours par semaine.
Nous sommes équipés pour mener le processus d’entrevue à distance. 25% de nos employés travaillent d’un peu partout à travers la planète donc nous sommes habitués aux entrevues virtuelles.
En ces temps de distanciation sociale et de travail à distance, nous nous habituons à l'interaction entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle, nous prenons même plaisir à faire des rencontres en ligne avec un chat qui passe devant l’écran ou un enfant qui demande quel sera le dîner!

QUI NOUS SOMMES
Nous sommes une compagnie canadienne de 47 employés qui est le leader en solutions Track Trace Control pour l’industrie de l’assemblage électronique. Nos solutions permettent aux manufacturiers d’améliorer considérablement leur productivité, de contrôler efficacement le matériel et gérer leur production en temps réel.

Notre équipe est créative, efficace, amicale, et hautement expérimentée. Nous offrons cinq semaines de vacances, des avantages sociaux, un horaire flexible et la possibilité de travailler à distance. Nous sommes fiers de développer ensemble des solutions haut de gamme en matière d’Industrie 4.0 et IIoT donnant un fort avantage compétitif à nos clients et partenaires.

Nous sommes privilégiés que notre bureau soit situé dans la ville pittoresque de Bromont et nous en profitons pleinement! En quelques minutes seulement, nous sommes sur les pentes de ski, en vélo, à cheval ou en randonnée.

Notre culture d’entreprise repose sur le respect, la confiance, le bien-être et l’impact, avec la collaboration en trame de fond. Nous préconisons le travail d’équipe et nous nous concentrons sur les forces de chacun afin que chaque membre de l’équipe puisse développer son plein potentiel.

** Le genre masculin est utilisé dans cet affichage dans le seul but de ne pas alourdir le texte. **
________________________________________

We’re recruiting for a Software Developer, Business Intelligence Solutions who wants to contribute directly to the success of the company by designing and developing business intelligence & analytics software for the electronic assembly industry. Our solutions allow manufacturers to significantly improve their productivity and enable Industry 4.0 and IoT.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Analyze and synthesize customer needs
Estimate the effort required for the work to be accomplished
Design and program software features
Develop and maintain automated tests

WHAT YOU IDEALLY NEED TO HAVE
A university degree or college diploma in computer engineering, computer science or mathematics
2+ years experience in the development of business intelligence solutions
Strong knowledge of one of the object-oriented languages: Java and/or C#.
Experience with data warehouses, dimensional structures (OLAP), ETLs and presentation technologies (reports and dashboards)
Experience in the use of relational databases
Know how to apply Design Patterns and have great interest in applying good software engineering practices
The ability to deliver highly reliable results with good time management
The ability to bring simple solutions to complex business needs
Be comfortable communicating and working in French and in English
Important: Only candidates who are already legally entitled to work in Canada will be taken into consideration

WHAT TO EXPECT
Join one of our Scrum development teams and contribute directly to the creation of IoT and Industry 4.0 solutions that have a positive and concreate impact on efficiency and the environment for the electronic manufacturing industry.
Collaborate with our multi-functional team composed of Application Engineers, Sales & Marketing Professionals, Quality Assurance and Technical Support Specialists.
Learn and grow within our international environment: we work closely with customers and partners in 28 countries on 5 continents.

HOW DOES IT WORK WITH CURRENT SOCIAL DISTANCING REQUIREMENTS
We’re recruiting for our Bromont office. Currently, the team works remotely most of the time. Our office is open and it’s possible for a few employees at a time to work there when they wish. Considering the current situation and the recommendations of the Quebec government, working remotely remains the preferred option. For the time being, the new team member will have the option of working remotely or from office on occasion.
Once it is advised to start working from the office most of the time again, we’ll adjust accordingly. Even after operations return to normal and we’ll be back in the office, it is possible to work remotely a few days a week.
We’re equipped to conduct the interview process remotely. One quarter of our employees work from other locations all around the world, so we’re accustomed to online interviews.
In these times of social distancing and working remotely, we’re becoming used to the interaction between professional and personal life, we’re even enjoying having online meetings with our pets sitting in our arms or a child who asks what lunch will be!

WHO WE ARE
We’re a Canadian company of 47 employees who’s the leading Track, Trace and Control solutions provider for the electronics manufacturing industry. Our solutions enable manufacturers to significantly improve their productivity, effectively control equipment and manage their production in real time.

Our team is creative, efficient, fun and highly experienced. We offer 5-week vacations, company benefits, flexible hours, and the possibility of working remotely. Together we take pride in developing high-end IIoT and Industry 4.0 solutions that provide a strong competitive edge to our customers and partners.

We’re privileged that our head office is located in beautiful Bromont, Québec and we love taking advantage of it by stepping outside to go for a run, bike ride, horse ride or an evening out on the ski slopes.

Our company culture is based on respect, trust, well-being and impact, with collaboration as the main unifying piece. We value teamwork and we focus on everyone’s strengths so each of us can fully utilize our potential and grow together.

Title: Business Intelligence Manager
Description:
Purpose Statement
The BI Manager is responsible for bringing to life the digital transformation within the Strategy, Insights, and Planning (SPI) function at BAT Canada. The BI Manager sets the vision, develops and leads the Business Intelligence strategy and plan focusing on accelerating the digital transformation to drive commercial value, in alignment with corporate marketing goals. Integrating new capabilities and developing people & establishing the technology ecosystem that leads to insights and foresight, delivering competitive advantage for BAT is the main KPI.
He/she understands, analyses and can translate business imperatives into actionable insights. He/she leads a team of Data Scientists, Architects and Analysts. KPI’s include, maintaining a stable and data integrity BAU of current reporting needs, leads the POS performance data gathering and communication process, leads data analytics practice to solve business imperatives, leverages digital technology and automation to increase productivity and effectiveness, develops graphical/dashboarding products for greater self-serve capability, and embarks on machine learning & AI for predictive analytics, all to continuously evolve the BI maturity levels to the gold standard – actionable insights.
He or she will lead a team of 6-8 people from BI Associate Managers and BI analysts, specializing in Data Science, Data Engineers, Data Analysts, digital and visualization experts, and work with outside suppliers to shape the current & future needs of the organization.
Key accountabilities:
Understand, analyze and master business requirements to lead shaping the delivery of BI deliverables
Partners with business leaders across the organization to define and deliver reporting needs
Ensures OTIF delivery and accuracy of POS reporting both locally and globally
Leads the team to design and develop new BI solutions such as big data analytics, graphical mastery, machine learning, and artificial intelligence (NLP)
Engages and inspires BI team to deliver on BI projects OTIF with quality and effectiveness to deliver ROI.
Works with SP&I analysts to deliver both insight and foresight capabilities via the new BI tools.
Partners with IT to prioritize IT resources and prioritization.
Leads communication and embedding of BI Strategy and plan across Marketing
Continually looks for ways to streamline and automate reporting, ensuring a self-serve culture
Ensures the data integrity of all BI tools and products across Marketing.
Leads and manages the identification, selection and business case preparation for new tools or resources required to continue to advance dashboard, scorecard, report and data usage
Develops an organizational data training & capability calendar to increase DQ across Marketing
Leads and develops capacity and capability with direct reports and Analysts across the organization
Chairs the BI Steering Committee for all BI Projects with Head of Divisions
Coaches direct reports to turn talent into performance for BAT.
Develop and Manage a budget of around 4M annually effectively/efficiently to deliver a ROI for BAT.
Business Leadership
Able to understand and shape business requirements/analytics to lead team to deliver actionable insights to the organization, to support delivery of our marketing/corporate objectives on volume, share, profit.
Lead digital technology and automation across marketing that delivers data and insights faster and easier
Champion the team to develop visualization/graphical mastery and dashboarding solutions that transform “mountains of data” into visualizations that provoke action and spark decision making
Lead the team to develop a data analytics practice, machine learning/AI capabilities to develop predictive and data modeling frameworks that identify new potential market dynamics and causal relationships to deliver both insight & foresight.
Establish the vision for D2C analytical capabilities and champion the vision internally Ensure Data Architecture that supports Transforming Tobacco, data governance and integrity of all data & BI Tools.
Lead the team to develop user centric solutions that build value added propositions that enable understanding of the forces at play, new business dynamics and potential causal relationships to deliver actionable insights.
Ensure POS Process is managed and led effectively for minimal disruptions and feeds constant pulse on performance.
Partner with IT to develop, build and manage data warehouse interfaces and self-serve BI environments of the future for both local and global
People Leadership
Engage senior leaders to champion BI plan and strategy.
Deliver clear and concise communications on BI strategy, plan and projects by mastering storytelling framework to inspire stakeholder buy-in
Lead innovation for evolving BI maturity to inspire/provoke action.
Influence and collaborate with stakeholders at both local and global levels to ensure Canada’s BI strategy and execution raises the bar for the BAT group and is best in class.
Find and cultivate relationships with external thought leaders and agile suppliers to explore new innovative ways to deliver BI performance for BAT.
Provide leadership and strategies to attract highly qualified associates while coaching and developing current team for retention and performance purposes
Actively engage BI team to raise the bar on personal development plans, to stay ahead of BI trends globally and ensure fit for future capabilities.
Essential requirements:
Bachelor's\Master’s degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Data Science, Marketing, Business Administration with specialization in IT/Data Science or related fields.
8-10 years of relevant experience in leading a BI team and Data Science professionals.
Strong experience in DQ and able to deliver Digital Transformation and AI Strategy.
Excellent understanding of statistics, familiarity with statistical tests, distributions, maximum likelihood estimators, etc. evaluating when different techniques are (or aren’t) a valid approach.
Programming skills data science skills such as distributed computing, predictive modelling, story-telling and visualizing, Math, statistics and various forms of technological skills (R, SAS, Python, Matlab, SQL, Hive, Pig, Spark).
Advanced Knowledge of Excel.
Machine learning: Mastery of machine learning methods and be able to recommend.
Strong background in artificial intelligence and decision systems.
Excellent understanding of statistics, familiarity with statistical tests, distributions, maximum likelihood estimators, evaluating when different techniques are (or aren’t) a valid approach.
High performing Analytical Capabilities: Ability to synthesize information, reduce complexity and identify key opportunities and insights.
Excellent Communication Skills (both written and verbal): Able to deliver effective presentations and storytelling capabilities to stakeholders at all levels. Capability to zoom in / zoom out, to provide the right level of detail, depending on the needs of the user.
Creative and critical thinking skills to shape BI strategy and plan.
Design Thinking is an asset.
Work Proficient in English, French is considered an asset.
Strong balance of leadership & BI & Data Analytics knowledge.
Able to build a strategy while leading/shaping a team of 6 individuals.
Behavioral Success Criteria:
Leaderships skills: Able to manage and get the best out of a team of diverse individuals and profiles from Marketeers, Computer programmers, Engineers, Data Scientists etc.
Effective at Managing senior stakeholders to ensure they are engaged, aligned and champion BI.
High EQ profile and coaching capabilities.
Drive for results, guarantee quality and critical thinking to improve ways of working and performance.
Able to work in fast paced environment, autonomously and work with ambiguity
High personal resilience, flexible and adaptable to be able to work in a constantly changing environment.
Positive attitude to deal with frequent challenge/adversity.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $129,000.00-$135,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental Care
Employee Assistance Program
Life Insurance
On-site Childcare
On-site Gym
On-site Parking
Paid Time Off
Work From Home
Experience:
leading a BI team and Data Science professionals: 8 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Location:
Montréal, QC (Required)
Language:
English (Required)
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Business Analyst - Business Intelligence & Analytics
Description:
On behalf of our client located in Winnipeg, Manitoba, we're looking for a Business Intelligence and Analytics consultant to provide expertise in requirements gathering, quality assurance, analysis, training and reporting on data analytics and reporting solutions. The consultant will contribute to health system optimization by generating and analyzing information that supports system improvement and value integration.
Qualifications:
(5) or more years of progressive responsibility and directly related work experience with analytical, reporting, and/or business intelligence
(5) or more years experience in decision support, informatics, analytics and business intelligence
(5) or more years experience working in an agile manner with stakeholders to gather business requirements, create wireframe solutions and translate requirements to developers
(5) or more years experience with data quality and/or system development testing
(5) or more years experience process mapping and creating standard operating procedures
(5) or more years experience in a healthcare environment, ICT, finance and/or supply chain
(5) or more years experience working with databases i.e. Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Access/Excel, SAS, SPSS, or other statistical software applications
(5) or more years experience working with ERP systems, SAP in particular
(5) or more years experience in LEAN, Six Sigma
(5) or more years experience in Project Management or Coordination
(5) or more years experience in Change Management
About Affinity:
Affinity is a full service Information Technology agency that takes a unique approach to recruiting. We believe recruiting is about creating long term relationships that foster a mutually beneficial partnership - an affinity. Bringing a new style of recruiting founded on four core principles – Transparency – Flexibility – Efficiency – Agility.
/

Experience : 5 - 10 Years

Title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence
Description:
If you believe in the same things we do, let’s talk.

We’re a financial cooperative that does things differently. That means we create innovative yet simple solutions to help people achieve their financial dreams and life goals. We make a difference by helping to build healthy communities. Our work environments will accelerate your personal and professional growth inspiring you to lead with courage. We strive to be an employer of choice in Canada, not just for what we do, but how we do it.

Exceed the limits of what you thought was possible and bring out your full potential. Inspire yourself with purpose and create new possibilities— for your future, for the lives of others and for the communities you’re part of.
We are seeking a Senior Manager, Enterprise Intelligence Solutions to join our
team.

COVID-19: We encourage and support employees whose responsibilities can be accomplished remotely to work from home. However, for certain positions employees are required to work out of one of our business locations—these instances are clearly outlined in the job posting details. Because the health and safety of our employees and members is our top priority, we’re taking proactive measures to ensure everyone working in a branch or office location is optimally protected.
We’re using digital platforms to conduct interviews by phone or video as opposed to in-person. Once an applicant commences employment with First West, they’ll participate in virtual training and onboarding. We also use tools that will help them stay connected and engaged in our supportive work environment. For more about our hiring practices through COVID-19, visit: https://www.firstwestcu.ca/recruitment-during-covid-19/

Position Overview
The Senior Manager, Enterprise Intelligence Solutions, oversees the delivery of complex analysis and management reporting which drives business performance and translates business strategy into tactical action plans. Using a consultancy approach, this position works closely with business units across the organization to understand specific business challenges and desired results, then uses fact based analysis, insights and recommendations to improve performance and reduce risk.
Here’s what would be included as a part of your typical day:
Key Accountabilities:
Business Problem Identification: Consults with internal clients to define business problems, identify information requirements and perform analysis required to gain actionable insights.
Projects: Leads analytical projects and directs the activities of analysts to understand specific drivers of business performance. Champions insight driven decisions, then works with cross-functional teams to drive tactical execution.
Business Performance Framework: Consults with senior management and department leaders in the design and implementation of ongoing performance measurement. This includes understanding the business challenges and determining what data needs to be analyzed to deliver on the desired results.
Management Reporting: Manages the intake and prioritization of management reporting and enterprise intelligence solutions. Ensures management reporting meets or exceeds the needs of the organization.
Presenting Results: Architects performance measurement solutions; works with the business to present complicated data in a streamlined fashion (e.g., dashboards). Facilitates purposeful and positive change to improve company performance.
Leadership: Coaches and mentors analysts – assists analysts as required; reviews results; prepares final presentations. Manages the performance and day-to-day coaching of direct reports.
Required Skills, Experience & Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Business, Information Technology or related Discipline
Master’s Degree Preferred
Eight years in Enterprise/Business Intelligence
Advanced analytics and problem solving skills
Advanced data modeling with SQL, R, Excel, Power BI or equivalent
Proven ability leading cross functional teams
Expert analytics and problem solving skills
Financial Services Industry experience
Proven ability to drive organizational change through the applications of data driven insights
Superior Business acumen, combined with advanced technical skills on how to apply information and analytics to solve business problems
Strong leadership to collaborate with the business, peers, other key stakeholders and team members on complex deliverables to develop and execute solutions effectively and on-time
Intellectual curiosity and the ability to identify new approaches to deliver relevant enterprise intelligence solutions
Expertise transforming stakeholder needs into Enterprise Intelligence Solutions
Knowledge of Performance Management methodologies and their implementation
Leadership (confidence, expertise and communication) skills to influence others to do things differently
Self-starter attitude with capability to effectively execute end to end deliverables
Expert level understanding of financial services and enterprise intelligence
Why work for us?
Our employees give us a lot and we think it’s only right to give something back. We offer a total rewards package that includes:
A competitive base salary plus performance-based incentive compensation and annual merit pay increases
Flexible benefits as well as retirement benefits
Vacation time, a flexible bonus day off every year, and the ability to purchase up to five additional flex days
Other financial perks such as waived or reduced financial service fees, reduced rates on personal loans, mortgages, and vehicle leases, and no-interest loans to buy computers or fitness equipment for home use
But most of all, we’re invested in our local communities. Our initiatives are far-reaching with a special focus on raising food, funds and awareness for our local food banks. We volunteer and employees can be provided with paid time off to volunteer their time to assist in serving an organization.
What’s your place in the First West story? Apply now and let’s find out together!
First West regrets that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Diversity & Inclusion
First West Credit Union is committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to create an inclusive, accessible environment for our candidates and employees that reflects the communities in which operate. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment or interview process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other types of accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Intelligence Solution Advisor
Description:
As a BI Solution Advisor, you will work with the customers and prospects to drive sales. We are looking for a highly energetic individual with a technical background and business/sales smarts to make Dundas customers successful with our product.
This position will give you the opportunity to work with customers around the globe and across all industries. You will get the chance to learn not only diverse technical skills but also about business intelligence, business analysis, project management, and will give you the possibility to learn how companies work as well as measure their performance.
Being part of a very dynamic and talented team who are go getters, you will get the opportunity to work on different areas in the company that might interest you. Dundas offers a great compensation and benefits packages which include free Goodlife gym membership, a health plan and much more.
In this role you will be responsible for:
Understanding and gathering requirements/challenges faced by our prospects and customers which hinders them from going to market sooner.
Prepare and deliver product pre-sales and post-sales demos/demonstrations.
Negotiate and help to drive the sales to close.
Advising customers during the development and/or delivery of integrated end-customer customer success programs for our product, services and/or solutions.
Periodically evaluate the effectiveness and evaluate our customers based on a predefined criterion.
This is a full-time position. Work would be done on site (at our Toronto, Ontario, Canada offices); therefore any potential candidate must be eligible to work in Canada.

About You
Your Experience and Skills:
Have a degree (or college certificate) in computer science combined with business courses or any other related field.
Ideally have 3+ years of experience as a consultant, sales engineer, or pre-sales solutions architect in the software industry.
High level of understanding of sales process, strategy and solution sales methodologies.
Strong presentation, communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to convey complex information to a broad audience.
You enjoy interacting with people and have great listening skills.
Results-driven work ethic coupled with a team-centric sensibility.
Flexibility to shift priorities, demands, and timelines.
3+ years experience with databases (SQL/MySQL, Oracle…) including writing simple queries and scripts, perform simple database administration tasks, and understand fundamental database principles.
2+ years experience with programing languages, ideally C#, JavaScript, HTML5, and JQuery.
Experience with any reporting tools such as Reporting Services, Crystal Reports, Excel, etc. will be a definite asset.
Familiar with the business intelligence industry will be a plus.
Some IT/Networking knowledge will be a plus.
Willing to learn new skills on a regular basis, both on and off the job.
Able to work well within a team yet be able to work autonomously.
Very accurate attention to detail.


Apply Now
Please send your resume via email to careers@dundas.com and reference “BI Solution Advisor” in the subject line. If you have any questions about this position or our company, please feel free to ask we will be more than glad to ensure you have the information you need.

Title: Développeur / Concepteur en Business Intelligence
Description:
Si vous consultez ce poste c’est que vous êtes à la recherche d’un emploi ou simplement attentif au marché ! À l’écoute d’une belle opportunité de carrière ? Nous avons peut-être votre futur défi professionnel !
R3D recrute pour son Studio un Développeur / Concepteur en Business Intelligence pour un mandat de 6 mois renouvelable situé au centre-ville de Montréal.

Venez rejoindre notre centre de développement situé en plein cœur de Montréal ! En plus d’offrir un environnement stimulant, nous souhaitons accueillir des gens passionnés et désireux d’apprendre.

Ce que nous vous proposons :
Un studio de développement jeune, dynamique et agile
Des bureaux tous neufs situés en plein cœur du centre-ville de Montréal
Une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (incluant café/jus à volonté et des fruits frais tous les lundis !)
L’opportunité de travailler sur des projets et des technos diverses et variées
Formation continue et gestion de carrière pour devenir un vrai champion du développement
Un club social pour faire une tonne d’activités (autant classiques que périlleuses)
La possibilité de faire du télétravail ou flexibilité des horaires
Et le plus important : une équipe incroyable !

Les talents et qualifications que vous devez posséder :
Leadership et sens de l’initiative
Travail d’équipe
Souci aigu du service à la clientèle
Habiletés relationnelles
Savoir communiquer efficacement
Gestion du changement
Habiletés de négociation
Connaissance de la plateforme BusinessObjects (Web Intelligence, Xcelsius, Crystal Reports, Universe Design, Administration et sécurité, Data Integrator)
Connaissance de l’ETL Informatica et/ou Datastage
Connaissance de la famille Windows
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles
Connaissance du développement de rapports (Reporting)
Connaissance de la création de tableaux de bords
Connaissance de la configuration de l’administration et sécurité
Connaissance de la création d’univers
Accompagnement client dans la définition des phases de cadrage

Les prochains défis que nous vous proposons, en tant que Développeur / concepteur en Business Intelligence :
Concevoir, documenter, développer et implanter les solutions techniques appropriées en fonction de l’architecture de l’information et des exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles
Mettre en place / améliorer les bonnes pratiques de développement et tests en solution BI
Passer en revue le code de programmation pour faire en sorte que les normes et les standards de développement soient respectés
Extraire des données des bases de données relationnelles telles que Oracle, Sybase, SQL Server, DB2
Effectuer le suivi du processus de tests unitaires afin de garantir la qualité des livrables
Assurer la qualité et la stabilité des systèmes BI mis en place. Effectuer, à cette fin, l’analyse détaillée, la conception, l’implantation ainsi que l’application de scénarios d’essais en plus du développement de tests automatisés afin de valider le bon fonctionnement
Coordonner les activités nécessaires afin de transférer les solutions BI développées en mode opérationnel
Collaborer aux divers projets / initiatives BI et intervenir dans l’entretien des composantes en production (amélioration de performances, résolution de problèmes)

Pourquoi vous joindre à R3D ?
R3D c’est plus de 500 experts techniques à travers le groupe qui œuvrent au sein de solutions techniques en mode services conseils ou projets Forfaitaires/Studio. Présentement en pleine croissance, nous souhaitons accueillir des gens passionnés pour nous appuyer dans notre évolution.

Vous souhaitez vous joindre à une équipe multidisciplinaire ? Nous avons une place pour vous dans l’une de nos « Tribus » ! Dans notre studio de développement, une panoplie de gens avec des parcours et expériences différentes seront là pour vous épauler et vous faire progresser dans votre cheminement. Vous aurez l’occasion d’exprimer vos idées, de baigner dans plusieurs environnements technologiques, d’apprendre et surtout d’évoluer.

Si vous vous retrouvez dans ces défis et notre environnement, alors envoyez-nous votre CV, nous avons hâte de vous connaître ! Et si jamais cette opportunité n’est pas faite pour vous, alors n’hésitez pas à nous référer à votre réseau, nous offrons des primes de référencement très intéressantes !

… parce que votre carrière nous tient à cœur !

R3D souscrit au principe d’équité en emploi et applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi pour les femmes, les autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques et les personnes handicapées.

Title: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Title:
System Analyst - Operational Technology (ID# 64-2020)
Who We Are:
Impala Canada is the only Canadian pure play palladium producer. Located in Northern Ontario, Lac des Iles Mine (LDI) features a world-class orebody consisting of an open pit and one of the largest underground mines in Canada. Mine operations are data driven, supported by the latest in mine technology and equipment, real-time mine management and automation. At LDI we employ over 580 of Canada’s best and brightest in their field. Driven to exceed, our people are motivated by a culture of safety in a positive and collaborative work environment. With a modern infrastructure, significant exploration portfolio and dedicated employees, Impala Canada is a well-positioned, low cost, long term, sustainable palladium producer.
Job Description:
As Lac des Iles continues invest in advanced operational technology, we are looking to expand our technical team and continuously improve our data management and analytics capabilities. This is a salaried position requiring a four days on three days off work schedule at the Lac des Iles mine site 90km north of Thunder Bay. Any candidates with an interest and required skills are encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement and support data acquisition systems, including real-time sensor historians and web-based business intelligence solutions.
Integrate and maintain multiple software platforms used to collect, aggregate and report business metrics using custom dashboards and reports.
Collaborate with the operational team to continually improve data-led decision making for production, quality and reliability.
Create and evaluate innovative ideas and technologies to help improve the way we do business.
Support the operational technology team in the maintenance of software and hardware infrastructure, including servers, switches, routers, firewalls and backup solutions.
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree or technical diploma in computer engineering, computer science or related field.
Strong understanding of, and experience with, business intelligence software and concepts, including the capture, extraction, analysis and reporting of data using a variety of tools such as SSRS, Power BI and Microsoft Excel.
Hands-on experience building analytical capabilities with software and IOT solutions including, SQL, Python, Pi, Windows Server, Hyper-V and Linux, or equivalent tools.
Ability to plan, organize and problem solve in complex and fast-paced environments.
Results oriented, resourceful, team player, with a mature and positive attitude.
Well-developed communicator with ability to articulate challenges and opportunities to non-technical personnel.
What's in it for You:
The position offers a competitive remuneration package consisting of base salary, health & medical insurance, retirement savings plan and travel allowance. Accommodations and meals are provided while at the mine site. On your off duty time enjoy various outdoor and indoor extracurricular activities.

Please note, that all job offers are conditional upon successful completion of a pre-employment medical which includes drug and alcohol testing.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please visit www.nap.com for more information regarding Lac des Iles Mines Ltd. Visit careers.nap.com to apply

Title: Specialist Business Intelligence Performance Measurement and...
Description:
Reporting to the Lead, Data Architecture, the Specialist, Business Intelligence is responsible for the planning, design, development and management of new and existing data warehouse and analytics solutions related to various PHSA programs and services. Applying a broad range of information technology experience, Data Warehousing (DW), Business Intelligence (BI), and clinical and operational knowledge, the Business Intelligence Specialist works with stakeholders to develop analytical products that meet their analytical, reporting, monitoring, surveillance and evaluation needs. This position plans, designs, and develops BI and analytical solutions, including data Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data marts, reports and dashboards as part of the overall PHSA Enterprise Data Warehouse. This position ensures the integrity and quality of the data accessible through these solutions, and also manages and maintains the metadata and other product documentations.
What you’ll do:
Architect and implement analytics solutions to develop, enhance and improve analytics and use of data at various PHSA programs and external stakeholders. This includes leading the design, development, documentation and implementation of complex data marts, multidimensional cubes or other semantic models, reports, dashboards and other front-end interfaces.
Architect and implement optimal database schemas and ETL solutions to integrate data from various source systems into integrated linked data marts. Collaborate with other members of the team on conceptual design, development, and implementation of the Enterprise Data Warehouse.
Lead the identification of new data sources and implements data extraction routines from departmental feeder systems. Provides advice and direction on data availability and quality. Consults and problem-solves with feeder departments regarding routine data extracts.
Participate in the development, definition and reporting of performance indicators as related to program operations, access and throughput, for use at the program director and executive level. Liaise on behalf of the agency with external consultants on the provisioning of patient specific data, as well as providing education on analysis and interpretation.
Provide technical expertise in the development of Analytics and Business Intelligence solutions by assessing client needs and requirements, reviewing technical options, determining the design and architecture and leading all levels of the solution development and deployment.
Ensure the designed solutions meet the established architectural, security, and quality standards set by the department by actively engaging peers and leads in design and review processes. Maintain current metadata, definitions and documentation of the solutions.
Maintain familiarity with the latest on-premises and cloud analytics technologies, and an awareness of current clinical and business information system trends and issues. Evaluate and recommend products or methods to deliver analytics and Business Intelligence in an accurate, timely and user friendly manner.
Mentor other developers and team members and provide technical and educational support to end users by developing training materials, delivering training sessions and training trainers.
Represent Performance Measurement & Reporting on committees at various levels with regard to data standards, appropriate usage, availability and quality.
What you bring:
A level of education, training, and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Health Information Science, Management Information Systems or a related field, plus 5 years of recent BI, data warehousing, data modelling or analytics experience. Strong understanding of health care system operations and public and population health concepts is definite asset.
Advanced knowledge, and experience in application of best practices of data standards, database design, data architecture and modelling.
Expertise in developing ETL solutions, relational and multi-dimensional databases and data marts.
Superior database querying, and query optimization skills using Structured Query Language -preferably T-SQL, MDX or DAX or equivalents.
Advanced knowledge of and experience with BI and visualizations tools such as Microsoft Power BI, and Tableau, and collaboration solutions such as SharePoint.
Proven hands-on experience with standard data warehousing and Business Intelligence tools such as Microsoft SQL Server, Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS), Reporting Services (SSRS), and related development tools and version control tools, or comparable technologies from other vendors.
Working knowledge of big data technologies, data science methods and languages such as (Python, R) and Windows and web application development tools and languages is an asset. High level of expertise in Microsoft Office suite of applications.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology with internal and external contacts.
Demonstrated ability to analyze operational problems and recommend innovative solutions.
Strong analytical, problem solving and system analysis skills including the ability to comprehend complex large scale health care environment operational issues and related data/information and present information in concise meaningful ways.
Customer focused with ability to facilitate and encourage cooperation between professionals from other disciplines.
Ability to understand management reporting and statistical concepts.
Ability to educate and lead management staff on the importance of using high quality data for decision making, via business intelligence tools and other means.
Self-directed and motivated to learn new tools and technology.
Ability to work independently with little direct supervision and as a member of a multi-disciplinary team.
Excellent time management skills with the ability to organize and prioritize work.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the job. Persistence and a positive attitude are essential given the iterative development cycle and sometimes problematic data integration issues.
What’s in it for you:
Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan.
12 annual statutory holidays with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.
Job type: Regular Full-Time
Number of positions: 3
Location: 1333 W. Broadway Vancouver, BC
Closing date: Open until positions are filled
Reference number: 90280
What we do:
PHSA plans, coordinates and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose. Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services.
PHSA is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Title: Head of Business Intelligence
Description:
Head of Business Intelligence
Our client is one of the fastest growing Canadian tech companies.
As a Head of Business Intelligence, you should have a vision for how BI helps move the company faster and make better business decisions. You will lead business/functional analysts, programmer/analysts, database/data warehouse administrators, and data stewards/functional owners. You will analyze data requirements, study complex source data, create the data model, and determine the best methods for extracting, transforming and loading the data into the data warehouse.
Requirements:
10+ years of overall experience with an emphasis on Business Intelligence, Data Modeling, ETL, and Analytics
4+ years demonstrated experience building, inspiring, leading and managing high performing teams
A proven track record of strategic thought leadership
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject
Ability to innovate new ways of managing, transforming and validating data
Create and enforce guidelines to ensure consistency, quality, and completeness of all data assets
Compensation:
Competitive base salary + package

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Job Duties and Responsibilities

Work with business clients, to understand their requirements, and produce functional specification documents
Follow Enterprise BI standards and policies through the development process
Create or enhance reports, dashboards, etc as per specification documents
Support testing by the Quality Assurance team
Support User Acceptance Testing process
Create documentation for future developers and support team
Work closely with ETL Programmers, QA Analysts and business clients, to resolve any and all requirement and specification issues as they arise. This includes root cause analysis, which may surface issues back in the ETL processes, data model or even requirements.
Front and back end programming is not a requirement, but may be required to assist with data analysis and testing, strong SQL skills are therefore required
Required Skills, Education, Knowledge and Experience

Solid understanding of the data warehousing end-to-end development life cycle
Strong SQL programming skills and solid understanding of relational databases and data architecture
3-5 years of experience as a business systems analyst in a business or information technology environment
Knowledge of at least one procedural language
Querying, Business Intelligence reporting and analytical tools
Some Unix experience is an asset
Strong communication (verbal/written) communication and presentation skills.
Be a self-motivated individual who takes pride in delivering high quality work and working as an integral part of a team
Thrive in a fast-paced, results oriented environment, and have worked within the structure of a large organization
University degree or college diploma
Equal Opportunity Employer

In our commitment to promote fair and equitable treatment of all employees and applicants, Adastra Corporation provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals regardless of age, sex, disability, race, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sexual orientation, marital status or any other ground as described in the Ontario Human Rights Code. Title: Business Intelligence Architect / Lead
Description:
Business Intelligence Architect/Lead

Provide architectural risk assessment and mitigation strategies

Drive BI tool recommendations

7+ years’ experience with data warehousing implementations and dimensional modelling
Solid understanding of the data warehousing end-to-end development life cycle
Strong SQL programming skills and solid understanding of relational databases and data architecture
Business Intelligence reporting and analytical tools
Knowledge of at least one procedural language
Strong communication (verbal/written) communication and presentation skills.
Some project management or team leadership background, although this is not a project management position
Some Unix experience is an asset
Be a self-motivated individual who takes pride in delivering high quality work and working as an integral part of a team
Thrive in a fast-paced, results oriented environment, and have worked within the structure of a large organization
University degree or college diploma

Title: Senior Project Manager, Business Intelligence

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Specialist
